There is the option of a night drive to spot giant turtles coming ashore and between June and November, there'll be the option of whale watching, too.

dayInfo.title: Full day in St Lucia, optional whale watching
dayInfo.description: : We'll get the chance to relax today with another day on the coast. Again, there'll be optional activities on offer, including whale watching (June to November) and turtle watching (November to March). There's also the option to join a boat trip on the St. Lucia River to spot hippos and crocodiles.

dayInfo.title: Drive to Durban airport where the trip ends
dayInfo.description: : Departing St Lucia this morning, we'll drive south along the coast to Durban's International Airport (DUR), aiming to arrive at around 2pm, where our trip ends. The earliest your flight can depart is 3pm. If you are taking an evening flight from Durban, it's possible to make a stop at Umhlanga Beach en route to the airport. The beach is just ten minutes from Durban city centre and boasts expansive golden sands stretching northwards of 200 kilometres/124 miles. There are plenty of restaurants and bars, as well as a shopping centre to pick up last-minute souvenirs.

tourName: Family horse riding holiday in South Africa
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Horizon Signature Lodge, Sotho village, daily horse riding, safaris or other activities including polocrosse
generalInfo:
A perfect holiday to experience Africa and relax together as a family whilst horse-riding through the bush alongside the Big 5. Great for novice riders through to the more experienced.

Activities for all the family and for the youngsters, much fun including polocrosse, western games, jumping and cross country, cattle mustering and swimming with their horse.

dayInfo.description: On arrival into Johannesburg you will be met and transferred to the Ants Nest (approx. 3 hours) in time for lunch. This lodge is where it all began. Lying in a natural amphitheatre, the original homestead, with its wide verandas, has a classic, relaxed African atmosphere. A wide variety of game frequents the watering hole in front of the bush home bringing game viewing to ones door step. The Main Lodges’ six bedrooms accommodate a maximum of twelve guests. There is a swimming pool in the garden, ideal for those needing some exercise or for purely cooling off after an active day and this is great for kids as its heated all year. Extensive lawns with indigenous plants surround the pool and there is a wonderful thatched chill out spot with vast sofa beds where one can relax during the heat of the day. Comfortable bedrooms located downstairs in the original homestead with en-suite bathroom, doors opening up onto a private veranda area with outside seating. Your first day finishes watching the sunset from a rocky outcrop. (L/D)

This morning you can choose your ride – this lodge is one of the earliest pioneers when it comes to offering horse safaris in Africa, successfully running them since 1996. Horses are their passion, and their incredibly dedicated and long-standing team ensure that the horses are as well looked after as well as the guests. The herd of over 90 horses live a blissful life on the private game reserve amongst the wildlife. With the horses seen as a normal part of daily life, the horse riding safari guests can get closer to wildlife than probably anywhere else in Africa. The private reserve offers an incredible diversity of terrain and scenery as well as wildlife, including many of the rarer species not easily observed elsewhere. Non-riding spouses, partners, friends and family can easily be catered for with a wide variety of other safari activities on offer. However, many guests learn to ride here and riding lessons are available. (B/L/D)

For those who might like more exercise, the guides can lead you through the bushveld on foot. These guided walking safaris are informative and interactive, enabling guests to gain a more intimate knowledge of the flora and fauna resident on the reserve. Learn to recognise tracks, find out the tell tale signs of male vs female in certain species, and even get up close with white rhino. Whether you choose to have a gentle stroll or a more energetic hike over the plains clambering up steep kloofs, a walking safari allows you to experience the sights, sounds and smells of the wilderness. (B/L/D)

Explore the reserve with your own guide in an open 4×4 game viewer, covering far more ground across the reserve and seeing up close over 40 species of animal and 300 species of resident and migrant birds. From giraffe to white rhino, sable and roan antelope, buffalo and zebra – there is a new sighting around every corner. Whether in the morning after a delicious homemade breakfast or in the afternoon ending with sundowners from spectacular viewpoints within the bush, a game drive is the unmissable amongst classic safari experiences. (B/L/D)

It is said that breakfast is the best meal of the day, and if it is in the bush that is certainly true! This morning is spent exploring the bush on horseback and tracking some of the many antelope, giraffe and white rhino that are resident here. (B/L/D)

A day out of the saddle will be a welcome break if you’re feeling a little sore today. Take a magical night game drive to search for elusive nocturnal animals, such as the rare brown hyena, aardvark, bushbaby and porcupine. If you are incredibly lucky you may have an exceptional sighting of a leopard. Or combine a game drive with a walking safari to enhance that sense of adventure and make photography even more exciting. (B/L/D)

Give your children a life-changing experience on safari in South Africa. With a selection of wonderful ponies suitable to both the novice and experienced child rider, they can have the chance to head out on horseback. Beginners can be led by a competent guide and riding lessons are also available. Children under 5 can be led on a pony in and around the lodge area. On guided bush walks they can learn about tracks, investigate bugs and experience the scale of the bush veld. Children are welcome on game drives and for when they are not out exploring, there is archery, fishing and swimming to occupy their free time. Special food and meal times can be arranged or alternatively families can dine together. Children 11 and under must be accompanied by a parent or responsible adult on activities. (B/L/D)
Included activities are horse riding, game drives and night drives, game walks, mountain biking, bush lunches and sundowners, fishing, air rifle and archery. (B/L/D)

After a wonderful week of riding, you can choose your favorite ride to repeat for the last time while you say goodbye to the horse you have shared your week with. Depart back to Johannesburg for your onward journey. (Lunch not included) (B)

tourName: Garden Route self drive holiday, South Africa
generalInfo: A trip perhaps for second time visitors to South Africa, or those wanting to get off the beaten track and self-immerse into the local culture.  This is a superb sample self drive itinerary starting in Cape Town, passing through the Karoo - with incredible scenery and tiny villages, along the Garden Route - with lots of opportunities for hiking, boat trips - and amazingly fresh seafood, as well as a little-known wine route - to the Eastern Cape's Sunshine Coast and Wild Coast.  Well off the beaten track, these last stops are areas begging to be explored, with picturesque villages, pristine white sand beaches, friendly locals, and scenic walks and hikes, fishing, kayaking, and sand boarding opportunities - as well as simple relaxation.

tourName: Garden Route tour and safari in South Africa
generalInfo: The Garden Route, the greatest road trip in South Africa, deserves an adventure to match. So, join this activity-packed itinerary for a showcase of its greatest experiences, handpicked by the local experts. You’ll discover the wonders of Cape Town and the glorious Cape Peninsula, ride the wine tram to legendary wine estates, marvel at mischievous meerkats, cruise the beautiful Knysna waterfront and hike through the dramatic landscapes of Tsitsikamma National Park. It ends with an unforgettable safari through the African bush, spotting beasts big and small with the help of an expert ranger.

dayInfo.description: Begin your adventure in cosmopolitan Cape Town, undeniably beautiful, culturally rich and a gateway to the Garden Route. Around 6pm, say howzit to your tour leader and fellow travellers, when we gather as a group for the first time to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. Your tour leader then ensures a big South African welcome by arranging a group dinner. Want to explore Cape Town further? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: City Lodge Hotel V&A Waterfront/Protea Hotel Cape Town Waterfront Breakwater Lodge (or similar) Upgrade to a room with a balcony today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Discover the wonders of Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula today. It starts with a driving tour around the city, our tour leader showing us the key landmarks, including the Castle of Good Hope, Grand Parade and St George’s Cathedral. We then head to the iconic Table Mountain, where we ascend to the top by cable car, weather permitting, for glorious views over Cape Town, Robben Island and the Twelve Apostles. After, drive to the Cape Peninsula, where we visit the Cape of Good Hope, a spectacular promontory jutting into the Atlantic, and take a funicular to the lighthouse. We visit Boulders Beach to see the penguins before returning to the hotel. Accommodation: City Lodge Hotel V&A Waterfront (or similar) Upgrade to a room with a balcony today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Depart Cape Town, taking the 2hr 20min coastal road to Hermanus, stopping en route at Harold Porter Botanical Gardens and Stony Point to view the resident African penguins. The beautiful seaside town of Hermanus offers some of the best shore-based whale watching in the world during the whale season (August to November), particularly of the southern right whale. Enjoy free time to explore and eat lunch, before returning to Cape Town. Accommodation: City Lodge Hotel V&A Waterfront (or similar) Upgrade to a room with a balcony today – speak to your sales representative for more details

We’re off to Franschhoek today (a 1hr 45min drive), labelled the wine capital of South Africa, to tour picturesque vineyards on the legendary wine tram. This hop-on, hop-off experience provides an entertaining and leisurely way to explore the Franschhoek Valley. The combination of tram and tram bus transports us around a loop, allowing the group to jump off at some of the oldest and most-distinguished wine estates in the world, while also discovering the history of the region and wine cultivation with two tastings. Accommodation: PH by Marriott Stellenbosch Dorpshuis and Spa (or similar) Upgrade to a suite today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Bid farewell to the Winelands and transfer (five hours) to one of South Africa’s greatest natural treasures: the Cango Caves. Formed over 20m years, this extensive complex of caverns is home to magnificent stalactites and stalagmites, which we learn all about from a local guide. After, we gather for an essential South African experience: a braai! It's as much a social occasion as it is a barbecue, with everyone coming together to enjoy each other's company, the beautiful scenery and a delicious meal. Accommodation: De Opstal Country Lodge (or similar)

Wake early this morning for our 6.15am transfer to Berluda Farm. Joined by a trained ranger, we head into the farm’s Klein Karoo landscape of arid semi-dessert to observe the resident meerkats as they forage and frolic around their burrows. Leaving the farm, we transfer (45 minutes) to Meiringspoort Waterfall, where a stream tumbles down a smooth rock face into a deep pool. Bring your swimwear, it may be possible to take a dip in the pool beneath the cascade. After, we continue (2hr 25min) to Knysna, where we spend the next two nights. Accommodation: aha Rex Hotel (or similar)

Enjoy a morning at leisure, with the opportunity to book optional activities, such as zip lining, quad biking or a monster scooter tour. At midday, we leave the hotel and board the Featherbed ferry for a 30-minute cruise along the scenic waterfront. Our journey takes us to the Featherbed Nature Reserve, where we ride a 4x4 to spectacular viewpoints and learn all about the local history, flora and fauna from a specialist guide. You can also join an optional guided walk (1.2mi/2km) through coastal forest, fynbos and ancient sea caves. After, we enjoy a delicious buffet lunch under a canopy of milkwood trees. Returning to Knysna Waterfront, take time to explore, enjoying the mix of leisure, shopping and dining activities, before heading back to the hotel for a relaxing evening. Accommodation: aha Rex Hotel (or similar)

After breakfast, we transfer (three hours) to Gqeberha (Port Elizabeth). Along the way, we visit Bloukrans Bridge (home to the highest commercially operated bungy jump in the world) and Tsitsikamma National Park, where we visit Storms River Mouth (weather permitting), the end point of the Garden Route. Accommodation: The Kelway Hotel (or similar) Upgrade to a larger room today – speak to your sales representative for more details

Spend your final full day in South Africa exploring Amakhala Game Reserve, riding an open Land Rover in search for iconic safari animals. We’re joined by an experienced game ranger, who knows all the animals’ favourite hiding spots, with the chance to see wildebeest, cheetahs, giraffes, zebras and antelopes. After returning to the hotel to refresh, we head out together for a farewell dinner, the ideal opportunity to recount tales from the adventure. Accommodation: The Kelway Hotel (or similar) Upgrade to a larger room today – speak to your sales representative for more details

The adventure ends today, and we begin our return journeys home. If you have time to linger, consider joining a morning safari in Schotia Game Reserve. Alternatively, if you’d like to extend your adventure, speak to your sales representative to discuss our large range of extension options.

tourName: Garden Route tour, South Africa
placesVisited: Cape Town, Stellenbosch, Oudtshoorn, Guided tour of Cango Caves, Tsitsikamma National Park, Plettenberg Bay, Addo Elephant National Park, Port Elizabeth, Optional activities include: wine tasting, visit to an ostrich farm, bungee jumping, canopy tours, zip-ling, blackwater tubing and numerous nature walks
generalInfo:
There are just some scenic stretches, around the world, that really need to be seen, first-hand, to truly be believed. South Africa's Garden Route is one such 'must do' road trip destination, and this week-long tour provides every opportunity to find out why.

Starting out in Cape Town you'll instantly be transported to some of South Africa's best-loved sites with the wine regions around Stellenbosch one of this tour's historic and naturally appealing highlights. An ostrich farm awaits in Oudtshoorn before you drive through the Outeniqua Mountains after a guided tour of the captivating Cango caves. Plettenberg Bay provides accommodation for the night – no camping on this tour – with plenty of optional activities to allow you to stretch your legs by the seaside.

Tsitsikamma National Park tickles the toes next with a wonderful waterfall trail complementing more optional activities including everything from canopy tours and nature walks to black water tubing, bungee jumping and zip-ling.

If it's elephants that you're after on the Garden Route then the penultimate day of this seven day tour will turn those big eared dreams into reality as you enter Addo Elephant National Park.

Wildlife watching from our elevated travelling truck provides a superior vantage point for game drives, with one final game walk on Day 7 offering a chance to bid farewell to the animals prior to transferring to our final destination, Port Elizabeth, where our tour comes to a close.

Throughout this tour you'll be travelling as part of a small group and invited to take part in several optional activities along the Garden Route. Being able to pick and choose what you want to take part in is perfect for accommodating all budgets and giving travellers the chance to take things at their own pace. The itinerary below has been designed with a range of optional activities included. We recommend booking these activities in advance so as to ensure availability and to help our guides plan the tour structure accordingly. Please get in touch if you need any further details or prices.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Cape Town Your tour starts with your arrival at Cape Town International Airport, from where you are transferred to your accommodation. This will be in the form of either a comfortable, high-quality backpacker lodge, or a more luxurious deluxe guesthouse or boutique hotel, depending on your choice. You will be free to spend the rest of the day, as well as the next day, exploring Cape Town on your own. Included activities

Free DAY in Cape Town This is your chance to experience the sights and sounds of Cape Town with 2 free days in the famous Mother City. Home to many important historical landmarks, as well some gorgeous natural sites, Cape Town has so much to offer. Table Mountain, Signal Hill, Robben Island, Hout Bay, Camps Bay, Clifton Beach, the V&A Waterfront, Constantia. You can fill your days or take them easy, as you prefer. We recommend taking a tour on the city sightseeing bus; alternatively, you can pre-book out a Cape Peninsula Tour or Cape Winelands Tour (joining with other travellers not on our trip). | OVERNIGHT
Free DAY in Cape Town You have another free day to explore Cape town today. | OVERNIGHT

Cape Coast- Hermanus, Betties Bay, Cape Agulhas, Shark Cage Diving The group joins together today as we follow the scenic Cape coastline. We depart Cape Town early, heading towards Hermanus. Guests who have chosen to do the shark cage diving activity depart separately and join up with the rest of the group later in the day. En-route to Hermanus, we make a stop at Betties Bay, where a marvelous sight awaits us
Route 62, Winery Stop, Ostrich Farm Today we travel along a famous route in South Africa

Wilderness National Park and Knysna We have an adventurous and exciting day ahead of us today. We begin by crossing the magnificent Outeniqua Mountain Pass into Wilderness National Park. We explore this beautiful landscape in a unique way- by paddling down the Touw River in canoes. This is a truly enchanting way to experience the beauty of the park, and our journey takes us through the forest, which is abundant with life. After our boating excursion, we enjoy a short 2km hike to a lovely waterfall and rock pool area. We then depart for Sedgefield, where the pristine beaches are perfect for rounding off the adventures of the day. Included activities

Knysna, Tsitsikamma National Park and Bloukrans Bridge Bungee Jump This morning, we will head to the famous town of Knysna via the beautiful Lake District of the Garden Route. Whilst in Knysna we'll visit the viewpoint, where we'll be rewarded with magnificent views of the Knysna River estuary and towards the Indian Ocean. Our next destination is Tsitsikamma National Park. En-route, we stop at the world-famous Bloukrans Bridge, the site of the highest bungee jump in the world. While the thrill-seekers in the group enjoy this must-do experience, the rest of us continue onwards to the park. Tsitsikamma National Park’s delightful combination of forest and unspoiled coastline provides a variety of activities for all. Go hiking and swimming, and cross an awesome suspension bridge across a river mouth. In the afternoon, we depart and head towards Addo. Included activities

Safari in Addo Elephant National Park, Transfer to Port Elizabeth Today is the last day of the tour, and what better way to spend it than on safari? We spend the morning exploring the vast wilderness of Addo Elephant National Park, home to an incredible diversity of wildlife species. The park is true to its name, and houses approximately 600 elephants. Also look out for zebra, kudu, eland, warthog, and, of course, the other members of the famous Big 5. After a 2-3 hour safari, we depart Addo and reach Port Elizabeth in the early afternoon. Those catching international flights will have ample time, as many depart in the early evening. Guests who wish to extend their stay may certainly do so. There is a number of options available- you can book extra nights in PE, at a lodge outside Addo, or even at a private game reserve. Please contact us for more information. Safari extension

tourName: Golfing in the Winelands of South Africa
generalInfo:
A golfing holiday in the Western Cape Winelands of South Africa is the ultimate experience for any golfer looking for a unique blend of challenging golf, breath-taking scenery, and cultural exploration. The 5-day tour includes visits to three of the most spectacular GEO certified golf estates in the area: Stellenbosch Golf Club, Pearl Valley, and Devondale. Each of these premier estates offer a unique golfing experience, set amidst the picturesque beauty of the Winelands. All three estates have state-of-the-art facilities that cater to the needs of golfers of all skill levels. So, whether you are a beginner or a seasoned pro, you are sure to have a great time.

Along with golf, the tour also offers the opportunity to explore the charming towns of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek, known for their rich history, colonial architecture, and renowned wine estates. Visitors can indulge in world-class cuisine, savour the best of South Africa's wines, and take leisurely strolls around the enchanting streets of these towns.

The tour promises a once-in-a-lifetime experience that will delight and inspire golfers of all skill levels while also offering the chance to discover the best of the Western Cape Winelands, both on and off the golf course.

dayInfo.description: DAY 1 of your golfing holiday starts with a trip from Cape Town International Airport to Oude Werf, where you will check-in to your hotel located in the heart of Stellenbosch. In the morning, you'll embark on a walking tour of the town, known for its quaint streets, historical architecture and stunning surroundings. The tour will give you an idea of what Stellenbosch has to offer. For lunch, Juvenate is an excellent option. This Mediterranean-style bistro boasts great food and atmosphere. After lunch, you can relax in the afternoon and explore the town at your leisure. Popular things to do in Stellenbosch include taking a stroll through the Stellenbosch University Botanical Garden or visiting local art galleries. For dinner, Coopmanhuijs, a fine dining restaurant located in a 300-year-old Cape Dutch building, is the perfect spot to end your day.

On DAY 2 you’ll be driven from Stellenbosch to Franschhoek. During the drive, you'll enjoy the scenic routes of the Cape Winelands, passing through wine farms and small towns. Once you arrive in Franschhoek, you'll begin the morning with a ride on the Franschhoek Wine Tram. The tram takes you through the lush wine region, allowing you to sample wines from various derivatives while learning about the history and culture of the area. For lunch, we suggest Reuben’s Restaurant in Franschhoek. Helmed by celebrated chef Reuben Riffel, the restaurant offers a relaxed and elegant atmosphere with a menu that features a variety of dishes made with locally sourced ingredients, many of which are grown in the restaurant's own garden. The restaurant also has a great wine selection that pairs well with the food, featuring wines from the surrounding wineries. After lunch, you'll head back to Stellenbosch for a round of golf at the prestigious Stellenbosch Golf Club. The 18-hole championship golf course was opened in 1922, making it the 4th oldest in South Africa. Over the years Stellenbosch Golf Club has hosted many significant tournaments, including the South African Open and the South African PGA Championship. It is known for its well-maintained fairways, fast greens and a variety of water hazards and bunkers. Without a doubt, a “must-play” for any golfing enthusiast! After completing your round of golf, you'll be transferred back to Oude Werf where you will have some time to freshen up and relax before dinner at the hotel's restaurant, making for an ideal conclusion to the day.

Start DAY 3 with a round of golf at the Devonvale Golf & Wine Estate. This Par 72 18-hole championship golf course measures 6 541 meters from the back, and is surrounded by rolling vineyards and majestic Simonsberg mountains. The curved layout features broad tree-lined fairways, large greens, and strategically placed bunkers and water hazards that provide a challenging yet fair test of golf. After your round of golf, you'll embark on a unique guided tour of Waterford Estate's 120-hectare vineyard in a safari vehicle, where you'll learn about what makes Waterford's wines so special. You'll also enjoy a wine tasting experience in the estate's tasting room, as well as a wine and chocolate pairing with light snacks. From Waterford you’ll be transported to your suite at the luxurious Pearl Valley Hotel. Situated on the award-winning Val de Vie Estate, the hotel overlooks the driving range, lake and surrounding mountain range, and offers top-notch amenities. For dinner, we suggest dining at the hotel's restaurant, which is known for its delicious food and great service. Overall, Day 3 offers a perfect blend of outdoor activities, relaxation, and gastronomy in spectacular surroundings!

DAY 4 kicks off with an art lover's dream experience! A private, guided tour will take you on a journey through stunning sculptures and gardens in the Winelands, showcasing the beauty of the region in an entirely different way. You will have the opportunity to explore and admire some of the most fascinating and unique sculptures and gardens in the region, including those that are not usually open to the public. After the tour, you will head back to Pearl Valley for a round of golf at the world-class Pearl Valley Golf Estate in the afternoon. Designed by renowned golfer and course architect, Jack Nicklaus, Pearl Valley it is often considered one of the best golf courses in South Africa. The course, set in the picturesque Franschhoek Valley, is well-known for its challenging layout. With a mix of holes that will test golfers of all skill levels, it features generous fairways, large undulating greens and strategic water hazards, which make for an exhilarating round of golf. The course's design is also notable for its natural beauty, which is accentuated by the surrounding vineyards and mountains. To end off the day, we suggest enjoying dinner at Le Bon Vivant in Franschhoek. The French-inspired restaurant is known for its delicious food, stylish décor, and excellent service. The menu features a wide range of classic French dishes made with locally sourced ingredients, as well as a great selection of wines from the region. This is the perfect place to relax and unwind before settling in for another night at the deluxe Pearl Valley Hotel.

On the last day of your holiday, DAY 5, you will be transferred from the Pearl Valley Hotel to Cape Town International Airport for your flight home. You’ll leave with wonderful memories and the hope of returning someday. Safe travels!

tourName: Horseback safari in South Africa
generalInfo:
Experience an exhilarating 10-day horseback adventure in South Africa, designed for both seasoned riders and beginners.

Begin with an invigorating gallop along the picturesque Noordhoek beach, enjoying a 2-night stay in Noordhoek on the Cape Peninsula. Journey through varied terrains, including fynbos and indigenous forests, during a 4-night horseback ride along the Walker Bay Trail.

Next, head to Pongola for an exciting 3-night stay, just north of KwaZulu-Natal, where you'll immerse yourself in horseback safaris and game drives, offering close encounters with Africa's wildlife in their natural habitat.

This adventure masterfully combines outdoor excitement with the stunning natural beauty of South Africa. Whether you seek a challenging experience or a serene ride through untouched wilderness, this journey offers the ideal escape for horse riding enthusiasts. Embrace breathtaking landscapes and unforgettable moments, creating lasting memories of South Africa's charm.

dayInfo.description: Your South African horse-riding holiday begins with a warm welcome at Cape Town International Airport, where a driver will take you to Noordhoek. You'll check in at the luxurious Granite Forest Chalet at Kinghorns Gardens, a secluded one-bedroom, double-story chalet perfect for two adults. It features indoor and outdoor bathrooms, a modern farm-style kitchen, and a sunset deck in a peaceful forest setting. The top floor offers stunning views, a queen-size bed, and a stone bath with views of the trees and sunset. A 65-inch flat screen TV with Netflix and a gas heater ensure comfort and entertainment. On Day 2, a driver from Hannival's Travel will pick you up and take you to Noordhoek Beach for a guided horseback tour with Horse Riding Cape Town. This relaxed walking tour allows you to fully enjoy the 8-kilometer stretch of pristine white sand and the Atlantic Ocean, with ample time to appreciate the natural scenery and birdlife. After the ride, you'll enjoy lunch at Monkey Valley's Thorfynns Restaurant, nestled among trees with ocean views. Your driver will then return you to your accommodation for a comfortable end to your day.

On day 3, you'll set off on the Walker Bay Trail, a four-day horseback adventure led by expert guides from the African Horse Company. The journey begins with a road transfer from Kinghorns Gardens to the picturesque White Water Farm in the heart of the Overberg region. Upon arrival, you'll enjoy a welcoming dinner, where you'll meet your fellow riders and guides, surrounded by the tranquil charm of this historic farm. The next morning (day 4), after a hearty breakfast at White Water Farm, you'll embark on a 4-hour ride along the pristine beaches of Walker Bay. Feel the exhilaration as you gallop along the sand with the ocean waves by your side. After a packed lunch amidst the coastal beauty, you'll return to White Water Farm for a relaxing dinner and an evening of camaraderie. On day 5, after another delicious breakfast, you'll set out on a 5-hour ride from the beach to the rugged hills of the Overberg. Transitioning from coastal paths to mountain trails, you'll experience the region's diverse landscapes. A leisurely lunch along the way provides a perfect pause before reaching Witkrans Farm, where a warm dinner and the farm's rustic ambiance await. The final leg of your adventure begins with breakfast at Witkrans Farm on day 6, followed by a challenging 7-hour ride from the mountains back to the beaches of Walker Bay. This ride offers breathtaking views and a deep connection with your horse. A midday break for lunch allows you to savor the last moments of your journey. The day concludes with a final dinner at White Water Farm, where you'll spend the night before continuing on to the next phase of your adventure.

Today, you'll bid farewell to White Water Farm and catch a flight from Cape Town International Airport to Durban. From there, a scenic 4-hour drive will bring you to Pakamisa Lodge, nestled on the Pakamisa Mountain plateau in the heart of Zululand. The lodge offers breathtaking views of the Pongola River valleys and the Reserve's rolling hills. With its unique blend of Spanish architecture and African ambiance, Pakamisa Lodge is home to 29 Arabian and Boerperd horses, lovingly cared for by the owner, Isabella. Upon arrival, settle into your spacious suite before heading out on a guided bush walk with experienced rangers. During the walk, you'll explore the reserve's diverse flora and fauna and may encounter giraffes, zebras, wildebeests, impalas, and warthogs. During your stay, you'll enjoy both horseback safaris and game drives. The horseback safari, which is suitable for all riding levels, takes you on a 2-hour journey through the lodge's private 2,500-hectare reserve. As you ride, you'll have the opportunity to see a variety of wildlife, including elephants, buffalos, leopards, hyenas, cheetahs, and rhinos, all against the backdrop of stunning mountain, valley, and plain views. Lunch breaks at the lodge provide a pleasant interlude. Alternatively, you can opt for a game drive, where you'll explore the reserve in an open safari vehicle, guided by knowledgeable experts. Spend 3 hours in the morning and afternoon observing and photographing wildlife, learning about their behavior, conservation efforts, and the region's rich history and culture. Night drives offer a chance to spot nocturnal animals such as owls, jackals, porcupines, and bush babies. Dining at Pakamisa is a culinary experience to savor. The award-winning El Prado restaurant offers a diverse range of cuisines, while the outdoor area provides a relaxed setting for a South African braai or bush dinner under the stars. The outdoor fireplace invites you to unwind with conversation and stargazing, making for a memorable African evening.

Today marks the final day of your horseback safari holiday and the culmination of an incredible journey. As you depart from Pakamisa Lodge and head towards King Shaka Airport you'll have one last chance to take in the spectacular South African wilderness. Your heart filled with lasting memories you’ll board your flight back home, already planning your next incredible adventure in our beautiful country. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

tourName: Hwange NP safari and rail holiday, Zimbabwe
generalInfo:
Zimbabwe's National Parks are home to abundant wildlife and offer superb safari experiences. The landscapes of Zimbabwe are varied and striking, including the Zambezi River, Victoria Falls, and the ancient rock formations of the Matopo Hills.

Hwange National Park, situated at an elevation of 5,000 feet, is a truly remarkable destination. The park is home to resident prides of lions, vast herds of elephants, numerous species of antelope, and rhinos, offering visitors a chance to experience some of Africa's most iconic wildlife in their natural habitat. Its diverse landscapes and rich biodiversity make it a must-visit for nature enthusiasts and wildlife photographers alike.

Imagine combining the awe-inspiring Hwange National Park with a captivating three-day, four-night sleeper train journey. After visiting the majestic Victoria Falls, you'll board the renowned Rovos Rail and begin your leisurely journey south and west, winding your way towards Bulawayo and Messina. The train travels through the very park you’ve just explored, offering an extraordinary opportunity to glimpse Africa's wilderness from the comfort of your private compartment or the elegant restaurant car. This unique voyage allows you to experience the best of both worlds—an unforgettable safari adventure and the luxury of train travel through the heart of Zimbabwe.

dayInfo.description: Your flight from Johannesburg International Airport arrives at Victoria Falls. Make your way through immigration and find your safari guide outside the terminal and the vehicle will take you to the Gorges Lodge for your first overnight. The Gorges Lodges is ‘glued’ to the edge of the cliffs over the Zambezi River below. A drop of 400 metres down is right off your balcony, and this dramatic setting is the backdrop of your meals, drinks, dawn and sunset. This first evening after a long-haul flight to get here, we’ll take it easy and let you enjoy the sunset over these jungle-covered plummeting facades. The communal bar is on the flight path of the famous Black Eagles that nest near the chalets on the cliffs, and they come close enough to make out their individual markings. Drinks and dinner are an informal and communal affair and the home-cooked food is tasty and plentiful. Retire to your balcony with a nightcap and get ready for the next day’s activities.

After a relaxed breakfast, a transfer will take you into Victoria Falls town. You are dropped off right at the entry of the Falls National Park, where you spend a few hours walking the various trails and tracks that give you all the angles of the falls and the boiling ravines below. Once you had your fill, exit the Park and meet your driver to cross the bridge to the Zambian side of the Falls. Here you have the option to have a rest and tea at a bar on the waterfront and by 2/3 PM, you enter the Mosi Oa Tunya National park. The smallest park in Africa, but with the largest creatures in it: you can visit the family of rhinos that lives here. And it is worth the effort to see these shy, vulnerable creatures, even if only for 15 minutes. After a drive through the lovely little Park, you are taken back across the bridge and have the chance for another stop at the iconic Victoria Falls Hotel. If you are interested in trains and history, then this is a must-do stop in your day. The breathtaking views of the bridge over the river are world-class. Eventually return to the Gorges Lodge by car, in time for dinner and drinks with the eagles and another night in the bush.

If brave enough, you can ask one of the Lodge guides to walk you down all the way to the river below. Beware – you must come up again as well. Especially in the hot season, it is best to do so in the morning. Relax around the lodge, have a cold dip and after lunch, you are taken into town again for a visit to the local art market. At 16:00 you are taken to the siding to board the Rovos steam train for a classic evening out. This train offers exclusive six-course meals while the train steams over the bridge and into Zimbabwe and all food, snacks, and drinks are included. The local expert on all things Zambia/Zimbabwe/Botswana, historian and author Dr Peter Jones will start the evening with an onboard lecture explaining the local geo-political history. And while you slowly chunter along over the tracks, a sumptuous dinner and matching wines are served. Around 21:00 you are back in the siding in Victoria Falls itself from where the transfer vehicle will take you back to the Gorges Lodge for a nightcap on the edges of the cliff. With the evening breeze coming up from the river deep below you cooling down your room above the escarpment it is a fitting end to a historic train ride in Africa.

After a leisurely breakfast, you will be transferred by vehicle to Hwange National Park and Bomani Lodge. Upon entering the park, your game drive will begin immediately. As the Land Rover climbs up and down dry riverbeds, traversing both forests and plains, it offers a captivating introduction to the diverse landscapes and wildlife of Hwange. This journey through the park will set the tone for your safari experience, providing an exciting first glimpse of the area’s natural beauty.

Today you have a full day inside Hwange National Park. Depending on the season, the recent sightings and your own wishes, a plan for the day is made with you and the guides. You may be keen to cover some more ground and see the various landscapes the park has to offer, with its different animals making their living in these habitats. Perhaps you are more into bird spotting and would like to stay put in a sheltered spot to see what feathered gems come by. Maybe all you want to do is watch elephant families drink and play around the water pans. Anything you like to do is taken into account and the day is yours. Lunch can either be a packed picnic in the park or a return to the lodge for a shady patio lunch and a rest during the hot hours. An afternoon game drive or village visit is always on offer.

This is your second day in the Park. A fantastic and unique way to see the wildlife from a very different angle is to plan a visit to the Underground Hide: a container has been sunk into the ground near a watering hole and in all safety, you can sit and watch the animals come to drink. The animals know there is a structure, but as you are inside, and hidden from their view this is one of the most natural settings to watch them come to drink. Another option for a more adventurous exploration of the bush is to go out on foot with the camp’s guides and learn about tracks, spotting smaller animals like birds, insects and rodents. See the different prints and scat left behind by visitors of the bush and feel the heat, dust and sand while walking through this landscape. Bushwalking is always done in single file, guided by 2 armed rangers and only when they deem the situation safe. If you are an experienced horseback rider, this is also a way to see the bush up close and away from the usual open cars. Lastly, dirt bikes are an option in the dry season to cover some ground: again this will be guided by expert rangers and only when safe. Whatever you do: your lunch can again be either a picnic in the park or enjoyed in the shade of the camp while you rest during the heat of midday.

This is your third full day in the park. Immerse youself wildlife of Hwange National Park. As usual at midday, take a break and enjoy a picnic lunch in the park, or relax in the shade of the camp as you rest during the heat of the day. In the evening you have your final game drive before the usual stunning dinner with the Bomani team.

Its time to leave Bomani and return to Victoria Falls. We reccomend game driving out and then changing vehicle and picking up speed to return to Victoria Falls. There is an option to fly this route. Check in to the Ilala Lodge in town.

It is time to board the Rovos Rail train. This extraordinary journey begins in Victoria Falls for your luxurious train journey through Zimbabwe's stunning landscapes. You steam back travel through Hwange National Park, and can have another game drive in this vast wildlife sanctuary. You'll be the expert now and be able to tell your fellow travelllers what to look out for. Continue through one of the world’s longest stretches of straight railway line, covering 114km, before heading south towards Bulawayo, the second-largest city in Zimbabwe and the capital of Matabeleland. Next, cross the Limpopo River and the Tropic of Capricorn, continuing on your way to Matobo National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Here, you’ll experience the awe-inspiring bushmen caves, rock art, and the dramatic granite hills, as well as the historic grave of Cecil John Rhodes atop Malindidzimu – the “hill of benevolent spirits” with a panoramic view of the world. As the train travels south, passing through Nylstroom (Modimolle) and Warmbaths (Bela-Bela), known for its mineral springs, make your way to Pretoria, where the journey ends.
After a wonderful night in the Southern Sun Hotel Pretoria (upgrades are possible) transfer to Johannesburg Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Kalahari rare mammals holiday, South Africa
placesVisited: Guided wildlife watching in Witsand Kalahari Reserve, Stay on working game ranches within the Kimberley region of the Kalahari, Anticipated wildlife includes: aardvarks, bat-eared foxes, spring hares, springboks, pangolins and duikers
generalInfo:
This is a great opportunity to join up with resident naturalists in South Africa and track down some of the Northern Cape's most elusive species including: aardvarks, aardwolves, bat-eared foxes, pangolins and black-footed cats.

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching and especially mammal watching safari holidays all over the world. To develop our range of fantastic mammal watching holidays we have spent years searching the world’s best wildlife watching locations as well as visiting some seldom visited areas. As a result we have created some great itineraries with the combined help of our guides, local experts and scientists (who have helped develop the itineraries) studying various rare mammals.

When it comes to wildlife watching there are very few better destinations than South Africa with the lesser-visited Kalahari region, in the northwest, being absolutely no exception.

The Kalahari Desert is one of the largest semi-arid regions in the world and home to a variety of birds and mammals including many of the continent’s rarest species. The region is sectioned into national parks, private reserves and working game ranches. The low density of humans allows for a greater abundance of wildlife and because the land is so arid there is little vegetation to support the huge numbers of large herbivores that dominate South Africa's better known national parks. Without the large herds of antelope, zebra and gazelles there are less large predators which has led to bigger numbers of bizarre and unique species such as: aardvarks, aardwolves, brown hyenas and elephant shrews.

The suggested tour below will be guided by our professional local guides. We also have a great network of local guides in South Africa who have developed a great range of wildlife watching locations where the rarest species are commonly seen. To make the most of our time away we will spend many hours during the early morning and late afternoon on jeep safaris and guided walks. We will also explore after dark with high powered spotlights in order to catch a glimpse of animals that only come out at night.

Best time to visit:

Early August to late October, which is the dry season in the Kalahari, is the best time to go for wildlife watching. Temperatures can get hot however, you will have the best chance of watching wildlife congregating around watering holes as well as less vegetation blocking the view.

Accommodation:

Most of the accommodation that we use are privately owned bed and breakfasts and working ranches that are seldom visited by tourists. Many of these ranches have resident animals which are very hard to see elsewhere. For example we know of a location where a family of aardvarks have been living for some years now and offer an exceptional opportunity to watch this elusive animal in the least intrusive way possible.

Fitness level required:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from 4x4 safari vehicle. We can also include guided walks which can be for as long or as short as you wish; it's entirely up to you.

Minimum age: 18

dayInfo.description: Witsand Kalahari Reserve – Travelling & Wildlife Watching – On your arrival into Upington airport you will meet your local guide and driver and taken to the Witsand Kalahari Reserve. You will probably arrive here in the late afternoon and so we will not have much time to see the local wildlife before dinner, but we can head out after dinner for some spotlighting. In the past aardvark, black-footed cats and pangolins have been seen here. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Witsand Kalahari Reserve – Wildlife Watching – Today will be a full days you will exploring the scrubland and bush of this reserve. This is a very good overview of the Kalahari ecosystem and there are many species of mammals and birds recorded from here. The large mammals that we shouldn’t miss here include the abundant the stunning gemsbok, springbok, red hartebeest, common duiker, steenbok and greater kudu. These grazers and browsers are the main diurnal mammals here but we will also search out ground squirrels, mole rats, elephant shrews and the very charismatic meerkats. The bird life here is also prolific and we will have a chance of finding some of the rarer species such as three species of sandgrouse, kori bustards, secretary birds and the tiny pygmy falcon. But the real focus of our tour comes after dark when ground pangolin, aardwolf, bat-eared fox, cape fox, genets, spring hares, African crested porcupine, black-footed cats and aardvarks are the top draw species. The ground pangolins have been studied here and we have enlisted the help of the researchers to find this very elusive species. So as long as the studies are still on going we will be able to get extra help in finding the unusual ground pangolin. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Marrick Game Farm – Travelling & Wildlife Watching – After breakfast this morning you will depart Witsand Kalahari Reserve and travel to Marrick Game Fame in the Kimberley region of the Kalahari. This large working ranch will be your base for the next few days and on arrival you will be able to head out into the farmland during the afternoon. Depending on the time of arrival you will have some safari time but even you have arrive late in the afternoon you will be taken out after dinner for some spotlighting. There is an aardvark burrow quite close to the main building and we should get some great views of this seldom seen animal, and being quite used to people here the individuals will come quite close to people (relatively for aardvarks anyway). Also around here during the night are aardwolves and bat-eared foxes which are quite common here. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Kimberely – Wildlife Watching – This morning you will have your first full day exploring the habitats here, the most commonly seen large species is the black wildebeest (endemic to the cape of South Africa they are a very unusual looking species. Also commonly seen here are giraffe, eland, gemsbok and the amazing tan coloured lynx like caracal. We will also be able to get out of the vehicle and search this area on foot. It is by exploring the habitat on foot that you will be able to see smaller mammals like rodents, elephant shrews, hedgehogs and reptiles. The birding is also very productive here during the day and with blue cranes that breed on the farm you should see these huge and beautiful species close up. Then after dinner you will be taken back out around here or to the nearby Benfontein Game Farm for spotlighting. Benfontein is very good for black-footed cats and we will be searching out this species as much as any other here. You will have another spotlighting session after dark around Marrick, looking for the aardvarks that are so famous here. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Kimberley – Wildlife Watching – Today we will travel from Marrick Game Farm to Mokala National Park, this is one of South Africa’s newest national parks and is home to both white and black rhinos, African buffalo, black wildebeest, klipspringer, blue wildebeest, common warthog, giraffe, mountain reedbuck, gemsbok, roan & sable antelopes, meerkat, Cape grey mongoose, slender mongoose, black-backed jackal and many other diurnal species. On the way to the park we will visit Kamfer’s Dam which is one of only 4 lesser flamingo breeding sites in the world. Then after dark we will have a night safari and look for brown hyena, Cape fox, African wild cat, caracal, small spotted genet, Southern African hedgehog and possibly aarvark too. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Mokala National Park Today we will spend the day exploring the Mokala National Park and try and find as many species as possible and also have another night drive. (breakfast, lunch and dinner included)

De Aar Game Farm This morning will be our last game drive around Mokala National Park before we leave and head to De Aar and the Karoo Experience. This rustic country house is set in the Karoo, another unique South African habitat and home to many species. The Karoo and Kalahari are very similar habitats and we will spend the afternoon and evening looking for wildlife. Many of the larger diurnal species will be the same as we have seen elsewhere but we have chosen these places to visit based on recent sightings of some of the more unusual species such as black-footed cats, aardvarks and possibly pangolins. So we will have a night safari as well to see if we can find any of these rarer species. We may also find Southern African hedgehog, Cape fox, red rock rabbits or smaller species like the very unusual elephant shrews that also inhabit this arid habitat. (breakfast, lunch and dinner included)

De Aar Game Farm Today we will spend the time exploring the property and surrounding countryside including visiting nearby parks, reserves and other known wildlife areas that have been researched by our local naturalist guide. We will come back to the Karoo Experience for our evening meal and last night in the Kalahari / Karoo of South Africa. (all meals included today)

Kimberley Today you will have one last morning game drive around De Aar game farm before departing for the town of Kimberley. You can either arrange your flight to depart from here in the late afternoon or evening today or we can arrange an overnight here for you. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home – Departure – if you did stay in Kimberley overnight on day nine you will be taken you will have to arrange your own airport transfer today.

tourName: Kalahari wildlife safari in South Africa
generalInfo:
Most people travel to South Africa for safaris only visit Kruger National Park, but South Africa has so much more to offer wildlife enthusiasts. This tour explores two of the little known gems of South African wildlife watching. Firstly we will visit the massive Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park, being twice the size of Kruger (about the size of Switzerland) it is one of the largest protected areas in the world and home to some of Africa's best wildlife. After the lions, leopards, cheetah, eland and other large mammals of Kgalagadi we will explore some of the Kalahari.

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching and especially mammal watching safari holidays all over the world. To develop our range of fantastic mammal watching holidays we have spent years searching the world’s best wildlife watching locations as well as visiting some seldom visited areas. As a result we have created some great itineraries with the combined help of our guides, local experts and scientists studying various rare mammals.

When it comes to wildlife watching there are very few better destinations than South Africa with the lesser-visited Kalahari region, in the northwest, being absolutely no exception.

The Kgalagadi Transfrontier National Park is one of the largest wilderness national parks in the world and is home to a variety of birds and mammals including many of the continent’s rarest species. As well as safaris through the park you will also be taken to private reserves in the Kalahari. One of the best reasons the wildlife watching is great here is due to the low density of humans in the whole Kalahari.

The suggested tour below will be guided by our professional zoologist (zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) or expert local guide. We also have a great network of local guides in South Africa who have developed a great range of wildlife watching locations where the rarest species are commonly seen. To make the most of our time away we will spend many hours during the early morning and late afternoon on jeep safaris and guided walks. We will also explore after dark with high powered spotlights in order to catch a glimpse of animals that only come out at night.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary). We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and game drives. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through South Africa (and elsewhere in Southern Africa). Your naturalist escort is an expert in wildlife biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. Whilst the trip involves a lot of camps, these are not pitch your own tent camping camps, instead these are luxury tented camps where the tents are permanent and you do not need to bring any camping equipment or sleeping bags with you. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the Kalahari wilderness, night safaris are available in some locations (subject to the local conditions on that day). You will have to speak to your guide on arrival there and book places on these (this is not included). A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist guides as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it. We do our best to include as many wildlife activities as possible in all of our itineraries.
• Depending on budget and interest we have a range of different accommodation packages to offer, from luxury top end lodges, national park safari lodges and mobile-camps which often offer unbelievable wildlife watching deep inside national parks as well as camping. We can also arrange mobile camping safaris of Botswana is very popular and all of your camping gear will be provided.
• Spend all the daylight hours searching for wildlife and visiting various natural wonders and stunning landscapes.
• All the above reasons give this, our South Africa wildlife safaris a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Southern Africa so that we can try and find and observe some of the rarer and more elusive species. We have great itineraries and expertise in all Southern African countries (Namibia, South Africa, Botswana, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi and Mozambique) and can arrange trips to find some of the rarer species such as aardvarks, aardwolves, brown hyenas and black-footed cats among other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Best time to visit:

Early August to late October, which is the dry season in the Kalahari, is the best time to go for wildlife watching. Temperatures can get hot however, you will have the best chance of watching wildlife congregating around watering holes as well as less vegetation blocking the view.

Fitness level required:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from 4x4 safari vehicle. We can also include guided walks which can be for as long or as short as you wish; it's entirely up to you.

Minimum age: 18

dayInfo.description: Kgalagadi Transfrontier National Park - Arrival Once you arrive at the airport in Upington (early arrival needed) you will meet your local guide and be transferred the 250km towards the enormous Kgalagadi Transfrontier National Park. This park borders South Africa, Namibia and Botswana and allows migrations to occur between different habitats and as a result there are large populations of animals here. But for today we will just check into the safari camp and relax with an evening meal before beginning to explore the park tomorrow. (dinner is the only meal included today).

Witsand Kalahari Reserve - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning you will be transferred south back towards Upington, but we will travel further to the Witsand Kalahari Reserve, this drive will take you through the mosaic of wild Kalahari habitat and private farmland. Once you arrive at the reserve and the chalet inside the rest of the day will be free for you to relax after the long drive down here. If you wish then after dark we can have a short night drive to try and find aardvarks, pangolins or black-footed cats. (breakfast and dinner included)

Kimberley - Travelling & Wildlife Watching After breakfast in Witsand we head for the town of Kimberley and more specifically our next wildlife location which is Marrick Game Farm. This will be our base for the next three nights. This pleasant working farm will be our base camp for the next few days. On our first night we will look for an aardvark, which has burrowed quite close to the lodge in the past and as a result had become fairly habituated towards humans, well as habituated as the usual elusive aardvark can get. During this evening excursion we might also encounter bat-eared fox and aardwolf, both of which are quite common here. (all meals included)

Upington - Wildlife Watching & Travelling This morning you will have a last chance for a short game drive in the early morning before breakfast. Then after breakfast you will be transferred back to Upington and your hotel; for your last night. You will check in and have the rest of the evening at your leisure. (breakfast only included).
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast only included)

tourName: Kitesurfing and houseboat holiday, South Africa
generalInfo:
Embark on an unforgettable three-day kite surfing adventure through the stunning landscapes of Langebaan, Cape Town, and Kraalbaai. Flying into Cape Town, you’ll be transferred to Kraalbaai Lifestyle Houseboats with Hannival's Tours to spend your first night surrounded by nature and tranquility.

The following day, you'll journey to Langebaan, a renowned destination for kite surfers, where you’ll stay in the cozy Boat Houses at Kraalbaai for two nights. These unique, well-appointed accommodations offer the perfect retreat, tucked away in the tranquil West Coast National Park.

The lagoon’s consistent winds and crystal-clear waters create the ideal setting for kite surfing, whether you're a beginner or a seasoned pro.During your time in Langebaan, take full advantage of the area’s natural beauty, enjoying thrilling sessions on the water or relaxing on the peaceful shores.

The surrounding landscapes of Kraalbaai, with its serene beaches and rugged coastline, provide a stunning backdrop for your kite surfing adventure.Conclude your trip with a return to Cape Town, where dramatic coastlines meet vibrant city culture. Explore iconic landmarks such as Table Mountain or simply soak in the lively atmosphere, with luxury accommodations offering the perfect retreat.

This combination of exciting kite surfing, breathtaking landscapes, and comfortable accommodations provides the ultimate getaway, immersing you in the best of Langebaan, Kraalbaai, and Cape Town.

dayInfo.description: Your journey begins with a warm welcome in Cape Town, where you’ll be collected by Hannival’s Tours and swept away from the city bustle, heading north along the coast. As the scenery shifts from urban skyline to wild coastline, you’ll be transported into the heart of the West Coast National Park—a place where time seems to slow down and nature takes center stage. Upon arrival, guests have the option to ease into the adventure with a peaceful stand-up paddleboarding session, gliding across calm, glassy waters surrounded by unspoiled beauty. Whether you're a seasoned paddler or simply seeking stillness, the lagoon offers the perfect introduction to this coastal escape. As the sun begins its descent, you'll be treated to a deeply restorative massage or holistic treatment with Monica, our trusted local therapist known for her intuitive, grounding touch. Let the golden hour settle over you as the stresses of travel melt away. When your soul feels as light as the breeze, you'll be transferred to your unique self-catering accommodation aboard the Kraalbaai Lifestyle Houseboats. Tucked gently into the lagoon, these floating homes offer a serene and unforgettable setting. Enjoy a quiet evening under a sky of stars, lulled to sleep by the soft rhythm of the water.

Wake to the gentle rocking of your Kraalbaai houseboat, with sunlight dancing on the lagoon and birdsong echoing over the still water. After a peaceful morning on deck, you’ll be whisked across the lagoon by small boat to begin your private 3-hour kitesurfing lesson with Constantly Kiting in nearby Langebaan. Whether you're a beginner or seasoned rider, expert instructors will guide you in mastering the wind, helping you glide confidently across the sparkling blue waters in one of South Africa’s most iconic kitesurfing destinations. After your thrilling session, settle in for a seafood feast at the famous Strandloper Restaurant, where the scent of the ocean mingles with smoky grills and laughter under the open sky. With toes in the sand and a plate full of fresh, local fare, soak in the laid-back charm of the West Coast. Return to your floating home for a tranquil evening—watch the sun dip below the horizon, or indulge in another sunset massage with Monica, the perfect ending to a day of wind, waves, and unforgettable flavors.

Start your day of adventure with a self-catered breakfast at the Kraalbaai houseboats, where you’ll enjoy a stunning sunrise over the tranquil waters and panoramic views of the surrounding wilderness. The morning light illuminates the bay, offering a serene beginning to your day. Once fueled for the day ahead, you’ll be whisked away by boat for an exhilarating kite surfing session, setting the tone for your adventure. Day 3 offers exciting opportunities for both beginners and advanced kite surfers. For the more advanced kite surfers, the day will be filled with challenging winds and expansive waters, allowing you to hone your skills and feel the thrill of the wind beneath your kite as you glide across the water. After an active day on the water, unwind at Kokomo Beach Bar, a laid-back seaside spot offering delicious seafood-inspired dishes. It’s the perfect place to enjoy a well-deserved meal while reflecting on the day’s adventures. The relaxed atmosphere and stunning views make it a memorable dining experience. After lunch, you will be transferred to Cape Town to continue your journey to new horizons.

tourName: Kruger & coast holiday in South Africa
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Nocturnal bush walk with the famous Black Mamba rangers, Safaris in Kruger National Park, Swaziland, Hlane Royal National Park, Visit a traditional Swazi village, Saint Lucia Estuary, Boat safari in search of hippos and crocodiles, Cape Vidal, Durban
generalInfo:
Sample the very best of South Africa and Swaziland on this fully escorted small group tour, as you travel from Johannesburg to Durban through Kruger National Park, Hlane Royal National Park and the wildlife-rich Saint Lucia Estuary. Your itinerary includes a couple of very special experiences: camping with the famous Black Mambas - the world's first all-female anti-poaching unit, and a boat safari with the chance to see hippos and crocodiles, a thrilling alternative to the traditional game drive.

Your first stop is a few days in the legendary Kruger National Park, home to some 150 species of mammal including the Big Five, 100 species of reptile and over 500 species of bird. But your first night here won’t be spent in a lodge or bush camp. Instead, you’ll stay at the HQ of the Black Mambas. This team of 36 young African women helps patrol the Balule Nature Reserve, part of Greater Kruger National Park, and as part of your introduction to their work, they’ll take you on a nighttime bush walk to help remove snares, and perhaps see some nocturnal wildlife.

After a day of game drives in Kruger, you’ll cross into Swaziland, and Hlane Royal National Park. Here you’ll be taken on a game walk with a brilliant Swazi guide to see huge herds of elephants and giraffes, with lions, leopards and hippos also present. After a night camping in the park you have the opportunity to visit a local village, unusual in that it has a female chief, to learn about Swazi culture and perhaps even lend a hand with some of the everyday farming activities.

Cross the border, then, back into South Africa, as your group makes for the Saint Lucia Estuary, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that provides habitat for hundreds of hippos and crocodiles. Two nights of camping here include a thrilling boat safari that offers a very different experience to traditional game drives, and a day trip to Cape Vidal. Depending on the time of year, you might spot migrating humpback whales off the coast, or see loggerhead turtles making the way up the beach to lay their eggs.

Finally reaching Durban, South Africa’s second city, bid farewell to your fellow travellers at this glamorous coastal destination.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg.
dayInfo.description: Sawubona! Welcome Johannesburg, the sprawling South African capital. In Joburg (unlike a lot of city nicknames, this is one people actually use) mansions stand alongside humble tin abodes and there are as many green parks on the outskirts of the city as there is concrete jungle in the centre. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm. If you can’t wait to begin exploring and arrive with time to spare, why not make your way to the Apartheid Museum and start your journey with some crucial history before you meet up with your group.

dayInfo.title: Greater Kruger National Park - Black Mambas HQ.
dayInfo.description: Rise and shine for a long day’s drive to the outskirts of Kruger National Park where you'll be lucky enough to camp for the evening at the Black Mambas headquarters. Our Foundation is proudly partnered with Helping Rhinos, who directly support the work of the Black Mambas - the world's first all-female anti-poaching unit. Made up of a team of 36 young African women, the Mambas patrol 20,000 hectares of the Balule Nature Reserve, part of Greater Kruger National Park. Turning a traditionally male-dominated industry on its head, they’re putting their female prowess to work protecting Kruger National Park's wildlife in an unconventional way. You'll join them on a bush walk to learn how they find and destroy snares firsthand. Enjoy a special dinner by lantern light and later, relax by the campfire with the Mambas as they share stories about their path to becoming a Black Mamba and conservation work.

dayInfo.title: Kruger National Park.
dayInfo.description: Wave goodbye to the Mambas and take a scenic drive along the famous Panorama Route through some of the most stunning scenery South Africa has to offer, such as Bourke’s Luck Potholes. In the evening, choose to relax at your camp, located in Kruger National Park, or perhaps head out on an optional night drive with the park guide. The optional night drives are a chance to spot nocturnal animals and perhaps even a night-time predator or two – maybe catch a lion or hyena out hunting, or perhaps an impala out in search of a late-night feed.

dayInfo.title: Kruger National Park.
dayInfo.description: Rise early and enjoy a light breakfast before heading out on 4x4 jeeps for a full-day game drive. Most of your day will be spent spotting game, birdwatching, and stopping at various waterholes and viewpoints to rest along the way. Kruger National Park is one of the largest National Parks in Southern Africa. It boasts over 500 bird species, 100 species of reptile and 150 mammal species, including the Big Five and the endangered African wild dog. Drive through some of Kruger’s prime game viewing areas on your way to camp and try to spot some of these amazing creatures straight away! Set up camp and get settled for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Hlane Royal National Park.
dayInfo.description: Start the day with a slow game drive through Kruger, covering between 20 and 70 kilometres (depending on what animals you see along the way) in the park then exiting by mid-morning. Hit the road towards Hlane Royal National Park. Travel south-east and cross the border into the kingdom of Eswatini, a country nestled between Mozambique, Northern Zululand and Mpumalanga. Arrive at Hlane Royal National Park, a vast expanse of bushveld with ancient hardwood trees, and begin exploring immediately on a guided game walk. The walking safari, led by a local guide, will give you the best understanding of how large and complex the ecosystem in this park is. With a professional ranger by your side, you’ll look out for animals like rhino, giraffe, and elephant while also searching for tiny creatures like snakes, spiders, and small mammals (don’t worry, there’s no lions in the section of the park where you’ll be walking). You’ll spend tonight at a camp within the national park.

dayInfo.title: Hlane Royal National Park.
dayInfo.description: Today you’ll have the opportunity to further explore Hlane Royal National Park at your leisure. You might like to book an optional 4x4 game drive within the park, where you can expect to see all kinds of animals like antelopes, elephants, zebras, rhinos, and lions. Guided by a local Swazi guide, these drives typically take 2-2.5hrs either in the early morning or late afternoon. Another optional activity for today is to visit the Hlane Umphakatsi (Chief Village) - a tour of the authentic living homestead and opportunity to discover the Swazi way of life. You'll learn more about the traditional culture here, get to know the locals and even get a chance to try your hand at day-to-day activities. You’ll discover how Umphakatsi is a special village since it is one of the few with a female Chief: Inkhosikati.

dayInfo.title: St Lucia Estuary .
dayInfo.description: Depart Hlane this morning and cross the border to Lake St Lucia, part of the St Lucia Estuary, stopping at a shop for supplies along the way. Declared a World Heritage Site in 1999, St Lucia Estuary is home to thousands of varieties of birds, mammals and reptiles, including hundreds of hippos and crocodiles. On arrival at camp, jump onboard a Hippo Boat Safari which offers a different perspective to traditional Game viewing with the chance to spot creatures cruising down the estuary, or basking on the banks.

dayInfo.title: St Lucia Estuary.
dayInfo.description: We'll take a day trip to Cape Vidal today for some time by the sand in the sun. Cape Vidal lies within the iSimangaliso Wetland Park World Heritage Site and sits on the exquisite Zululand coast – home to a rich array of marine life. This area is visited seasonally by humpback whales during their migrations, as well as loggerhead and leatherback sea turtles that come to the beaches north of Cape Vidal from November to February to nest. You can spend the day relaxing on the beach or speak to your leader about booking some of the optional activities in the area. You’ll head back to your camp at Lake St Lucia this afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Durban.
dayInfo.description: Continue to Durban after breakfast today. With no activities or accommodation planned, your adventure comes to an end on arrival today. Durban is South Africa's second most populous city, boasting sandy beaches and a glitzy nightlife – a great place to extend your stay and enjoy some leisure time. Perhaps take the opportunity for a final dinner with your fellow travellers this evening.

tourName: Kruger National Park Safari, South Africa
placesVisited: Eight full days in Kruger National Park, Morning guided walks, Sunrise safaris by Jeep, Nocturnal spotlight drives, Three separate safari camp locations, Animals you can expect to see: rhinos, cheetahs, leopards, giraffes, klipspringers, kudu, spotted hyenas, scarlet-chested sunbirds, Heuglin’s robins, hippopotami, lions, goliath herons, giant kingfishers and Nile crocodiles
generalInfo:
Travel to Africa's safari heaven in the company of expert local guides as you track down the Big Five on foot and by 4x4 vehicle. This 11 day tailor made tour offers a chance to immerse yourself within the landscapes and animals of Kruger National Park.

There is nowhere else better in South Africa for safaris than Kruger National Park. This park was one of the world's first national parks (established in 1898) and is still currently one of the largest, covering over 20,000 km2.

The number of species present in Kruger is mind blowing: 336 trees, 49 fish, 34 amphibians, 114 reptiles, 507 birds and 147 mammals. During this tour we will try and see as many species as possible, concentrating, in the main, on mammals, such as: lions, leopards, cheetahs, elephants, rhinos and hippos, as well as ostriches and Nile crocodiles. Our escort for this tour has experience working in South Africa as well as other national parks around the world. We also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through Kruger National Park. We also make the most of the expert guides that work for the park and head out on guided sunrise and sunset walks and spotlighting after dark. Coupled with full days spent driving in a 4x4 safari vehicle, this is the best way to experience Kruger in all its natural glory.

Even though Kruger is open all year there are some seasons that prove better for wildlife watching than others. Summer (Nov – Jan) is the rainy season where water fills the rivers and watering holes, resulting in the bushveld looking lush. Game viewing is sometimes a bit more difficult at this time because the vegetation is dense, making it bit harder to locate and observe wildlife. Towards the end of November and early December, Kruger National Park is filled with newborns, and spotting wildlife with their young is an incredibly rewarding experience. Birding is excellent during this time as the summer migrant birds arrive. However, it can get very hot during the day. The best time for wildlife watching is during the winter and spring (Jul – Oct). The bushveld is more open, allowing for better visibility. The grass is low, the bushes and trees are sparsely leaved and because it is so dry - with no rain - the wildlife migrate towards the water.
