There is also the option to take the aerial cable car to the top, which runs frequently to and from the summit, where a network of trails criss-crosses the plateau and provides a variety of vantage points. While it's possible to visit Robben Island and take the cable car to Table Mountain in the same day, you won't have time to visit Robben Island and hike up Table Mountain. If you'd like to do both, you can book a pre-trip stay to give yourself more time. Please also note that both of these activities are weather-dependent and windy weather may change things. Table Mountain's cableway is closed for two weeks at the end of July for maintenance. Another option is to take a trip to the Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens, which claims to be the most beautiful garden in Africa and is devoted to the conservation of the Cape's indigenous species. Your Tour Leader will be able to give further local advice and recommendations on how to spend your time in Cape Town. Late this afternoon, we'll leave Cape Town and head to the scenic winelands of Stellenbosch where you can relax with a local Chenin Blanc.

dayInfo.title: Free morning in Stellenbosch and winetasting at a local vineyard
dayInfo.description: : There are no set plans for this morning, so you are free to explore Stellenbosch at your leisure. Consider visiting the University Botanical Gardens to learn about native plants, going curio shopping, or browsing the various galleries scattered throughout the town. Stellenbosch is world-famous for its wine, and there's no better way to experience this than by visiting one of the many vineyards in the area, which is exactly what we will do in the afternoon. Depending on the season, your Tour Leader will select a suitable vineyard where we can sample several local wines while immersing ourselves in the unique South African wine culture. Many of the estates feature spectacular gardens and farmland, providing opportunities for lunch and a leisurely stroll. There is also the option to take a guided tour of Stellenbosch Town, a great way to learn about the diverse cultures that have contributed to making Stellenbosch what it is today. As one of the oldest colonial settlements, this charming town boasts wide, oak-lined streets and beautiful whitewashed Cape Dutch architecture. You'll find many cafes, bars, and delis for lunch, most of which pride themselves on using local produce.

dayInfo.title: Travel to Hermanus via Stony Point's African Penguin Colony
dayInfo.description: : This morning we make our way down to Hermanus, on the coast. A 90-minute drive takes us to the Betty's Bay area where we'll have an included visit to Stony Point Nature Reserve. This reserve sits on the site of a historic whaling station and has a quiet, undiscovered feel, offering excellent penguin viewing without the crowds. The path can be followed over the craggy outcrops to see the resident seabirds up close without disturbing them. We then continue to our accommodation in central Hermanus. This afternoon is free to explore the coastal town. From June to November, Hermanus offers some of the world's best shore-based whale watching, with good opportunities to spot southern right, Bryde's and humpback whales. Although there is a good chance of seeing the whales from the water's edge in town, you may prefer to follow the coastal path to a better vantage point or join a boat trip excursion for a closer view. At other times of the year, you might like to spend the day exploring the galleries and museums in Hermanus, which are easy to discover on foot, or enjoying the coastal views from the 8km walking path that runs right along the cliff edge. This evening will be at your leisure, with a variety of excellent restaurants and wine bars to discover.

dayInfo.title: Visit Cape Agulhas. Spend the night in Barrydale
dayInfo.description: : A 90-minute drive takes us to the southernmost point of the African continent this morning, where we see the Atlantic Ocean and the Indian Ocean meeting in a crash of waves. Now marked by a stone plaque, the 'Cape of Needles' was once the site of various shipwrecks and a grave point of danger for European travellers. We'll have a little free time to explore the magnificent monument. This afternoon, we continue towards Barrydale on the renowned Route 62 (one of the longest wine routes in the world). The Tradouw Pass (which means Women's Pass in the old Khoi language) is a 16 kilometre/10 mile-long drive, offering some of the most beautiful and rugged scenery in this region of South Africa. Barrydale is a scenic little place with the air of a Wild West frontier town about it. We'll stop here to break up our long drive to Oudtshoorn. If you have any time this evening or tomorrow morning, a walk around the backstreets reveals a couple of small art shops and some beautiful scenery. We have an included dinner tonight - local restaurants here have a big lunch trade but close around 5pm, so we'll enjoy some local food at our small hotel. The total drive time today from Hermanus is approximately five hours

dayInfo.title: Continue to Oudtshoorn in the Klein Karoo, ostrich capital of the world; visit the Cango Caves
dayInfo.description: : After a late start in Barrydale, we continue our journey for around two hours to Oudtshoorn, driving past open farmland and winelands. This seemingly empty plain is in fact home to vast numbers of ostrich, and we'll likely spot them in the farms that run alongside Route 62 as we drive. Oudtshoorn is the principal town in the Klein Karoo, which grew in the early 1900s thanks to its rich trade in ostrich feathers. We may have time to have a quick explore of the shops and the small curio museum before driving onto the huge limestone caverns of the Cango Caves. These caves are an underground network of extraordinary structures, millions of years old. The combination of dripping rainwater and limestone has led to the creation of ancient stalactites, stalagmites, and mighty rock columns. Allegedly, a local European farmer first discovered the caves late in the 18th century; however, there is research that proves the caves have been used by man as far back as the early Stone Age. After a visit to the caves, we drive on to our countryside lodgings for the evening

dayInfo.title: Take a beach walk with a guide from the Strandloper Project; admire the views at the Knysna Heads
dayInfo.description: : Today we make our way back down to the coast and the start of the Garden Route proper, driving south through the town of George towards the ocean. At the small town of Sedgefield we'll stop at Swartvlei Beach where we'll have about an hour's walk along the wild and scenic coast with a guide from the Strandloper Project. This small project began in 2018 when a group of locals decided to organise a reef clean up to tackle the threats posed to the reef and native marine wildlife, from discarded fishing tackle. The project has expanded onto the land, and the volunteers now use microplastic collection data from the beach to lobby regional councils about their plastic waste. The walk on the beach is spectacular, and we'll learn not just about the project but also about the surrounding environment. After our visit here we continue our drive to Knysna Heads Viewpoint, where two limestone cliffs emerge from the Indian Ocean, side by side, protecting a lagoon that runs inland from the turbulent sea. We'll end the day in Plettenberg Bay, on the Indian Ocean. Today's total drive time is approximately three hours.

dayInfo.title: Discover Robberg Nature Reserve. Free afternoon in Plettenberg Bay
dayInfo.description: : Today we take a short drive to Robberg Nature Reserve, a World Heritage Site, where our Tour Leader will lead a walk along the trails. The hiking here is moderately graded, and good stability and fitness are both essential. Rewards for tackling the rocky terrain, sand dunes and occasional steep steps are great - sweeping coastal views, beautiful golden sands, and the possibility to spot dolphins and seals playing in the waters below. From July to December there's also the chance to spot the southern right whales that come into the calmer and warmer waters to calve and nurse their young. For those who don't want to undertake the 5.5km loop with the Tour Leader, there is a shorter 2km loop, or you could simply enjoy the fantastic views from the clifftops. After working up an appetite, we'll stop for a well-deserved lunch in Plettenberg Bay. Seafood is a favourite on the menu here - hake, meaty prawns or calamari washed down with a crisp white wine. Afterwards, the afternoon is free with the option to relax on the beach, shop for souvenirs or join a whale-watching excursion (in season).

dayInfo.title: Walk, kayak or discover the tree canopy at Tsitsikamma National Park
dayInfo.description: : The wild coast of Tsitsikamma National Park awaits today, around a 45-minute drive away. Another hotspot for seasonal whale watching, the national park covers both land and sea, protecting important forest and marine areas, and offering stunning coastal views. We'll be staying in the Storms River region. Timings today may vary depending on a number of factors, but there is the opportunity here to take a short but steeply-stepped walk to a series of three suspension bridges that overlook the mouth of Storms River as it reaches the sea. You may also like to try your hand at zip wiring (a short drive out of the national park), or an adventurous river kayaking trip up the Storms River (this involves a walk of approximately 20 minutes carrying your paddle, jacket and helmet - it's a stunning river paddle but not a leisurely activity!) Tonight we'll be staying in simply furnished chalets set either amongst the forest, or on the clifftop.

dayInfo.title: Experience a game drive at Addo Elephant National Park
dayInfo.description: : We'll leave the Tsitsikamma area this morning for another of South Africa's national parks. It's a long drive of approximately three hours plus stops. Home to more than 600 elephants as well as lions, hyenas and Cape buffalos, Addo Elephant National Park is our last national park of the trip. On arrival, we'll swap into one of the park's safari trucks - perfect for the terrain and for capturing great wildlife shots - for a two-hour game drive with a park guide. Warthogs are abundant here, along with various species of antelope, zebra and of course elephant. After our game drive, we'll make our way to our accommodation, which is located 20 minutes outside Addo Elephant National Park. Often our hosts here at the small, family-run property will treat us to a proper South African braai this evening, a fitting end to your Garden Route journey.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends at Addo Elephant Park
dayInfo.description: : Our trip ends after breakfast at our accommodation near Addo Elephant National Park. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to depart from Addo at any time. Check-out from our accommodation is at 10am. If you'd like a transfer today, you'll need to depart from Port Elizabeth International Airport (PLZ), which is a one-hour drive from Addo.

tourName: South Africa holiday, Cape Town to Kruger
placesVisited: Cape Town, Table Mountain, Kruger National Park, Sabi Sands, Zambezi River, Victoria Falls
generalInfo:
This 10-day Southern Africa holiday offers the opportunity to see the highlights of southern Africa, such vibrant Cape Town, Kruger National Park (one of the best wildlife destinations on the continent) and the thundering power of Victoria Falls.

Visit the spectacular Cape Peninsula for epic views and the Cape Winelands for rural beauty and wine-tasting experiences. Next, head for the Sabi Sand Game Reserve in the Greater Kruger region for safari. Your last destination is one of Africa’s most iconic sites, Victoria Falls. Explore this iconic waterfall and its surrounding areas through scenic hikes and helicopter rides.

From the spirited city of Cape Town to valleys of vineyards to game drives in the world-famous Kruger National Park, Southern Africa has so much to offer travellers, that you’ll find it difficult to leave.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Cape Town - Upon arrival in the city, you’ll either be transferred directly to your accommodation or, if you prefer, we can arrange for you to drive your hired car to your accommodation from there. You are free to explore Cape Town at your leisure during the reminder of the day. Visit the iconic Victoria and Alfred Waterfront, see penguins at Boulders Bay or enjoy a meal at one of the fantastic restaurants along the promenade at Camps Bay.

Explore Cape Town - You may wish to summit the iconic Table Mountain for breathtaking, scenic views of Cape Town or gain an insight into the lifestyle of the residents of Langa. You could even visit Robben Island, home to the infamous prison where Nelson Mandela spent 18 years, and explore the four Clifton beaches and the nearby Camps Bay. After exploring Cape Town, drive to the historic towns of Stellenbosch, Franschoek and Paarl, known for their famous vineyards and trendy restaurants.

Fly to Kruger - After breakfast, its time to catch your flight to the Greater Kruger region. Meet our representative on arrival and drive to a camp situated in the Sabi Sand Game Reserve, a private reserve located in the Greater Kruger region.

Safari in Sabi Sands - Head out on an early morning safari with an expert guide. Have a picnic breakfast in the bush, before returning to your camp where you can relax by the pool before lunch - then return for another safari trip in the afternoon. Look out for a variety of wild animals, including elephants, lions, leopards, buffalos, white and black rhinos, hippos, cheetahs, crocodiles, hyenas, wild dogs, zebras, giraffes and several species of buck.

Fly to Victoria Falls - Transfer to the airport after breakfast and board a short flight to Victoria Falls. You will be met by a representative and driven to your safari lodge, located on the banks of the Zambezi River. The lodge is a fantastic base from which to see the majestic Victoria Falls and the mighty Zambezi River.

Explore Victoria Falls - Explore Victoria Falls with scenic walks along well-marked paths and multiple viewpoints, including the dramatic Knife Edge Bridge, offering spectacular views of the waterfall and Batoka Gorge. Expect to feel the mist and hear the thunder of the falls as you take in the breathtaking scenery. Beyond the falls, you can enjoy game drives in Victoria Falls National Park, guided walks on nearby islands, and cultural visits to local villages for a deeper understanding of the area’s natural and cultural heritage.
Depart Victoria Falls - You’ll be transferred back to the airport after breakfast for your onwards flight back home.

tourName: South Africa honeymoon, self drive
generalInfo:
Explore the vibrant city of Cape Town, drive along the scenic Garden Route, sample South African wines in the Cape Winelands and enjoy game drives in Amakhala Game Reserve.

Start your South Africa self-drive tour in Cape Town, where you’ll spend three nights before heading out to the spectacular, rolling vineyards, towering mountains and world-renowned wine estates of the Cape Winelands. Explore the quaint, beautiful town of Franschhoek known throughout the world for its Cape Dutch architecture and gastronomic delights.

Drive along the famous Garden Route, enjoying beautiful countryside, then head for the incredible Amakhala Game Reserve, near Port Elizabeth, where you will encounter some of region's big game favourites.

With exciting adventure activities, lush natural beauty, luxury accommodation and excellent cuisine accompanied by fine wines, we guarantee that the memories of this trip will last a lifetime.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Cape Town - Collect your car upon arrival in Cape Town and drive to your accommodation. You're free to explore the city on your own. Drive to the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront, which sits right in the middle of a picturesque harbour with Table Mountain in the backdrop or enjoy a sunset cocktail at one of the trendy bars and restaurants along the promenade at Camps Bay.

Explore Cape Town - Climb to the plateau of Table Mountain in a rotating cable car, visit the District Six Museum and Robben Island to discover more about South Africa’s political history and Nelson Mandela’s legacy, or wander down the iconic Long Street, which is famous for its bohemian vibe. You have another free day to explore Cape Town and the surrounding areas today. Drive to Cape Point, located at the tip of the Cape Peninsula, 60 kilometres southwest of Cape Town and enjoy breathtaking ocean and mountain scenery. Walk the shipwreck trail and spot cape mountain zebras and elands. If you are lucky enough, you will also get the chance to see whales move past Cape Point on their annual migration (June to October). Or you may wish to participate in optional activities such as mountain biking, kayaking and scuba diving.

Drive to Franschhoeck - Leave Cape Town and drive for about an hour to the small, picturesque town of Franschhoek, located in the stunning Cape Winelands. Spend two nights at an award-winning winery, in one of their exquisite guest suites overlooking spectacular vineyards.

Explore the Winelands - During your time in Franschhoek, you have the options of exploring vineyards, going on a wine-tasting tour, hiking or cycling in the Franschhoek Mountains and dining at world-class restaurants, plus a luxury spa experience.

Drive to Oudtshoorn - Leave Franschhoek after breakfast and drive to Oudtshoon, located along the edge of the famous Garden Route. Stay at a luxurious guest house in a breathtaking location surrounded by the Swartberg and Outeniqua mountains. During your time in Oudtshoon you can join optional activities such as a wild meerkat tour, hike in the mountains, visit an ostrich farm, discover the Cango Caves and nearby waterfalls or enjoy a relaxing massage.

Drive to Plettenberg Bay - Drive along the stunning Garden Route to the charming and tranquil town of Plettenberg Bay, where you can enjoy breathtaking scenery and beautiful views over the Indian Ocean. You’ll spend the next two nights in Plettenberg Bay.

Explore Plettenberg Bay - Explore Plettenberg Bay and the surrounding areas. You may wish to relax on endless sandy beaches, explore the dramatic rocky peninsula, lagoons and estuaries, and hike through the lush mountains on your own or book optional activities like kayaking with dolphins or enjoying a round of golf at one of the 18-hole championship courses. If you are feeling adventurous enough, you can glide from tree to tree, 30 metres in the air, during a canopy tour in the Tsitsikamma rainforest.

Drive to Kwandwe Game Reserve - Leave Plettenberg Bay after breakfast and drive along the coast, via the picturesque St Francis Bay, to Kwandwe Game Reserve. A guide will meet you at the entrance of the reserve and transfer you from your rental vehicle to the lodge's 4x4 vehicle. Check in at your luxury safari lodge and get ready for an afternoon game drive. Return to the lodge for a delicious dinner.

Safari in Kwandwe Game Reserve - You’re likely to see herds of elephants as well as lions, leopards, cheetahs, plus black and white rhinos during the trip. There are also optional activities like night drives, bush walks and boat trips.

Depart from Cape Town - Drive to the entrance of the reserve and collect your vehicle. Drive for 45 minutes from Amakhala Game Reserve to reach Port Elizabeth for a domestic flight to Cape Town, from where you will take your international flight back home.

tourName: South Africa luxury holiday, Garden Route & safari
placesVisited: Bantry Bay, Cape Town, Cedarberg Mountains, Stay at private wilderness reserve, Ancient rock art sites, Fynbos excursions, Franschhoek and Winelands, Hermanus, Stay at private Grootbos Nature Reserve, Whale watching, Knysna, Garden Route, Kwandwe Private Game Reserve, Game drives
generalInfo:
Our South Africa luxury holiday follows a carefully crafted itinerary, starting in Cape Town with time to take in this stunning cosmopolitan city and all its famous sites, and ending in a top notch Eastern Cape Game Reserve.

We have chosen nothing but the best in terms of accommodation on this holiday, with three or four days in each location so that you can not only enjoy the magnificent landscapes but also some of the spas, food, wine and wildlife viewing on offer. Our guests always struggle to pick a favourite from the boutique hotels we send them to, be it in the Cedarberg Mountains, the Eastern Cape, the Winelands or on the coast at Hermanus.

At Hermanus you can go whale watching from land, as southern right whales pass through here close to land between the months of June and November. Wildlife also abounds at the private wilderness reserve in the Cedarberg Mountains, as do ancient rock art sites in their hundreds. And your final wildlife watching treat is at Kwandwe Private Game Reserve where your trip draws to a close, with three days to take in the South African bush at its most stunning.

You can chill out on this holiday or enjoy plenty of outdoor adventures on offer, such as sea kayaking, hiking or cycling along the Garden Route. This is a tailor made itinerary so we can make it as active or chilled as you like. What we will always ensure, is a stunning place to sleep with some of the country’s food and wine ready and waiting.

dayInfo.description: Head for the stunning Garden Route today, to the town of Knysna for a 3 night stay at Kanonkop House on a bed and breakfast basis. (Includes drinks). Offering luxury boutique accommodation in the heart of the Garden Route, Kanonkop House is gloriously sited on the apex of Kanonkop Hill above Knysna. This beautiful family owned guest house noted for its excellent service, has gorgeous views overlooking Knysna Lagoon across to the famous Knysna Heads and Indian Ocean beyond. Kanonkop offers five luxury spacious suites, individually created and furnished and each with its own character, decoration and name as well as artworks by talented South Africans. All suites feature fully appointed en-suite bathrooms, bathrobes, slippers, cotton linen, under-floor heating, handmade paddle fans, satellite television, CD player and selection of CD’s, tea and coffee facilities and complimentary WiFi. All suites include private decks that overlook the lagoon or surrounding garden and forest with distant lagoon views. Kanonkop House offers an elegant guest bar where you can help yourself to complimentary drinks; breakfast is served under umbrellas on the patio or in the dining room, there is a relaxing swimming pool with sun loungers and secure off road parking. Kanonkop House in-house activities include bikes, kayaks and a speed boat for water sports or sunset cruising. Discounted golf is available at Simola, Pezula and other Garden Route courses. The guest house is only 2km from Knysna town centre. Knysna is the place to be for savouring seafood fresh from the sea: Knysna Oysters in particular are popular. Knysna Harbour is a great place to relax and watch the sunset from one of the many waterside restaurants and bars. Boat trips to Featherbed Nature Reserve and sundowner cruises can also be arranged here.

tourName: South Africa multi activity holiday
generalInfo:
This 13-day / 12-night travel experience offers a unique way to discover the unparalleled natural beauty of Southern Africa and will both challenge and pamper you as you wind your way from the winelands of the Western Cape up to the sandy shores of northern KwaZulu Natal.

Kick off your activity-filled adventure in the “Mother City”, Cape Town, with an exhilarating guided cycle ride through the picturesque farm roads and sprawling vineyards of Franschhoek to the West Coast fishing village of Paternoster. Before embarking on the next leg of your journey, unwind a while in the is charming hamlet with its pristine beaches, whitewashed cottages and turquoise water. Seafood lovers will be in heaven as they feast on fresh fish at any of the quaint restaurants in the village.
Follow this with a magical 2-day “slackpacking” journey into the Garden Route’s Tsitsikamma forest. Explore the rugged coastline with its sweeping views of the Indian Ocean, natural fynbos and unspoiled forest without the chore of carrying a heavy backpack; while overnighting in well-appointed accommodation and enjoying exquisite cuisine. Take an early morning dip in the sea or get the adrenaline pumping with an evening quad bike ride, in this bird-watcher’s paradise.

You'll overnight in Johannesburg before rounding off your vacation in earthy elegance at the exclusive and luxurious Thonga Beach Lodge, nestled between the exquisite dune forests on the KwaZulu Natal north coast. Wake to the sound of the waves and choose what the day will hold. Whether it be early morning guided kayaking on Lake Sibaya, diving the brilliantly coloured coral reefs amongst schools of fish, sharks and dolphins, or simply lazing the day away in a hammock, the choice is yours.

dayInfo.description: You’ll land at Cape Town International Airport today, and be transported to Parker Cottage (B&B) where you will spend your first night. This ethical and sustainable guesthouse is in the leafy suburb of Tamboerskloof, one of a group of contiguous neighbourhoods known as the City Bowl. Enjoy the day exploring the “Mother City” on one of the many open-top City Sightseeing busses. With over 30 stops, taking you to more than 50 of Cape Town’s top attractions, the bus allows you to hop-on and hop-off at your leisure.

Today marks the first leg of your supported cycling adventure. You’re taking to the saddle with a 50km cycle ride from Jonkershoek Nature Reserve to Franschhoek deep in the Cape Winelands. Tonight, you will stay at the luxurious Akademie Street.

Today you have a slightly longer ride, but the picturesque landscape makes the extra distance worthwhile. After lunch in the olive producing town of Riebeek Kasteel you will cycle onwards to the charming historic town of Tulbagh. Your destination is the elegant Bartholomeus Klip which overlooks the Elandsberg Nature Reserve.

You’re heading back to the coast today with a transfer from Tulbagh to the stunning West Coast National Park, where you’ll begin your guided cycle ride to your next destination. You’ll spend two nights at the tranquil Strandloper Ocean Boutique Hotel in the quaint fishing village of Paternoster, where you’ll enjoy some well-deserved rest and relaxation.

Today marks the start of the hiking leg of your adventure: You’ll explore the magnificent Tsitsikamma coast with 3 nights in luxury lodges enjoying exquisite cuisine and sweeping views of the Indian Ocean … but without the burden of heavy backpacks. All your luggage will be transported by vehicle to your overnight stops. All you need to carry with you is a light day pack, and your camera! After an early morning flight from Cape Town to George you’ll be transported to your new address where you’ll meet your Dolphin Trail guide. Tonight, you will stay in one of the rustic Dolphin Trail Chalets (fully inclusive).

There’s opportunity for an early morning swim or bird watching before your hike today. After crossing Storms River over a suspension bridge, you’ll be guided along ridges and rocky paths until you reach the lookout point with sweeping vistas of the coast towards Plettenberg Bay. Here you’ll relax and enjoy a snack. Be sure to keep an eye out for whales and dolphins! Hike on to your accommodation at Misty Mountain Lodge. Enjoy an exhilarating sunset Quad Bike Tour in the reserve before sitting down to a sumptuous 3-course dinner at the hotel’s restaurant.

This morning’s hike is mostly at sea level, perfect for a spot of snorkelling enroute. It's a steep climb uphill before being rewarded with a picnic lunch, then a 3km forest walk to The Fernery where you will spend the night. After supper enjoy a jacuzzi or sauna to round off a memorable day.

Start your day with breakfast at The Fernery. Afterward, head to Port Elizabeth Airport for a scenic ride. Fly to Johannesburg and stay at The Peech Hotel in Melrose, a stylish and eco-friendly boutique hotel. Enjoy dinner at the hotel's restaurant, then unwind in your cozy Classic Room for a restful night’s sleep.

You’re back in the air with a flight to the Kwa-Zulu Natal town of Richards Bay today, where pick up your rental vehicle and make your way to your lodging for the next three nights at the sensational Thonga Beach Lodge. Head out on foot on a guided walk through the forest where you’ll have the opportunity to see some of the multitude of bird, plant, spider and butterfly species from the area. Enjoy scuba diving and snorkelling, as well as kayaking on Lake Sibaya … or just laze the day away soaking up the sun on the unspoiled white sandy beach.

This is your last day in South Africa. You’ll drive from Thonga Beach Lodge to Durban, where you’ll fly out from Durban International Airport today with what we hope are some outstanding memories to hold onto until we see you again!

tourName: South Africa safari holiday, 14 days
placesVisited: Rukiya Safari Camp, Unique 'bush senses' experience, Bush walks, Help Ingwe Leopard Research Team set camera traps, Wild Rivers Reserve, Private concession in Balule Reserve, Parsons Private Nature Reserve, Klaserie Game Reserve, Thornybush Game Reserve
generalInfo:
This 14-day safari to South Africa offers an exciting, diverse package at an affordable price. The base for this trip is the exclusive Rukiya Safari Lodge, on the banks of the Blyde River in the Wild Rivers Private Nature Reserve. Rukiya is also a key location for our leopard research program. Spend four days here with our team, enjoying big five game drives, bush walks and our fun ‘bush senses’ experience. From here, move on to visit three other game reserves, so you experience a mix of lodge styles and reserves, for a fully rounded and rich safari experience.

Many safaris are concerned simply with spotting the Big Five, but this trip strikes a balance between game viewing and the chance to gain an understanding of wildlife conservation, and even get involved with it. You will have the opportunity to explore our home reserve with wildlife conservationists, too, and there is of course plenty of time for relaxation and enjoying the African bush.

The safari itinerary shown below has been developed and honed over many years, in keeping with our company ethos and taking into account feedback from our safari guests. It includes all the elements we believe an African safari should have, and continues to delight guests, who regularly leave five star reviews! We can also offer exclusive tailored safari itineraries to suit your personal needs and preferences – just let us know.

We understand how important it is to be able to plan your safari costs before you arrive and avoid any hidden extras. We don’t believe in hidden extras and where possible provide an all-inclusive price, with any additions to that clearly flagged up on the itinerary.

Safaris are available all year round, so do get in touch and tell us what you’re looking for. Together we can make your time with us an experience you’ll cherish for a lifetime. This safari is also available for families, with children under 12 years paying 50% of the adult price. All bush walks are replaced by game drives for any children under 14 years.

dayInfo.description: Your safari begins at Hoedspruit Airport (HDS) were you will be met by on arrival by a member of our team and transferred to Rukiya Safari Camp just 25 mins away. Eastgate Airport is the established gateway to the heartland of South Africas wildlife game viewing reserves and has three daytime flights arriving each day from Johannesburg, that are scheduled to assist international visitors to easily connect with Hoedspruit.. Many of our guests prefer us to arrange for their internal flight from Johannesburg to Hoedspruit (50 mins), or alternately for a scenic road transfer (approx 5 hours) which takes the hassle out of arranging the final leg of your journey and is a service that we offer our guests at cost price. Whether you choose to transfer by air or road the price is the same for singles or couples, however a road transfer is more cost effective for a small group or family travelling together. Whichever transfer you prefer you will arrive at Rukiya Safari Camp in time to settle in and rest and relax. Rukiya is a small luxury tented camp within the Wild Rivers Reserve and is a key area for our leopard research team. The camp nestles along the banks of the Blyde River among age old tress, a truly stunning location. Later in thew day, before the sun sets we’ll take a short stroll along the river bank and enjoy a sundowner, returning to the lodge for dinner.

You are woken with an invigorating cup of coffee before setting off on a morning game drive. Your morning game drive will take you through the Wild Rivers Reserve and into the adjacent Balule Reserve (part of the Greater Kruger Park) where you will be able to enjoy your first big five game drive. Lunch is followed by time to relax and enjoy the views from your private deck with river views, before your afternoon game drive in the Wild Rivers Reserve, before returning home for a sumptuous dinner. On your first full day on safari we will include our unique bush senses experience. This is an activity that we have developed over many years and has proven to be very popular with our safari guests. In a fun way it encourages you to use all of your senses when in the bush. Not just sight, but also smell, hearing and touch. Some of our senses are dulled by modern living, but this simple and fun exercise quickly hones one’s bush senses, ideal preparation for any safari.

An early morning game drive will take you through the Wild Rivers Reserve and into the adjacent Balule Reserve (part of the Greater Kruger Park), breakfast will be served in the bush before return to Rukiya. There will be time to rest and relax and enjoy lunch, and when the heat of the day has faded a little, you may join our rangers learning to track leopards and other predators within the reserve, where the Ingwe Leopard team are monitoring the resident leopard population. You will have the chance to try your hand at camera trapping. You’ll be given a motion activated camera trap to put at a place of your choosing on the reserve, with the aim of capturing images of the resident leopards. Over the remainder of your safari your camera will photograph any animal that walks by and triggers the motion sensor day or night. We’ll see what animal pics you capture at the end of your safari. This is the point when you can put all you have learnt so far into action. Guided by the Ingwe team you are able to consider and select places along game trails that you feel are likely spots to photograph the local leopards as they roam during the forthcoming nights. Leopard movement and territorial behaviour changes almost on a daily basis and is dependent on many factors, making this a fascinating and fun exercise and rightfully invites you to feel and become part of the Ingwe team. Return to camp for drinks and dinner.

After breakfast we will transfer to the near by transfer to the luxurious Raptors Retreat in the Greater Kruger Park arriving in time for lunch. An afternoon game drive within the reserve returns to your lodge in time for dinner. The following morning you’ll have an opportunity to enjoy an escorted bush walk within the big five Balule Reserve, returning to your lodge for a late breakfast. Midday at leisure perhaps snoozing in the heat of the day, or enjoying a dip in the pool, or watching animals passing by. Your afternoon game drive will often continue after dark returning to the lodge for dinner.

An early morning game drive followed by a late breakfast and time to rest during he heat of the day. Perhaps enjoy a soak in your private dip pool, watching animals passing by. Before your afternoon game drive, returning to your lodge for dinner.

Early morning bush walk or game drive within the Balule Game Reserve. Returning to the lodge in time for brunch and then transfer to the near by Klaserie Game Reserve which is also part of the Greater Kruger Park. On arrival there will be time to settle in before a late lunch. An evening game drive, will return to the lodge after the sun has set.

An early morning wake-up and an invigorating cup of fresh coffee, will start your first full day in the Klaserie Reserve, followed by an escorted bush walk before returning to the lodge for breakfast. You will have plenty of time for a well-deserved rest during the heat of the day, where there will be time to relax and enjoy the sights and sounds of the African bush. After lunch your afternoon game drive will cover previously unseen areas of the reserve, again returning after dark in time for dinner. The next day will again start with an early morning bush walk. After lunch there will be an afternoon game drive before dinner. As there are no boundary fences between the Klaserie and Kruger National Park, the bush dynamics are constantly changing which means every walk or drive may offer new and exciting events. As we always say snooze and you loose.

A final early morning bush walk followed by brunch. You will then transfer to the near-by Thornybush Game Reserve, famed for its exceptional game viewing and a favoured location for movie stars and the rich and famous, providing a lovely sedate bush atmosphere, with personal and friendly service. Even on bush roads it takes only 45 mins to transfer to Thornybush so you will have plenty of time to settle in and relax before afternoon high tea and game drive. Again returning to your lodge for dinner.

No two days are ever the same on safari. Your next days in the Thornybush Game Reserve starts with an early morning game drive, returning to your lodge in time for a late breakfast/brunch. After which guests may have the option of taking an accompanied big five bush walk. An opportunity to trail in the Thornybush Game Reserve is an experience that will never be forgotten. The trail will return for a well-deserved rest during the heat of the day, where there will be time to relax and enjoying watching animals passing by. The afternoon game drive will start after high tea and will cover previously unseen areas of the reserve, followed by dinner often taken around the fire in an outside boma.

On your last morning in Thornybush, your game drive aims to visit those parts of the concession that we haven’t had time to reach previously, offering an opportunity to get those final photographs, before returning to the lodge for breakfast. Then transfer back to Rukiya Safari Camp to meet up again with our leopard research team and recover the camera traps you set on day 3 and find out if you did indeed capture a leopard on your camera. Guests often remark that returning to Rukiya “feels like going home” and makes an ideal last night on your safari.

A final morning bush walk in the Wild Rivers Reserve followed by brunch. Then together we will review your camera trap pictures, hoping to find leopards, and many more animals that have been roaming the reserve day and night in your absence. All photographs will be added to the Ingwe Leopard Research data base and form part of our research as well as being available for you to copy and take home. We will then transfer to Johannesburg Airport, again taking the Panorama route through the mountains. We will arrive at Johannesburg Airport at around 17:00 and in time for an evening onward flight. For those who have opted to fly back to Johannesburg, we will transfer you to Hoedspruit Eastgate Airport in time for an early afternoon flight.

tourName: South Africa safari holiday, 9 days
generalInfo: Embark on a luxurious African journey that perfectly combines the vibrant culture of Cape Town, the thrilling wildlife of the South African bush, and the awe-inspiring beauty of Victoria Falls. Your adventure begins in Cape Town, where you will explore the city's iconic landmarks, stunning coastlines, and rich history. Next, retreat to the tranquil Pondoro Game Lodge for exhilarating safaris and the opportunity to spot the Big Five in the heart of the African bush. Finally, conclude your journey with the breathtaking sights and unforgettable experiences at Victoria Falls. This bespoke itinerary offers the ideal balance of adventure, luxury, and relaxation, creating memories to treasure for a lifetime.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Cape Town - Welcome to Cape Town and check in at the Clarendon Fresnaye. Your accommodation will be in a Superior Room on a bed and breakfast basis. The room is configured with one double bed, ideal for a comfortable stay. Spend your day exploring the vibrant city, enjoying the stunning views of Table Mountain and the Atlantic Ocean. Relax in your luxurious accommodation before the next day’s adventures.

Transfer to Pondoro Lodge - Check out from Clarendon Fresnaye and transfer to the airport for your journey to Hoedspruit. On arrival, you will be transferred from Hoedspruit Airport to Balule (Ukhozi Reserve Area). Your accommodation will be at Pondoro Game Lodge in a luxury suite, which includes all meals and selected beverages as part of your fully inclusive package. This exclusive lodge offers you a serene escape into nature.

Over the next 4 nights enjoy Pondoro Lodge and all it has to offer from game drives witnessing amazing wildlife encounters. During your stay, you will experience thrilling game drives, with the chance to spot the Big Five and immerse yourself in the beauty of the African bush.

Continue to enjoy your stay at Pondoro Game Lodge. The day will be filled with safari activities, such as morning and evening game drives, bush walks, and relaxing downtime at the lodge. Included in your stay are access to the Balule Reserve, vehicle entry fees, and the rare opportunity to encounter the Black Mamba anti-poaching unit on-site, enhancing your conservation experience. Pondoro has partnered and became a sponsor of the world famous all woman Black mamba anti-poaching team and their affiliate project the Bush Babies Environmental and Awareness Program and we are very excited to announce a Black Mamba Anti- Poaching tour done every Wednesday and Saturday. Guests will be able to meet the Black Mambas, find out why they are so effective and discover the rationale behind this ground breaking initiative. This includes a visit to the Nonwane research facility, a presentation and a lot more. This is a great opportunity for our guests to do their bit to save Africa’s wildlife and more specifically its rhinos. (All funds will go directly to the Black Mamba Anti-poaching unit.)

Transfer to Victoria Falls - Check out from Pondoro Game Lodge and transfer to the airport for your flight to Victoria Falls. Upon arrival at Victoria Falls Airport, you will be transferred to your accommodation at The Palm River Hotel, where you will stay in a Deluxe Room on a bed and breakfast basis. Victoria Falls offers breathtaking views and a variety of activities. You may wish to explore the nearby town, take a sunset cruise on the Zambezi River, or visit the famous waterfall.

On your final day, you will be transferred from The Palm River Hotel to Victoria Falls Airport for your onward journey. After days of adventure and relaxation, you will leave with unforgettable memories of Cape Town, the South African bush, and the majestic Victoria Falls.

tourName: South Africa self drive safari in Limpopo province
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Welgevonden Game Reserve, Kololo Game Reserve, Soutpansberg Mountains, Mapungubwe National Park, Leshiba Wilderness, Five wildlife watching experiences
generalInfo:
Our South Africa safari holiday in Limpopo Province is a self drive trip around the country’s northernmost province and one that proffers the most spectacular, off the beaten track experiences. Pick up your hire car in Johannesburg and drive north for three and a half hours to Welgevonden Game Reserve, your first safari port of call. As with many places on this itinerary, you can choose from villas, chalets or tented camps as a place to stay, but we also recommend you spend three nights here in order to gain maximum enjoyment from the Big Five game viewing experiences.

The cultural heritage of the Limpopo Province is also a feature of this holiday, and we try to incorporate as many experiences as possible such as visits to galleries, artisans, local cafes and community run enterprises. Your next stop in the Soutpansberg Mountains is ideal for this, home to the Venda and Tsonga people with a fascinating heritage.

The heritage of the ancient San people is also a feature of your next stop, staying at a bush lodge near Mapungubwe National Park, a World Heritage Site bestrewn with rock paintings and artefacts of San Bushmen and Iron Age Bantu. As with everywhere in Limpopo there are also dramatically beautiful landscapes all around, with more to follow at Leshiba Wilderness game where you can go on a walking safari to see giraffe, zebra and wildebeest, to name but a few.

These are just a few ideas for your trip to Limpopo, with the suggested itinerary below, but we can tweak this to suit your budget and timeframe.

dayInfo.description: Arrive Johannesburg, you collect your car and drive into the malarial-free Welgevonden Game Reserve for a 3 night stay at Kololo Game Reserve. Kololo Game Reserve offers a varied African safari experience a mere 3,5 hours drive from Johannesburg. Kololo is situated in the beautiful, malaria-free Waterberg area and affords guests the chance of seeing a wide variety of free ranging wildlife including giraffe, kudu, zebra, eland and impala. Enjoy game drives, walks or a mountain bike ride assisted by Kololo’s friendly and knowledgeable rangers. Part of Kololo is integrated into Welgevonden Game Reserve, a Big Five region. Here elephant, rhino, lion, leopard and buffalo abound along with a range of other animals and an abundance of birds. Accommodation types vary from chalets and villas to the tented camp. Relax at the pool, enjoy a bush braai or sip a drink while soaking in the splendour of the African bushveld view from the lookout decks.

This morning you have an early start for a drive into the Soutpansberg Mountains and to Madi a Thavha lodge, where you will stay for 2 nights. Madi a Thavha Mountain Lodge is situated in the Soutpansberg Mountains, a brief 4 hour drive from Kololo. Madi a Thavha lies resplendent in a beautiful valley against a dramatic mountain backdrop. Here one can relax while enjoying warm hospitality amid the rich diversity of local arts and crafts. An art gallery and exhibition centre that is incorporated in the lodge gives an overview of various cultures and how traditional objects have evolved into contemporary arts and crafts. Explore the Venda and Tsonga tradition and lifestyle on a day tour through this incomparable region and visit workshops where local artists have developed strong creative skills in wood carving, textile design and ceramics.

This morning you drive further north to Mopane Bush Lodge, where you stay for 3 nights, a mere 2 hours from Madi a Thavha. Mopane Bush Lodge, is an intimate bushveld lodge inspired by traditional African design. You will stay in a secluded thatched en-suite chalet with outdoor shower. Relax at the pool and dine under the stars. Mapungubwe National Park, the Limpopo World Heritage Site, lies adjacent to Mopane Bush Lodge and is filled with sandstone landscapes, thousand year old baobab trees and herds of African wildlife. Rock paintings and artifacts of San Bushmen and Iron Age Bantu cultures cover this evocative space. Soak in the breath-taking vistas from the Treetop walk and Confluence viewpoint adjacent to the mighty Limpopo river where South Africa, Botswana and Zimbabwe merge.

Today you drive on a further two hours to Leshiba Wilderness, where you stay for 2 nights. Leshiba Wilderness is a magical game reserve situated high up on top of the Soutpansberg Mountains and a 2 hour drive away from Mopane Bush Lodge. Leshiba has over 340 indigenous tree species and abundant animal and bird life. Walk amongst wildlife including giraffe, zebra, wildebeest, porcupines and pangolins; along spectacular trails through forests, across plains and down breathtaking gorges with sparkling pools. Visit ancient Bushmen Rock Art sites. Enjoy sundowner game drives, guided walks and adventure horse riding trails. Your stay is in the extraordinary and authentic Venda Village lodge that was created together with acclaimed Venda artist, Noria Mabasa. The Venda village has 5 rooms and 2 suites with private plunge pools. Pure cotton linen, delicious baths, candlelight and kerosene lamps add to the romance.
Today you drive back to Johannesburg airport, where you drop off your car in time for your onward flight.

tourName: South Africa shark diving tour
generalInfo:
Southern Africa is home to some of the highest diversity of shark species and largest populations in the world. The meeting of both the Atlantic and Indian Oceans along the coast of South Africa. This unique tour travels from the Western Cape of South Africa right across the southern tip of this great continent and then ends in the tropical waters of Mozambique.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife safaris of Southern Africa including diving holidays which specialise in sharks. So if you are passionate about sharks or fascinated by the ocean this tour is a wonderful way to taken in the best dive sites in two Southern African countries whilst hoping to come into contact with as many species of sharks as possible.

The observation of sharks on this itinerary comes in a few different forms, including scuba diving, snorkelling, cage diving and observation from the boat itself.

Many of our targeted shark species on this trip are very well known such as Great White Sharks, Whale Sharks, Tiger Sharks, Bull Sharks and Sand-tiger Sharks. But alongside these species we also have dives planned for Blunt-nosed Seven-gill Sharks and smaller species such as Puffadder Shy Sharks and Spotted Gully Sharks etc.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in towns. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and game drives. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a local escort and then knowledgeable guides onboard each dive boat we will be using. These guides have decades of experience working and diving with sharks through Southern Africa. These guides are experts in shark biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all boat trips, dives, snorkels, cage dives and other activities mentioned. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the water. You will have to speak to your guide on arrival there and book places on these (this is not included). A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

The weather in South Africa and Mozambique during September varies from Cape Town to Tofo, but the temperatures are usually between 25-30 degrees C with little rain. However we will spending so much time in the water the rain will not be problem anyway. Water temperatures will vary as you will be experiencing different currents from the cold water Benguela current along the Western Cape and the much warmer Agahlus current from the east.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our shark diving holidays are guided by an experienced dive masters and shark experts and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• The boats that we use for our cage diving limit the number of people per boat, the number people in the water at any one time.
• The boats that we use for our cage diving also spend at least half of the time on each trip observing the completely natural hunting behaviours of the sharks, we emphasise the natural behaviours of the sharks before thinking about getting in the water with them.
• Depending on budget and interest we have a range of different accommodation packages to offer, from luxury hotels to budget guest houses.
• Enjoy 15 different dives throughout the South African coastline.
• All the above reasons give this, our Southern African shark diving tour a great success rate of seeing the best of the sharks around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Southern Africa so that we can try and find and observe some of the rarer and more elusive species. We have great land based wildlife watching itineraries and expertise in all Southern African countries (Namibia, South Africa, Botswana, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi and Mozambique) and can arrange trips to find some of the rarer species such as aardvarks, aardwolves, brown hyenas and black-footed cats among other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour visit various locations within South Africa and one in Mozambique. Starting from Cape Town in the Western Cape you will be taken eastwards Umkomaas in the Wild Coast and then onto Tofo in Mozambique.

Fitness Level:

This trip is a very specialist diving tour and requires a good level of scuba diving skill and experience as well as high fitness as there is a lot swimming and diving involved.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: False Bay - Arrival - Today you will arrive into Cape Town International Airport and then meet your guide / local shark diving expert. Before being taken to your accommodation, the rest of the day is free at your leisure. (no meals included today).

False Bay - This morning will be the same morning great white shark trip as the last two mornings and then in the afternoon you will be taken to another part of False Bay, this time close to the rocky shore and in the kelp forests. This is our dive with some of the most rarely seen sharks in the world. The usually very deep dwelling blunt-nosed seven-gill sharks (known here as cow sharks) are often found in water less than 12 meters deep in the kelp beds of False Bay. As well as these impressive 1-3m sharks we usually seen spotted-gully sharks, brown shysharks, puff-adder shysharks and other species of catsharks. There is also a chance of spending time in the water with the playful inhabitants of False Bay the Cape fur seals before the day is done. (Breakfast only).

Umkomaas - This morning after breakfast you will be taken to the airport to catch your flight across South Africa to Durban on the wild coast. On arrival in Durban we will meet our next local shark diving expert and get transferred to Unkomaas. After checking into the accommodation you will have the rest of the day free to rest and prepare as for the next three days, you will have two scuba dives per day. (Breakfasts only)

Tofo (Mozambique - After an early breakfast this morning you will be taken to the airport to catch your flight to Johannesburg and the connecting flight to Inhambane Airport in Mozambique. Once you land you will be met by our third local shark diving expert and by transferred to Tofo and your accommodation. (Breakfast only).
Home - This morning after breakfast you will be transferred to Inhambane airport in time to catch home or back to Johannesburg.

tourName: South Africa small group tour
generalInfo:
Brimming with natural splendour, a diverse mix of cultures and some of the world’s best wildlife, South Africa is guaranteed to bowl you over. Adventure, history, scenery and so many other marvels of Africa are concentrated here, so we’ve packed all the highlights into a thrilling 12 day adventure.

One day you’ll be cruising golden savannahs looking out for prides of lions, mighty rhinos and herds of elephants, the next you’ll be discovering Africa’s cosmopolitan cities.
And all with an experienced group leader and an instant group of friends, get ready for the adventure of a lifetime!


HIGHLIGHTS

– Learn about South Africa’s history on a tour of Soweto, Johannesburg
– Experience a once in a lifetime safari in Kruger National Park
– Immerse yourself in Swazi culture
– Explore beautiful Cape Town and see breath-taking views atop Table Mountain
– Get up close and personal with wild Seals in their natural environment

INCLUSIONS

Airport pickup
11 nights accommodation
Walking and bus tour of Soweto
Apartheid Museum/Mandela's house entrance
Drive the Panorama Route
Half day open vehicle game drive of Kruger National Park
Sunset game drive in Hlane National Park
Local village Swazi cultural experience
Historic walk of Cape Town
Return Table Mountain ticket (alternative activity in Winter)
Full day peninsula tour including entrance to Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve
Seal island boat cruise
Boulders beach penguins
Meals as indicated on itinerary
Private transport throughout plus internal flights
Experienced group leader and local guides
Onward travel help & planning
24/7 support after the trip finishes.

dayInfo.description: WELCOME TO SOUTH AFRICA! - Welcome to South Africa! Once you arrive in Johannesburg we’ll take you to our hostel, where you can check in from 2pm. You’ll have plenty of time to recover from your flight before meeting everyone in your group.

EXPLORE JOHANNESBURG - First up today we’re learning about the history of Soweto township. We'll visit the beautifully designed Apartheid Museum or mandela's House depending on availability. Later we'll head out for some drinks at the best watering holes around.

GRASKOP & THE PANORAMA ROUTE - Today we leave JoBurg to head into the depths of Africa. We’ll have breakfast at the hotel, then drive the renowned Panorama Route to see some of Africa’s most stunning landscapes.

KRUGER NATIONAL PARK - We’re off to Kruger National Park, crossing our fingers for our first sightings of exotic wildlife on our drive. Tonight at our pre-erected campsite we enjoy a traditional Potjie, a South African dish that is traditionally cooked outdoors in a cast iron cauldron.

OPEN VEHICLE GAME DRIVE - Today is a trip highlight - a once in a lifetime open vehicle game drive through Kruger National Park! We’ll look out for herds of mighty elephants, rhinos, buffalos, prides of lions and lurking leopards, and our experienced guides will ensure we have the best possible experience. Tonight our guide will give us an explanation of the history of our dinner, known as braai; a traditional South African BBQ before we spend the night gazing up at an infinite, starry sky.

TRAVEL TO ESWATINI - This morning we’ll cross the border to Eswatini, a small landlocked nation that hosts Hlane Royal National Park. This evening is another chance to spot your favourite animals on a sunset game drive through the grasslands. Tonight if we are lucky, we’ll be treated to a show from rangers performing their traditional style of Swazi singing.

LOCAL WAY OF LIFE - Today we journey back into South Africa, traveling south towards Mkuzie. After we arrive, we’ll stop by a local crèche to connect with the community and spend some time with the children, getting a glimpse into their daily school life. Later this afternoon, we’ll have the opportunity to relax and make the most of our beautiful accom before dinner. This evening is a real highlight — a showcase of traditional Zulu dancing!

COASTAL TOWNS - This morning, we’ll spend time in a local Zulu village, discovering what traditional life is like in the rural countryside. Afterwards, we’ll make our way to the coast and settle into our beach lodge. The afternoon is yours to unwind — whether that’s lounging on the sand or taking a dip in the pool. Tonight, we’ll dig into a local favourite: Bunny Chow, a beloved South African dish made from a loaf of bread packed with curry — definitely a must-try!

TABLE MOUNTAIN - We’re off early this morning to catch our short flight to Cape Town. This afternoon we rise to the heavens as we summit the iconic Table Mountain (weather permitting, alternative activity in winter). Crisp air accompanies dramatic views, earning Table Mountain its title as one of the New 7 Wonders of Nature, and we’ll soak up a stunning scenes over the majestic natural amphitheatre. This evening we’ll make our way to the V&A Waterfront to stroll, shop, and take in the views.

DISCOVER CAPE TOWN - Today we head off on a walking tour of Bo-Kaap, an area known for it’s colourful houses and Cape Malay culture. The tour will continue with a drive past the Houses of Parliament, the City Hall, Slave Lodge, District 6 Museum, Slave Lodge, The Castle, and Cape Town Stadium. We'll finish the day with a cocktail in hand as we watch the sun set.

CAPE PENINSULA - Gear up for a day of adventure as we explore the dramatic beaches and cliffs of Cape Peninsula. We’ll go on a cruise to get up close and personal with wild fur seals, stop for photos at the impressive Chapman’s Peak, then explore the Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve and hang out with a colony of wild African Penguins on Boulders Beach. Tonight we’re out for our farewell dinner at a funky restaurant.

CHECKOUT & ONWARD TRAVEL - Time to bid farewell as our 12 day African adventure comes to an end. You can either check out and journey home, stay on longer in Cape Town or continue your travels in Africa. If you need any assistance planning onward travel, we’re more than happy to help!

tourName: South Africa & Vic Falls active adventure
generalInfo:
Tick 'been there' on your bucketlist with this journey to visit three of the world's most famous natural landmarks: Cape Town's Table Mountain, the transfrontier Kruger National Park and the largest waterfall in the world, Victoria Falls. This journey is ideally suited to first-time visitors to Southern Africa.

You can make this trip as active or passive as you like: we've included abseiling off Table Mountain, zipling across Victoria Falls and walking safaris in Kruger but you can just as easily take the cablecar to the mountain top or a river cruise on the mighty Zambezi.

Pricing is based on the assumption that you'll self-drive but this can just as easily be fully guided or partially guided, as you'd prefer - just ask us.

We've only used ethical and sustainable businesses, most of them Fair Trade in Tourism accredited, to build this journey. We are locally based in South Africa and personally visit and research every single place we use in our journeys to ensure standards are being met.

This journey's intinerary is just one way of seeing the landmarks: the whole trip can of course be done in reverse, made longer or shorter or include different landmarks, as you see fit.

dayInfo.description: You'll fly back to Johannesburg from Victoria Falls today and complete your journey home.

tourName: South Africa wheelchair accessible safari
generalInfo:
This accessible itinerary takes you through some of Africa’s most well-known destinations, designed for wheelchair users. Travel from Cape Town to Kruger National Park, ending at Victoria Falls, with accommodations and activities chosen for comfort and ease of access.

Explore Cape Town
Begin your journey in Cape Town, staying in accommodation with roll-in showers and other accessibility features. Take a cable car ride up Table Mountain, which has ramps and lifts for easy access to scenic views. Visit Cape Point using an accessible funicular and see the penguins at Boulders Beach via a boardwalk. Other options include exploring Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens on wheelchair-friendly pathways or visiting selected vineyards in the Cape Winelands.

Safari in Kruger National Park
Next, fly to Hoedspruit and stay at Ximuwu Lodge, designed for wheelchair accessibility. Go on game drives in adapted vehicles with ramps and swivel seats, allowing you to see a variety of wildlife. The lodge offers accessible facilities, including roll-in showers and spacious interiors, ensuring a comfortable stay.

Visit Victoria Falls
End your trip at Victoria Falls, where wheelchair-accessible pathways provide views of the falls. Optional activities include a scenic helicopter flight or a Zambezi River sunset cruise, with operators offering support for wheelchair users.

This itinerary provides a way to experience Cape Town, Kruger, and Victoria Falls with accessible travel in mind, ensuring ease of movement throughout the journey.

dayInfo.description: You’ll arrive into Cape Town International and be met and transferred to our adapted vehicle, with a ramp at the back of the vehicle for access. You’ll be driven in to the city to a hotel that we work closely with which has several accessible rooms. The rooms include roll-in showers, hand-rails and can be set up as twin or double. Every trip we plan in Cape Town is tailored to your dreams but here are some suggestions for adapted experiences to enjoy this beautiful city.

One of Cape Town’s highlights is Table Mountain, with the rocky expanse dominating all images of the city. We highly recommend ascending the mountain using the cable car, which has accessible access including elevators, ramps and parking bays. We will provide you with a map created for wheelchair users to navigate your way around the top of the mountain to get the best views out over the bay and beyond. There are also two accessible restaurants at the top of the mountain. We can organise for this trip to be guided or accompanied or just book the tickets and transfers.

This morning you’ll be met by our guide and board our adapted vehicle, with an accessible ramp at the rear. We’ll drive along the scenic Chapman’s peak, winding our way along the coastal roads with the wild Atlantic Ocean by our side. There is a funicular with accessible access to take you down to the Point. We then journey to Boulders Beach colony of African penguins. The penguins can be viewed from a large accessible decking area. We’ll stop in Simon’s town for some lunch, if we’re there at the right time (July-November) it’s sometimes possible to spot Southern Right whales from the shore!

Today you could visit Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens, on the slopes of Table Mountain National Park and generally regarded as one of the most beautiful gardens in the world. We will provide you with a map created for wheelchair users highlighting routes that are designated as accessible. Another option for today is take a guided tour of the winelands, visiting wine farms selected for their wines, hosted tasting and of course accessible access. The winelands are a short distance from the city in our vehicle and during our tour we’ll make a few stops at different wineries for tastings and lunch.

This morning you’ll be collected by your driver for your flight up to Hoedspruit, a key gateway to the private game reserves bordering Kruger National Park. The property we are suggesting is Ximuwu Lodge, one of the only safari lodges fully designed for wheelchair users. You’ll be collected using their wheelchair-accessible airport shuttle bus, equipped with ramps and swivel seats for easy boarding. Arriving at the lodge you’ll instantly notice that this lodge doesn’t just cater for wheelchair users, it exists to ensure they have an incredible experience. The extensive suites have indoor and outdoor hobless showers, handrails, height-adjustable beds and many more adaptions to cater to your needs.

Today you will fly up to Victoria Falls. We can either drive you down to Nelspruit for a direct flight to Victoria Falls or you can connect at Johannesburg, we can discuss these options when we create your trip. On arrival at Victoria Falls you will exit the plane using an aisle (Washington) chair. We have an adapted vehicle for transfer in the town with a lift/ramp. We work with a number of hotels in Victoria Falls Town, Zimbabwe which have adapted rooms to make them accessible. Victoria Falls is known as the adventure capital of Africa and there are quite a few activities which have been adapted for guests with mobile impairments.

tourName: South Africa wildlife photography safari
generalInfo:
Enjoy close encounters with lions and leopards, photograph elephants and rhinos, drink sun-downers under acacia trees, and get professional photographic tutoring at the same time during an exclusive wildlife photography workshop in South Africa. Set in a private game reserve in the Timbavati, this photo safari is a wildlife photography dream. The area is known for its incredible sightings of the African Big Five, including the elusive leopard.
 
Throughout the workshop, you’ll be guided by professional wildlife photographer Alan Hewitt, who will provide both theoretical and practical photographic tutoring and will help you become the best photographer you can be.

The Timbavati, a collection of game reserves that borders Kruger National Park, is photography heaven. It offers truly exclusive game drives; nowhere else in Africa do you spot the Big Five with such ease. You can prepare yourself for some close encounters with lions, leopards, elephants, and other wildlife, as the animals have been habituated to the safari vehicles after many years of game drives in the area. You might even follow big cats as they hunt, or spot a leopard dragging a kill up a tree. We’ll enjoy two game drives daily, one for each of the day’s golden hours.

The trip is completely built around photography. Tutoring and shooting will be focused on the incredible wildlife around us. We will have the luxury of staying at a private lodge, and the opportunity to build the whole experience around getting the very best photographs. The Big Five together with antelope, zebra, and giraffe will create a constantly evolving tableau of African beauty.

The combination of close encounters with wildlife, lush African bush, and stunningly warm light will provide incredible opportunities for wildlife and landscape photography. Our days exploring the Greater Kruger area will add another dimension to your photographic experience, allowing you to experiment with different settings and situations, and ensuring you’ll go home with an impressive and varied collection of images.

dayInfo.description: You will be met by one of our team members upon arrival at Hoedspruit Airport and driven to our private lodge. There will be time to settle in before heading out on our first game drive.

We will spend our days focusing on wildlife photography. Each day will begin with a three-hour game drive at sunrise. We’ll be tracking the Big Five as they are at their most active, at first light. You’ll be guided by an experienced ranger and tracker, and accompanied by Alan for photographic guidance. Afterwards, a large and delicious breakfast will be waiting for you at the lodge. There will be time for photography workshops, editing, and review sessions before lunch. At the end of the afternoon, we’ll head out for another three-hour game drive. This time we’ll photograph the day’s last warm light, and experience the bush as night is falling. Days will conclude with everyone enjoying an indulgent dinner.
After our last game drive it’s time to wrap up the workshop and we will head back to Hoedspruit Airport to catch our flights home.

tourName: South Africa wildlife tour, sharks and aardvarks
generalInfo:
We trade in lions and elephants for great white sharks and aardvarks on this South Africa safari. Travelling to watch great whites hunting fur seals, then enjoying some of the best whale watching in the world, spending time around penguins at their colony before heading inland and looking for some of the rare and unusual species that inhabit the dry grasslands and rocky escarpments of the zone between the Karoo to the south and the Kalahari to the north. If successful we could be among the first people (if not the only people) to see great white sharks and aardvarks in the same trip!.

Exploring many different habitats on this tour we will find wildlife at home in the shallow rocky waters of the Southern African coast, animals from the open ocean who are only coming into the bay for food or protection, animals that live on the sandy beaches and rocky cliffs of the Cape, plants and animals that make up one of the five floral kingdoms of the world the unique and endemic Fynbos.

All in all this dedicated and comprehensive wildlife tour of some unusual South African ecosystems that we hope will have you falling in love with the other side of safari holidays in South Africa. The whole of Southern Africa has many hidden secrets and much more than the Big Five and we hope to showcase some of these highlights throughout this tour.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary). We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and game drives, guided walks, shark & whale watching boat trips. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through South Africa (and elsewhere in Southern Africa). Your naturalist escort is an expert in wildlife biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. Whilst the trip involves a lot of camps, these are not pitch your own tent camping camps, instead these are luxury tented camps where the tents are permanent and you do not need to bring any camping equipment or sleeping bags with you. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the Kalahari wilderness, night safaris are available in some locations (subject to the local conditions on that day). You will have to speak to your guide on arrival there and book places on these (this is not included). A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced zoologist (where available- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) or naturalist guides as well as local drivers, boat skippers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it. We do our best to include as many wildlife activities as possible in all of our itineraries.
• Depending on budget and interest we have a range of different accommodation packages to offer, from luxury top end lodges, national park safari lodges and mobile-camps which often offer unbelievable wildlife watching deep inside national parks as well as camping. We can also arrange mobile camping safaris of Botswana is very popular and all of your camping gear will be provided.
• Spend all the daylight hours searching for wildlife and visiting various natural wonders and stunning landscapes.
• All the above reasons give this, our South Africa wildlife safaris a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Southern Africa so that we can try and find and observe some of the rarer and more elusive species. We have great itineraries and expertise in all Southern African countries (Namibia, South Africa, Botswana, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Malawi and Mozambique) and can arrange trips to find some of the rarer species such as aardvarks, aardwolves, brown hyenas and black-footed cats among other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Best time to visit:
