There are few finer vistas anywhere on the continent, and it is a more intimate experience from a hot air balloon than from any of Blyde River Canyon’s famous viewpoints. You will touch down to the east of the canyon, where you will continue your journey by road. It will take around one hour to reach Mala Mala, which is the largest of all the Sabi Sands game reserves and the one with the best location. The Sabi Sands and Kruger National Park share an unfenced border. Wildlife migrates freely between the two parks and congregates where there is water, most popularly the Sabi and Sand river. Mala Mala has the longest shared border with the park. Essentially, it is on the inside of the Sabi Sands, deep within the Greater Kruger. Some of the cheaper Sabi Sands private reserves are located along the outside of the ecosystem, where they have a fenced barrier to the urban world. Naturally, the unfenced realm on the inside is more attractive to the animals.

dayInfo.title: Mala Mala Private Game Reserve – Legendary Big Game Encounters through the Day and Night
dayInfo.description: As dawn breaks, you will be greeted by a special scene. A leopard may meet your gaze with its green eyes, piercing the morning haze. It will move slowly, serenely, and then in a split second, it will descend onto the savannah floor. A few steps at a time, the predator explores. It is elegance personified, but there is a deep earnestness to the hunter’s movements. Leopards are one of Africa’s most elusive and difficult to spot animals, and they are a specialism of Mala Mala. Guides know their hideouts and sunrise game drives can begin by venturing straight to their lairs. On most drives, you will simply watch a leopard as it moves slowly around the savannah, but sometimes, you can be treated to the spotted cat on a hunt. Leopards are also an excellent animal to follow on a nighttime game drive. Leopards and lions prefer to hunt at night, which is when the temperature is cooler, and their acute eyesight comes into its own. It is on a nighttime game drive when you are most likely to encounter lions on the prowl. Often, these drives have a near spooky resonance, but they are completely safe. The driver may cut the engine, so you can be led by sounds. Your eyes will adjust to the gloom, and the animals will seem much closer under the veil of darkness. These nighttime game drives help you understand the nocturnal world, and you can go in search of specific animals like leopards and lions. They will a beautiful addition to your daytime adventures and can be included on all three nights of your stay in the Mala Mala. The daytime game drives are all about abundance. Since there are so many animals here, it can be difficult knowing which way to look. Hippos wallow in a river as eland drink tentatively from the banks, baboons and vervet monkeys cry out from the treetops, possibly alerting everyone to a cheetah that hides in the grass, and white rhinos provide sublime and usually short moments as they cross your path and wander into a place of privacy. By the end of these two days, you will also know how to distinguish most of the Kruger antelope, including hartebeest, impala, waterbuck, endangered Roan antelope, and the stunning Sable antelope. As with the other destinations, you will have a private guide and driver, and this can really enhance your experience as it enables you to create a very personal Kruger storyline. For example, photographers can spend longer at specific sights to get the best shots, and hippo lovers can venture out before dawn to watch the giants as they return to a river. You can also focus part of a drive on anything from eagles to the unique pronking that is performed by Springbok. As this is a private reserve, you can also drive off the trail whenever you desire. In Kruger National Park, you do not need to stick to the roads and vehicle trails because going off the trail is essential for getting closer to the cats and the more elusive animals.

dayInfo.title: Lebombo Concession – Evoking Kruger’s Phenomenal Scale
dayInfo.description: After three nights in Mala Mala, you will enter Kruger National Park for the first time. Lebombo is on the far east side of the park, and it will take at least half a day to drive there. It could take the entire day, depending on what you see and how often you stop. A drive across the park must stick to vehicle trails, but it offers an outstanding impression of Kruger’s scale. This ecosystem also dwarfs many US states and European countries in size, and the deeper you go, the more surprises that you can encounter. Towards Eastern Kruger, there are fewer animals. You can drive for 20 minutes and claim that you have seen nothing, but then, you can cross a ridge, and suddenly a buffalo herd blocks your way. Your guide may also stop and use their binoculars to seek out a cheetah with cubs. One animal can seem to be following your journey, and that is the spotted hyena, which are active animals that are constantly on the move in search of food. They not only scavenge but seek out the weak and sick, using their incredible stamina to find food that others miss. At first, you may find them a bit ugly, but hyenas can be quick to change your perception. While reaching the Lebombo Mountains, you will check into your luxurious clifftop lodge. Mala Mala has an excellent camp and will provide an experience amongst the wildlife. It is the sort of place where you open your curtains to an elephant. Your final lodge in Lebombo is contemporary in style, and here, you can open your curtains to an almost endless view over the Kruger. There will be no other buildings or any vehicles in sight. This is an opulent retreat that is complete with a marvelous wine cellar, a safari spa, and some of South Africa’s best dining. After Mala Mala and a long drive, it will provide a nice change of pace.

dayInfo.title: Lebombo Concession – Luxury and Indulgence in Remote Eastern Kruger
dayInfo.description: After a couple of active days, your final day is likely to be more relaxed. Scenic beauty is one reason to visit Lebombo, and the lack of other people is another. Here, you can slow down again and feel the beautiful seclusion of a Kruger safari. That does not mean there will not be any wildlife sightings. Although life is not as abundant as in Mala Mala, the Lebombo Mountains hide an excellent array of wildlife, including smaller hunters like a jackal, which you may not have seen yet. Game drives are the mainstay of most programs, and they can be complement with game walks, nighttime drives, and also riding safaris. You can peddle through the bush on a mountain bike, or you can be lounge around the pool and enjoy a regal view over the Kruger.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg – Departure
dayInfo.description: After a final safari activity this morning, you will transfer to the nearby airstrip for a morning flight back to Johannesburg. Dayroom hotel use has been arranged at the airport so you can refresh before your international flight.

tourName: Boundless Beauty: 17-Day South Africa and Mozambique
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Sabi Sands Game Reserve, Cape Town, Franschhoek, Ponta Mamoli
generalInfo: From the dazzling suburbs of the city of gold, Johannesburg, to the sweeping lush plains of Sabi Sands Game Reserve and from the bustling districts and gorgeous coastline of Cape Town to the pristine beaches of Ponta Mamoli, this 17-day tour is tailored to showcasing what makes South Africa and Mozambique must-visit destinations. Embrace their boundless beauty, from the untouched wilderness to the immaculate coastlines during your stay.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg - Welcome to the City of Gold
dayInfo.description: South Africa’s city of gold, Johannesburg, is a busy metropolitan boasting a dazzling cultural scene and sophisticated suburban districts where glitz and glamour are boundlessly presented by lavish high-rise buildings and haute cuisine restaurants. You will touch down and transfer to a gorgeous accommodation hemmed in the heart of the city’s iconic Sandton suburb, a modern traveler’s playground complete with bustling entertainment parks and vibrant nightlife. You may enjoy the city’s many pleasures before turning in for the evening in anticipation of your safari ahead.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - A Proper South African Introduction
dayInfo.description: Your South African safari truly begins once you leave the cozy comfort of suburbia and transfer to one of the country’s premier private reserves, Sabi Sands. You will welcome a retreat to one of the grassy region’s gorgeous lodges stationed right in the middle of the untouched wilderness. After checking into your suite and checking out some of your accommodation’s lavish amenities, you may enjoy a thrilling afternoon game drive to acclimate to the astonishing remote ambiance. With dinner prepared on the open flames, your first evening in Sabi Sands will be a proper South African introduction.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - Discover South Africa’s Rich Wilderness
dayInfo.description: You will tuck into breakfast with views of the bushveld spreading from the edge of your patio towards the horizon. As you savor each bite of your scrumptious spread, you will watch animals wandering the open plains while the sun rises higher into the sky. After breakfast, you will join an experienced ranger and track down the curious creatures living in the wild. You will spot buffalo herds gathering in the mud, giraffes picking the leaves from acacias, lions pacing the plains in search of shade, and rhinos grazing with their young ones as you explore more of Sabi Sands.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - Exploring in the Early Hours of the Morning
dayInfo.description: Instead of waiting for the sun to rise before you head out on safari this morning, you will jump in your 4x4 vehicle before the break of dawn to discover what activities occur when many visitors still lie peacefully in slumber. Venturing across rugged terrain, you will search through the greenery by a spotlight and witness the remnants of last night’s escapades. Lions and leopards are more active hunters at night, and you will hope to spot the majestic big cats in action during your early morning game drive.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - While South Africa Sleeps
dayInfo.description: While the early morning is a great time to search for hunting predators, many fascinating species of wildlife come to life while the rest of the world is asleep. This evening, after a day of relaxation around the pool and delightful day trips through the reserve, you will join your ranger for a unique night safari. Shining a spotlight on the nocturnal creatures, you will witness some of the country’s rarely seen animals in action, which is something only recently captured on film thanks to the development of high-tech thermal cameras.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - The Crown Jewel of the Western Cape
dayInfo.description: In the foothills of the momentous Table Mountain, alongside the slopes of the iconic Lion’s Head, lies South Africa’s ritzy cosmopolitan escape, the world-famous city of Cape Town. Today, you will transfer via Nelspruit to Cape Town International Airport and arrive in the Western Cape’s crown jewel. Cruising from the airport into town, you will admire the immaculate Western Cape scenery and the marvelous cityscape towering along the Cape Peninsula. You will soon arrive at your boutique accommodation tucked beneath the summit of Lion’s Head in a suburb where Cape Town’s nightlife thrives.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - The Meeting of the Two Oceans
dayInfo.description: Cape Town is the entry point to the coveted Cape Peninsula cruise. In the morning, you will join your guide and set off across the tarred roads wrapping around the Cape coastline. Your scenic drive along the ocean will share breathtaking views of the region’s renowned rock formations, including the Twelve Apostles, as well as offer unbridled vistas of the rugged coast from viewpoints along the sought-after Chapman’s Peak Drive. Stopping at blue-flag beaches along the way and arriving at the meeting point of the oceans, the Cape of Good Hope, you will swoon over every inch of the peninsula.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Embrace the Cape at Your Pace
dayInfo.description: You will enjoy a day of self-discovery in Cape Town, choosing to explore the city at leisure and appreciating your personal experiences. You may decide to ascend the looming slopes of Table Mountain via cable car to take in the panoramic vistas thousands flock to capture or cross the Atlantic to Robben Island and delve into the dramatic life story of former president and visionary leader, Nelson Mandela. Or, you may wish to feed the squirrels on the immaculately kept lawns of Company Gardens or tuck into the Cape’s famous fish and chips in the seaside town of Hout Bay.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Insider’s Food Tour of the City
dayInfo.description: The best way to experience a country is through its food, and South Africa offers few better places to immerse yourself in its culinary culture. Cape Town is loaded with fancy, upmarket restaurants and boasts humble eateries sharing authentic representations of its historical cuisine. Today, you will join an insider foodie and peruse the city’s spirited suburbs in search of the restaurants and local diners known for their world-class and genuine delicacies, respectively. You may also enjoy private cooking sessions alongside Michelin-starred chefs should you wish to learn how to prepare the finest in South African cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - A Tantalizing Taste of the Cape Winelands
dayInfo.description: The Cape Winelands extends from the outskirts of the city, in Constantia, to Stellenbosch, Franschhoek, and beyond. They encompass the Western Cape’s finest wine farms, which represent one of the main reasons to visit the region’s rolling emerald hills. Today, you will transfer from Cape Town towards the vineyards circling its immaculate hilly fringes and be introduced by sommeliers to the winelands premier vintages. Having sipped an array of exquisite wines to backdrops of the cascading viridian vineyards, you will walk away from the elite estates with memories to last a lifetime.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - Unearthing More of the Cape Wine Country
dayInfo.description: The Cape Winelands is an impressive slice of unspoiled wine drinking paradise that is too enormous to fully explore in one day. Hence, your second day in Franschhoek is dedicated to discovering more of the discerning vintages produced in this globally renowned wine country. You may visit a collection of esteemed estates to learn more about their bottles as well as tour their cellars, cruise across the hills in a wine tram stopping off at beloved wineries, and tuck into an exceptional farm-to-table lunch at one of the Cape’s leading organic farms throughout the day.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - The Origins of the Huguenot Settlers
dayInfo.description: With your twelfth day open to freely explore Franschhoek, you may start your day slowly with a sumptuous breakfast spread overlooking the breathtaking viridian, hilly landscape. After breakfast, you may meander the countryside either with a guide, on your own, or in a restored vintage vehicle. No matter how you choose to galavant across your green surroundings, you will be thrilled to unravel the origins of the Huguenot settlers when visiting monuments and museums constructed in remembrance of their past.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Mamoli - Mozambique’s Hidden Island-Style Gem
dayInfo.description: Mozambique is known for its picturesque white-sand beaches, crystal clear sapphire oceans, and vibrant cultural lifestyle, characteristics all coming together perfectly at the final destination of your vacation. Today, you will transfer from Franschhoek to an all-encompassing beach retreat in one of the country’s less-visited but no less magnificent castaway destinations, Ponta Mamoli. Here, you will spend your remaining nights lapping up the luxuries of your Mozambican getaway, from indulging in top-tier amenities to embracing the laid-back atmosphere of this hidden island-style gem.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Mamoli - The Magnificent Mozambican Ocean
dayInfo.description: A huge part of Mozambique’s allure is its picturesque ocean, a water lover’s playground you will be ecstatic to enjoy during your stay on the iconic coastline. Today, you may embrace the beauty of the beach whichever way you please. You may find comfort lounging under the sun and tanning with your toes dug into the sand, partake in watersports such as kayaking or snorkeling in the crystalline water, or take part in fishing tours off the shoreline under the guidance of professional fishers.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Mamoli - Kicking back in Mozambican Style
dayInfo.description: You will adore your moments spent on Mozambique’s coastline, kicking back in style with cocktails in hand while gazing upon the sprawling seascape. Beyond the brilliant beachside activities, you may indulge in the lavish spa therapies offered at your accommodation. Today, you may join an experienced masseuse and feel your worries melt away as you choose from a collection of exquisite and revitalizing treatments. Whether you opt for a hot stone massage or a full-body aromatherapy massage, your spa with views of the sea will raise the bar.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Mamoli - Lapping up Coveted Coastal Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Beyond the beach and your accommodation’s delightful amenities, Mozambique is best experienced through its unique culinary dishes. With a coastline stretching the length of the country, Mozambique is most notably known for its exceptional seafood delicacies. Today, you may wander from your resort to local towns cherished for their exquisite cuisine and tuck into an assortment of freshly caught seafood meals at restaurants overlooking the ocean. You will return to your resort and delight in an oyster dinner while slurping down sensational cocktails and reminiscing about your coastal adventures.

dayInfo.title: Ponta Mamoli - Wave Goodbye to Mozambique
dayInfo.description: You will end your vacation the same way it started, cherishing your moments in a spectacular foreign destination. You will sip on a cup of fresh coffee as the sun rises over the Mozambican coast and floods the seascape in light, beckoning in a new day and the last morning of your tour. You may savor your final breakfast and think back on your adventures while packing your bags and preparing to bid farewell to the majesty of Mozambique. You will be collected by your transfer afterward and whisked away to the airport, where you will catch your flight home.

tourName: Bush and Beach: Luxury Kruger Safari & Mozambique Island Escape
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Sabi Sands Game Reserve, Londolozi, MalaMala Game Reserve, Pemba, Vamizi Island, Quirimbas Archipelago
generalInfo: Africa's landscapes redefine notions of escapism. They are not merely places where you simply go to escape the world; they are exotic realms that immerse you in a rhythmic beauty untouched for millennia. Combining five days of big-game Kruger action with four nights in Mozambique's Quirimbas Archipelago, this sublime safari offers a getaway into ancient worlds. Blending private reserves with an exclusive island, you escape to the bush, and then settle onto the white sandy beach.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands – Introductions in the Sabi Sands
dayInfo.description: The word safari comes from the Swahili language, translating into English as “journey.” It's a fitting definition of the experience to come, immediately suggesting notions of an adventure into the unknown. Yet there's more to the Swahili interpretation as the word safari means more than just the movement of travel, but also a journey of changing perspectives. Land in the Sabi Sands and both sides to the definition are immediately apparent. The landscape evocatively showcases how you've traveled into a new world; one where rhinos roam free and elephants tower above the airstrip. And the first experience on the savanna quickly helps to shift many people's perspective on Africa; this is not merely a continent to visit and experience, but one to intimately connect with. From a giraffe elegantly wandering by to a zebra herd beside your suite, the Kruger savanna immediately invites you into a realm untouched by time. It feels like animals are everywhere, either in sight or the sounds that reverberate across the bushland. Your first luxury safari lodge overlooks the Sand River, and there are dozens of different species roaming freely on the surrounding savanna. Just sit back, sip on a welcome cocktail, and watch the procession of mammals tentatively drinking in big cat country. An afternoon game drive provides a close-up, and when dinner is served under the stars, there's a sense of making a connection that can't be found elsewhere in the world. The Sabi Sands is a short flight from Johannesburg, and a representative will assist with the transfer between planes at O. R. Tambo International.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands – Big Game Encounters
dayInfo.description: As the iconic African sun pierces the horizon, you're out on the savanna, trailing a lion pride in hunting mode. Six lionesses work together, exchanging stealth for a group attempt at a breakfast buffalo. They harass the herd, snapping at the fringes before getting chased away by large males. Their prize is hidden behind the fur and horns, a young buffalo calf being carefully protected by the herd. Getting trampled by a buffalo would mean certain death, but the lionesses keep coming, pulling the herd in different directions, a few brave hunters dragging out the wrath of the biggest males. Then there's a flurry of dust and a haunting cry, three lionesses bringing down their target. Yet the battle isn't over. As you watch transfixed, the buffalo charge the lions, attempting to save their calf. For another hour the scene plays out, made even more dramatic by a pack of hyenas on the prowl. As safari in the Kruger promises, you're not just sightseeing, but immersing yourself in the rhythms of the wild. On a Kruger game drive, there are moments of charm, like watching rhinos or giraffes slowly walk past the vehicle. And then there are snippets of drama, like a lion hunt or two herds battling at a waterhole. Nothing is predictable, and this is part of the immersion; one moment you're following a leopard, the next moment you're surrounded by a noisy baboon troop. A safari is not like being at the zoo. You don't pass a cage knowing that a certain animal will be there. Instead, you escape into the wild and allow the landscape to surprise you. Soon, any notions of the Big Five have been replaced by the beauty of connecting with the wild. Over these two days, you enjoy morning and afternoon game drives, punctuated by a few hours of quiet time to let the heat of the day pass by. Your suite has a private plunge pool, ideal for cooling off and watching the life at the river. A private terrace continues the sense of escapism, with uninterrupted views dotted with wildlife. Monkeys and baboons swing past; elephants roam just meters below, and a myriad of exotic birds land beside you. Safari is certainly an adventure, but few people predict the utter serenity when it's just you and the Kruger savanna.

dayInfo.title: MalaMala Game Reserve – Safari in Africa's Premier Private Reserve
dayInfo.description: After a short game drive transfer, you settle into your next property on MalaMala, an exotic world amidst the forest on the banks of the Sand River. There's a certain air of romance and exclusivity here, where varied wildlife can be viewed from a private plunge pool and your suite seems to be hidden in the wild heart of Africa. MalaMala is a large private reserve, only accessible to guests staying at one of its three camps. Drivers are permitted to take you off the trail, so game drives bring an even more inspiring proximity to the wildlife. For example, you see a leopard high in the tree and the driver bumps over the grass until you're just a few meters away. Like the landscape you just left, this is big cat country, and the encounters come thick and fast. Cheetahs disappear into the grass then emerge in a flurry of dust; hyenas scowl as they seek a meal, joining jackals and vultures in picking at bloodied, discarded carcasses. Sometimes you see a lion pride lazing in the sun, snoozing with eyes ever alert for what's moving on their savanna. On other occasions, you follow a rare caracal as it journeys beneath the moonlight. At MalaMala, you're not restricted to exploring during the day. Nighttime drives enable you to see nocturnal creatures and further mystical encounters between predator and prey. There's also an option to go on a walking safari with an armed ranger, another way to keep bringing new safari experiences after four or five days in the savanna. The daily itinerary is flexible, and you can pick and choose between the activities. Along with the big cats, the Kruger is also a celebrated haven of Africa's giants. Around 10,000 rhinos occupy the savanna, and they quickly become a highlight, especially in the quieter and private world of MalaMala. Elephants are hard to miss, and you might find one passing the camp at sundown as you sip on a cocktail. Hippos spend their day in the river below, their gaping jaws a mesmerizing display of power. Yet perhaps your finest safari memories come from something very personal; a private show of affection between two zebras, a kudu nursing her calf, maybe a hairless baby baboon carried on her mother's stomach. When you escape to a world like the Kruger, such inspiring moments further cement your connection with the wild. The next day, a final game drive is a bonus chance to savor the last safari memories. Perhaps two rhinos in the bush, giants with a grace that matches their imposing bulk. Maybe a leopard, the furtive hunter keeping you spellbound as she dips her neck and disappears in the grass. Or an adorable zebra herd, an ancient elephant bull, a hundred springbok skipping elegantly across the grasslands. Return from the drive for a second breakfast before you transfer to the Skukuza airstrip for the one-hour flight to Johannesburg. You'll spend the night at a boutique getaway in the old colonial suburb of Houghton. A driver-guide is at your disposal and the afternoon can be tailored towards your interests, from wine tasting in private cellars to the colors of the city's urban forest or sundowner cocktails.

dayInfo.title: Vamizi Island – Flying Out to Corals and White Sand
dayInfo.description: Flying between the city and beach is relatively easy, with a scheduled flight to Pemba connecting with a charter flight to Vamizi Island. You land in the Quirimbas Archipelago, on an island that's dominated by thick indigenous forest. The island is only shared by a maximum of 12 guests and the canopy further enhances notions of privacy. Your suite cascades down onto the white sand, and you could go days without seeing anyone else but the attentive personal butler. Settle in, dip into your pool, brush your toes in the sand and float on the turquoise waters of the Indian Ocean. Like when on safari, your package is fully inclusive of meals and selected drinks.

dayInfo.title: Vamizi Island – Sensual Private Island Escape in the Quirimbas Archipelago
dayInfo.description: Vamizi reflects all the revered images of an Indian Ocean island escape. There's the white sand, fringed by vibrant corals and snorkeling opportunities. Next, the ocean laced with a divine blur of tropical colors. A forest backdrop adds another hue and the soothing sights are complemented by the islands' sounds; wind is rustling softly, waves lapping lightly, the odd exotic bird tweeting from the high branches. Mozambique has 2,000 miles of white sand coastline, along with a suite of islands cast adrift in the ocean. It's a country that remains off most travel radars, yet provides a compelling getaway into a realm untouched by modernity. Vamizi is an island where you take off the shoes and never put them back on, a place where time has no meaning and the day slips along with the utmost of tranquility. As you might expect on a private island, the accommodation adds a further haven of luxury. Expect a spacious suite with multiple places to rest and relax, along with a private pool and deck overlooking the beach. Spend your time lazing away the day and then add in one of the activities. Perhaps a deep-sea fishing trip, maybe snorkeling or diving on the surrounding reefs, or it could be sailing away in a traditional wooden dhow, with the captain timing your departure for a serene Indian Ocean sunset.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg – Departure from Africa
dayInfo.description: Exquisite aerial views dominate the short flight from Vamizi Island to Pemba, with the colors of the Indian Ocean blurring beneath the wingtips, turquoise to green to the lush flowing blue of the distant oceanic abyss to the east. Connect onto a scheduled flight in Pemba and fly back to Johannesburg, where you're greeted by a representative and transferred to your international departure.

tourName: Cape Town Culture & History Tour
placesVisited: Cape Town, Robben Island, Stellenbosch
generalInfo: South Africa is a premier destination for luxury travel as it boasts immaculate wildlife encounters and world-class sightseeing experiences. The country has a profound historical past which forms a significant foundation of its global appeal. The country’s diverse culture shines through the significant heritage sights and attractions that are located in its oldest city, Cape Town. On this immersive tour of the metropolitan city, as you explore the prominent points of interest, you will trace back the roots of this historic nation and discover what makes Cape Town such a thrilling location to visit.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Luxury Living by the Sea
dayInfo.description: You will land in the energetic city of Cape Town alongside an array of eager travelers and cultural enthusiasts. Your extensive exploration of the city will begin as you leave the airport. From the comfort of your private transfer, you will witness the diverse Western Cape landscape as you journey to the heart of the city. You will pass by agricultural towns and remote rural areas as you approach its center. Nearing the Nelson Mandela Boulevard, you will witness the mighty Table Mountain reaching towards the clouds. You will wrap around the mountain range and dip down into the bustling streets of Cape Town. Shortly after, you will reach your luxury accommodation in the renowned V&A Waterfront. After a seamless check-in, you will find yourself gazing out at the incredible ocean views from your private balcony that overlooks the waterfront and surrounding areas. This exquisite room will serve as an idyllic resting spot to conclude your culturally immersive adventures each day. The late-setting sun will still be shining in the sky, giving you the perfect opportunity to explore the waterfront and become acclimated to the exuberant city before nightfall. From your hotel lobby, you will meet your knowledgeable guide and venture to the port for a brief, yet fascinating tour of the V&A that will reveal insight into the city’s colonial past. You will visit a harbor museum and associated landmarks, which capture the European influence over the city. This influence and deep-rooted South African traditions will culminate into a riveting display of history and modernity that underpin many facets of the Cape Town lifestyle. You will bring the tour to an ideal close with a fine-dining sunset cruise. As you gently float along the Atlantic Ocean, you will enjoy freshly caught seafood dishes, and you will truly delight in the harbor side city’s rich cuisine as you witness the majestic sunset over the distant horizon. After which, you will transfer to the shore and return to your cozy room for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – A Captivating Discovery of Cape Culture
dayInfo.description: You will rise the next morning to sweeping ocean views, eager for the adventure ahead. While the hotel prepares an elegant breakfast for you each morning, on this day you will privately transfer to a leading morning market for an indulging taste of traditional South African food and treats. The sought-after farmers market, which is located nearby your hotel, is a public passion project that is driven by eco-conscious agricultural philosophies. You will find an assortment of locally-run business stalls that sell environmentally-friendly, authentic foods and goods to the hundreds of people that attend every weekend. From the smell of freshly squeezed fruit juice to the delightfully salty flavors of Biltong , which is South African cured and dried meat, the market will tantalize your taste buds in true South African fashion. With gorgeous views of the ocean and like-minded travelers to meet, you will be thoroughly entertained throughout your exploration of the morning market. Afterward, you will transfer to your hotel and meet your private guide for the day. Your guide, who will be exceptionally well-versed in Cape Town history, will eagerly transfer you to the city’s impressive cultural landmarks. Moreover, your guide will offer in-depth insight into the region’s rich, historical roots. The journey will take you to premier destinations such as the Bo Kaap. Here, you will capture vivid pictures of the brightly colored Cape Malay houses that are nestled at the base of Signal Hill. The historical area, which has recently received heritage protection, immaculately highlights age-old Cape living. From the streets, wafts of spicy curries will surround you, and the magnificent Table Mountain will tower over you. After fully immersing yourself, you will continue through to many more prominent landmarks and destinations where you will weave your way through the winding Cape roads that lie along the base of the mountain, visiting recognized memorials and witnessing scenic settings. Last but not least, the tour will transfer you to Signal Hill. After a short climb up the hill, you will be welcomed by a 360-degree view of the entire city. You will enjoy a delightful, evening picnic after learning more about the location. From these great heights, you will witness a picture-perfect sunset as hang gliders leap off the majestic hill and soar across the sky. Later this evening, you will make your way to a leading Cape Town restaurant for an elaborate, gourmet meal.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Remarkable Robben Island
dayInfo.description: Today, you will wake up feeling completely refreshed and enjoy a hearty start to the morning with a delicious breakfast spread at your hotel. Today, you will learn a great deal more about the country’s remarkable history. From your lobby, you will enjoy a leisurely stroll to the port where you will board a cruise that is bound for the famous Robben Island. The UNESCO World Heritage Site is home to the cell where former South African president, Nelson Mandela, spent 18 years of his imprisonment. Now, a must-visit monument to the great man and the story of his life, this dramatic trip to Robben Island will fill you with great admiration for the lengths that exceptional people will go to protect their nations and their people. During this tour, you will encounter the major significant sites that are situated around the island. Your cultured tour guide will share intriguing stories about the city’s tumultuous past and impressive achievements. The valuable educational experience will be complete with gorgeous views of the Western Cape shores and encounters with various local wildlife. After a thorough exploration and the culmination of the tour at Nelson Mandela’s cell, you will board the cruise ship and head to land. After arriving, you will transfer to your hotel for the afternoon at your leisure where you can take the opportunity to lounge in comfort around the pool or enjoy a South African Afternoon tea that is complete with traditional snacks and delicacies. Later today, you will transfer to the base of Table Mountain. As it exudes its imposing glory, you will hop into a Cable Car and climb to the top of the mountain. Here, amongst the clouds, you will witness breathtaking, panoramic views of the entire city and the greater Cape region. You will witness stunning moments on top of the mountain as you peer down to the seemingly tiny city. Before you make your way back down, you will relish in a fine-dining experience from these great heights, and you will allow the evening to slowly pass by as you indulge all of your senses. Finally, you will journey down the mountain and return to your room for a night in peaceful luxury.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Southernmost Tip of Africa
dayInfo.description: Many distinct Cape suburbs sprawl across the region, each offering entirely unique cultural experiences that are rooted in their individual history. The fourth day of your trip will be spent broadening your cultural Cape horizons with an engaging exploration of these essential destinations. After fueling up on a scrumptious breakfast at your hotel, you will meet your private tour guide and venture out for an in-depth Cape Peninsula Tour. This cultural excursion will take you along the winding coastal roads that lead through lush forests, along rugged mountainsides, and down to brilliant beaches. The beauty of this enriching tour will be highlighted by the wondrous wildlife and stunning scenery that you will witness on the way to the celebrated Cape of Good Hope. En route, you will discover premier destinations including Hout Bay and Boulders Beach. You can take this opportunity to tuck into the traditional South African fish and chips, which will be caught fresh that same day. Furthermore, you will enjoy the warmer waters of the Indian Ocean and swim alongside African penguins at Boulders Beach. These, as well as a scenic drive along the endearing Chapman’s Peak route, are just a few of the highlights you will experience during your journey. The excitement of the trip will culminate once you arrive at the Cape of Good Hope, the southernmost tip of Africa. Here, where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans meet, you will soak up the splendor of the wildlife that surrounds you. The cool breeze will swoop down the magnificent mountain ranges and whip out into the ocean where waves ebb and flow against the shore. The serene setting will serve as an idyllic location to capture lifelong memories. After your thoroughly enthusing day around the Cape Peninsula, you will transfer to your guesthouse that will be located in the valley of Cape Town’s most coveted beachside suburb: Llandudno. The premier beach will be situated off the beaten track, accessible via a single road that leads down into the valley. For this reason, it will be the perfect getaway destination for the evening. Llandudno’s beauty is highlighted by its pristine, crystal-clear waters and smooth boulder cliffs that enclose the bay on both sides. On this afternoon, you will walk out of your luxurious guesthouse onto the sand and sit comfortably under the shade of the nearby rocks where you will enjoy the refreshing embrace of the Atlantic Ocean and delight in the leisurely time to unwind. In the evening, you will transfer to Camps Bay for a gorgeous sunset that will be paired with exquisite cocktails. The elegant and fashion-forward suburb boasts some of Cape Town’s best haute cuisine restaurants for you to choose from for your evening meal. After which, you will return to your guesthouse in Llandudno for a peaceful sleep away from the crowds.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Flavors of the Cape
dayInfo.description: A huge part of Cape Town’s rich culture is showcased in its divine food and delicious beverages. Served humbly at traditional eateries or meticulously curated at upper-class establishments, the food and beverage scene offers a range of exquisite experiences. On your fifth day, you will discover all of Cape Town’s best dishes with an extensive cultural food tour. You will begin your journey immediately in the morning and skip the breakfast spread at your hotel to save precious time. Once picked up by your private transfer, you will venture to the many marvelous dining spots. Your first stop will be a leading coffee roaster in the city center. Here, you will taste a few of their premium blends that will be accompanied by South African pastries and snacks. After which, you will travel to Cape Town’s premier biscuit mill for a taste of some of its finer, fashionable boutique foods. All the while, you will take in the diverse scenes and mingle with other enthusiastic travelers and locals. You will journey to an established, award-winning restaurant for lunch and get the opportunity to meet the head chef behind the classy cuisine. Your behind-the-scenes look into Cape Town’s food culture will end perfectly with a trip to a traditional Shisa nyama , which is a Zulu phrase that loosely translates to braai or barbecue. The local hotspot, which is situated in a Cape Town township, will give you the opportunity to immerse yourself in authentic South African living. Surrounded by friendly faces and like-minded foodies, you will feel completely welcome at this sought-after Shisa nyama . In the afternoon, you will briefly return to your hotel before meeting your private transfer and setting off once again. This time, you will discover the city’s vibrant art culture. You will journey to leading galleries of both traditional and contemporary art. One of the highlights of this tour will be a visit to the Zeitz MOCAA, which is a riveting art museum that has been dedicated to contemporary African art. If this day happens to be the first Thursday of the month, or if you specifically request this, then you will experience the entertaining First Thursday Cape Town Initiative. On this day, the city becomes an energetic ode to art where restaurants and galleries open up their doors freely for an evening of artistic appreciation. Otherwise, you will be just as thrilled continuing your extensive tour of the city’s leading arts and cultural museums.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – A Taste of the Best
dayInfo.description: On the sixth day of your trip, you will enjoy a scenic drive out of the city limits into the Stellenbosch countryside after a satisfying breakfast to begin your day. Stellenbosch, although experiencing rapid growth over the past few decades, is an enchanting town whose architecture exquisitely reflects its old-world charm. Its Dutch-colonial influence can still be prominently seen, and you will bask in the opportunity to witness the marvelous cultural highlights in and around the town. Your private transfer will then take you on a tour of the pinnacle Stellenbosch attraction for its world-famous wine route. You will transfer to the town’s premier, renowned wine estates and delight in distinguished blends and vintages at each destination. Accompanied by a selection of cured meats and cheeses, each tasting will truly invigorate all of your senses. Your tasting guides will offer insight into each bottle as well as the deep cultural roots and heritage of the estates and their owners. The historically-inclined tasting tour along Stellenbosch’s famous wine route is a one-of-a-kind cultural experience just outside of Cape Town that is not to be missed. As you sip away at each wine, you will witness the stunning views of the extensive vineyards and mountain ranges in the distance. Then, you will delight in an elegantly served supper at a prestigious estate to bring the indulgent day to a close. Shortly afterward, you will transfer back to your tranquil abode in Llandudno for one last evening by the sea where you can soak up the surroundings and breathe in the fresh oceanic air as you drift off to sleep.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – A Journey of Growth
dayInfo.description: Before you set off back home, there will be one last must-visit destination to experience. You will enjoy a delicious breakfast at one of the city’s foremost beachside cafes. Then, your private transfer will take you to the reputable Kirstenbosch Gardens for a morning among the wilderness. Here, you will have a few hours to bask in the scenic Western Cape settings. Nestled at the base of Table Mountain, the massive national botanical garden is home to an abundance of diverse flora and fauna. You can explore the intriguing plant life that is native to the region as you weave your way through the enchanting paths in the gardens. As you go deeper into the park, you will encounter picturesque views of the greenery around you and intricate flowers that are in full bloom. The wondrous wildlife will offer a truly peaceful and gratifying way to end your culturally immersive journey through the Cape. After your splendid morning, you will transfer to Cape Town International Airport where you will say your goodbyes to the vibrant city. Unfortunately, you will know have to jet off into the sky with only irreplaceable memories of this city’s remarkable history.

tourName: Cape Town Vacation: Explore the Greater Western Cape
placesVisited: Cape Town, Hermanus, Montagu, Franschhoek
generalInfo: Cape Town is an incredibly diverse city that marvelously blends cultural heritage and modern sophistication. The landscape is immaculate with striking mountain ranges and sprawling greenery that provides impressive vistas at each of its premier destinations. During this captivating, 9-day tour of Cape Town and the greater Western Cape region, you will discover South Africa’s true splendor. From the region’s intriguing, historical landmarks to magnificent Big Five safaris, this tailor-made, luxurious tour showcases what makes the Cape such a special location to visit.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Welcome to the Mother City
dayInfo.description: Cape Town is a vibrant metropolitan city that is surrounded by magnificent mountain ranges, luscious green landscapes, and crystal-clear oceans. You will witness these picturesque scenes as you descend towards the thriving Cape Town International Airport. Upon arrival, you will meet your private transfer and be effortlessly whisked away to the heart of South Africa’s first city. During the short journey, the striking sights of Table Mountain and turquoise oceans that lap against the shoreline will captivate you. You will soon arrive at your 5-star accommodation in the exuberant Waterfront district. Make yourself completely comfortable in your private suite as you soak up the cool ocean breeze and listen to the waves gently rumble against the port. After taking some time to unwind, you will enjoy a stroll around the spirited V&A Waterfront. The thriving destination boasts a wealth of high-end stores and exquisite restaurants. Colorful keepsakes will catch your eyes as you weave your way through the bustling market, and the aromas of fresh seafood on the grill will enliven all of your senses. There will be so much to explore in this lively location. Dinner by candlelight, under the gaze of the remarkable Table Mountain, will conclude a perfect arrival in South Africa’s Mother City.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Uncover South Africa's History
dayInfo.description: You will begin the day with a delicious breakfast at your exemplary hotel. You will enjoy the country’s best breakfast dishes before readying yourselves for the adventure ahead. A private guide will meet you in the lobby and transfer you to Cape Town’s pivotal heritage sights and sightseeing locations. The historical tour will shed light on the city’s role in the riveting transformation of South Africa. You will spend the morning exploring spectacular museums and exhibits in and around the city center, and your knowledgeable tour guide will impart valuable insight throughout your trip. You will return to your hotel with a deep admiration for South Africa’s rich heritage and the extraordinary individuals who pioneered this positive change. In the afternoon, you will board a cruise ship and transfer to the world-famous UNESCO Heritage Site of Robben Island. Accompanied by a knowledgeable tour guide, you will uncover all of South Africa’s crucial historical highlights. The in-depth tour will culminate with a trip to Nelson Mandela’s former prison cell. Here, you will be swept away by his iconic life story. Return to the port later today and, soon after, you will board a luxury cruise ship for dinner. Calmly gliding across the gentle ocean, you will bask in the stunning vistas of the setting African sun while you indulge in a multiple-course, gourmet meal. This picture-perfect, seaside supper will bring your sensational day to a close.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Art and Culture of Cape Town
dayInfo.description: Cape Town is a diverse destination that boasts an abundance of significant cultural landmarks. From eclectic art galleries to eco-conscious farmers markets, your third day will be spent experiencing these essential attractions. Shortly after a delicious continental breakfast, you will venture to a charming market that is set amongst the gorgeous ocean backdrop. Boutique stores will sprawl across the wood chip floor, and many of them will serve delectable South African snacks while others present intricate local art and ornaments. After shopping to your heart’s content, you will journey to the city’s world-renowned galleries. Distinguished contemporary art exhibitions and long-established galleries are dotted around the city. You will visit the quintessential ones that highlight the incredible local talent and meticulous South African crafts. The sheer brilliance of Cape Town’s thriving creative scene emanates from these world-class points of interest. Then, you will make your way to the welcoming little village known as the Old Biscuit Mill. This fashionable boutique destination represents local creativity and collaboration in its purest form. The colorful displays and delectable cuisine will keep you thoroughly engaged throughout. In the evening, you will transfer to a premier, seaside restaurant. Your journey will take you along the famous Chapman’s Peak Route. From the rugged cliffs of the peak, you will capture unforgettable moments alongside the magnificent mountains. The day will culminate with a 5-star dining experience that overlooks the beautiful Hout Bay suburb.

dayInfo.title: Hermanus – The Whale Coast Route
dayInfo.description: Although there are many marvelous destinations to explore beyond the city limits, at this point in your journey, you will have explored many of Cape Town’s leading historical and cultural sites You will begin the morning with a superb breakfast. After which, you will check-out of your hotel and meet your private transfer. Sporting a luxurious vehicle for absolute peace and comfort, your dignified guide will invite you on a life-changing drive through the scenic Western Cape landscape. Your transfer will stick along the beautiful coastal strip of road that leads to your next destination. This stretch of road is famously known as the Whale Coast Route. Venturing towards the charming seaside town of Hermanus, you will revel in uninterrupted vistas of the ocean and mountain peaks. Along the way, you will stop off at an iconic whale watching destination. Here, with breathtaking views of the ocean, you will have the opportunity to spot pods of hundreds of dolphins and many whales that surface above the water. It will be a sight like no other, so be sure to plan this trip around the peak whale watching season, which is typically between July and November. The marvelous coastal drive will lead to the former fishing village of Hermanus. Today, the destination is a thriving hub of travel because of its whale-watching heritage and splendid surroundings. Despite the influx of interest, it continues to retain its immaculate old-world charm and endearing appeal. You will check-in to your exquisite 5-star hotel upon arrival. With far-stretching greenery around you and the turquoise ocean ebbing and flowing nearby, you will relish in the town’s delightful tranquility. A fabulous seafood meal will round off your spectacular day.

dayInfo.title: Hermanus – The Ocean's Splendor
dayInfo.description: Known for its whale-watching spectacles, a trip to Hermanus would be incomplete without a close encounter of the majestic sea creatures. After indulging in a fine breakfast at your hotel, you will transfer to the marina and board a classy ocean vessel where you will venture out to sea for uninterrupted views of the marine life should the weather permit. While the main attractions are the magnificent whales, which often move up close to the boat, you will also spot an abundance of other creatures. Dolphins and seals will coast along the water while birds hover above in the skies. Your knowledgeable crew will share information about the stunning sea life while you witness it all. A delectable lunch will satisfy your taste buds upon your arrival in the harbor. After which, you will visit the city’s leading museums where you will delve into the history of the town and encounter many impressive artifacts. A final stop at the significant lighthouses will highlight Hermanus’ surrounding beauty. From the top of these traditional buildings, you can capture a 360-degree view of your picturesque destination. To conclude your adventurous day, you will delight in gourmet cuisine while the sunset illuminates the sky.

dayInfo.title: Montagu – The Untamed Wilderness
dayInfo.description: Today, you will wake up to the serene sounds of the Hermanus wilderness. Take the morning slow, enjoying a final few hours at the idyllic seaside town. You will transfer to an exquisite local cafe for breakfast where you may capture the scenic vistas in their sun-soaked glory. The fresh breeze that rolls off the ocean will invigorate you as you prepare for your departure. Your private transfer will collect you for a glorious drive to Montagu. From the comfort of your luxurious vehicle, you will witness the Western Cape’s endless beauty. The breathtaking passes on route to Montagu will offer the most unforgettable moments. You will arrive at your destination in the Klein Karoo of Montagu, which is nestled at the base of the towering mountain ranges. Here, you will delight in a luxury safari getaway. Over the next two days, you will be treated to sights of the country’s wondrous wildlife and sprawling landscapes. In the evenings, you will return to your prestigious 5-star lodge for a peaceful night’s sleep. Shortly after checking in, you will meet your qualified ranger for a sunset safari in search of the Big Five. You will journey through the nature reserves diverse biomes as you learn more about the lodge’s environmentally-friendly practices and the wildlife in the area. Birds will whistle from the trees, bucks will rustle through the veld, elephants will trump across the land, and leopards can be spotted in the trees. As the sun sets and the stars begin to twinkle, you will feel worlds away from home. You will return to your lodge for a fine-dining experience in anticipation for the day ahead. If you have not seen all of the Big Five, then tomorrow will be dedicated to completing your list.

dayInfo.title: Montagu – Paradise in the Valley
dayInfo.description: On your seventh day, you will rise to the sounds of the untamed wilderness around you. From your private balcony, you will have unhindered views of the greater Klein Karoo landscape. You will meet your private ranger first thing in the morning for a sunrise safari. On this expedition through the wilderness, you will have the opportunity to discover any of the Big Five that you may have missed in addition to other incredible and indigenous species. Along the way, you will uncover what makes this region so special. The vast quartz fields, succulent shrubs, and unique wildlife habitats contribute to a largely untouched natural environment that is unique to South Africa. After capturing the wildlife in its element, you will spend a few hours relaxing at your serene lodge before meeting your private transfer and venturing to your next destination: Franschhoek. You will continue to enjoy the rich Western Cape habitats on route to the beautiful town of Franschhoek. Even the most incredibly captured images pale in comparison to seeing it for yourself. After a completely comfortable drive, you will arrive at your stunning 5-star guesthouse in the town. Looking out over the lush greenery and wrapping vineyards, the destination will highlight the momentous beauty of Cape Town. The long-standing buildings’ endearing architecture and carefully crafted wine farms will be a sight to behold. You will have the opportunity to learn more about the Huguenot Settlers as you journey to exceptionally well-kept museums in the area. Finally, your day will conclude with a fine-dining evening that is spent gazing out over the Cape.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek – An Award-Winning Adventure
dayInfo.description: You will spend the morning of your eighth day at your own pace. You can enjoy a ravishing breakfast spread before soaking up the African sun. In the early afternoon, your private transfer will meet you in the lobby, and you will be welcomed by an elegant chauffeur who will direct you to an impressively restored vintage vehicle. The luxuriously pristine automobile will take you through Franschhoek’s incredible mountain pass before arriving at a premier wine estate. You will spend the afternoon exploring the delectable tastes of the leading estates finest blends and vintages. As you sip on each wine, your cultured taste guide will share notes on the bottles. Accompanied by a charcuterie board and beautiful views of the greater Western Cape, you will feel completely relaxed during your stay. After your delightful wine tasting, you will further explore the surrounding area. The magnificent mountain ranges that tower in the distance, the endless rolling hills that spread across the landscape, and the deep blue ocean in all its majesty will fight for your undivided attention. You will revel in every moment along the way, and your tour will end at a gourmet, Michelin-style establishment. Here, you will meet the mastermind chef behind the award-winning restaurant’s best dishes and awaken your senses to the wonderful flavors.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – A Flawless Farewell to Cape Town
dayInfo.description: In the morning, as you wake up in the tranquil Franschhoek Valley, you will be embraced by the warm sun. Though you will bid your farewells on this final day of your tour, the memories of the marvelous destination will stay with you forever. You will bring the journey to a flawless close with a spectacular breakfast at a leading restaurant nearby. After which, you will meet your private transfer and make your way to the airport. Though it will be very bittersweet to be leaving, you will feel utterly fulfilled and depart with stories of your grand adventure. Until next time, Cape Town and the greater Western Cape region will eagerly await your return.

tourName: Cape Town Vacation for Lovers: Most Romantic Destinations
placesVisited: Cape Town, Stellenbosch, Franschhoek, Simondium
generalInfo: The Western Cape province of South Africa is a diverse region that is teeming with picturesque landscapes and magnificent mountain ranges. The heart of the province, Cape Town, is a sophisticated city that is nestled at the base of the towering Table Mountain. It is surrounded by pristine Blue Flag beaches and far-stretching green Winelands. On this intimate 8-day expedition, you and your partner will enjoy a luxurious tour of the city’s prestigious landmarks and enchanting destinations. Together, soak up the serene scenic splendor and tuck into revered South African cuisine. You will capture lifelong memories on this unforgettably authentic and romantic tour Cape Town that is sure to be remembered forever.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Capture Memories from Great Heights
dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Cape Town International Airport, you will be welcomed by the warm African sun. After collecting your things, you will meet your private transfer for a scenic drive to your first destination where you will witness the wondrous region in all its glory as you comfortably journey to the heart of the city. Table Mountain stands mightily tall in the middle of Cape Town, with roads and buildings that are wrapped around its base. You will transfer around the mountain and through the bustling streets as you travel to the pristine Camps Bay area. Camps Bay is renowned for its premier restaurants and luxurious beach. Here, you will explore the stylish cultural scene and tuck into delicious cuisine. You will arrive at your lavish 5-star accommodation that overlooks the ocean, and your intimate suite will offer breathtaking views from the comfort of your private balcony. Furthermore, your elegant hotel boasts first-class amenities to enjoy when you return from your romantic adventures. Once you have made yourselves comfortable, you will journey to the V&A Waterfront for a charming afternoon. The fashionable waterfront boasts opulent stores and extravagant restaurants, and you will enjoy exploring the surrounding area, purchasing high-end items and fine-dining on immaculate cuisine. After which, you will visit Cape Town’s leading contemporary African art museum where the amazing pieces will inspire and fill you with great admiration for African art. The displays will be immersive and engaging, keeping you thoroughly entertained throughout. After the rich, cultural discovery of African art, you will transfer to the base of the magnificent Table Mountain. A Cable Car will lift you into the sky as you reach for the top of the mountain. Once you arrive, you will be met with endless views of the Western Cape. You and your loved one will capture unforgettable moments together as you gaze upon the vibrant city below. As the sun begins to set, you will make yourselves comfortable at a gourmet cafe on top of the mountain. With sushi platters, fine wines, and South African cheese boards on the menu, you will delight in the romantic dining experience on top of the world. Afterward, you will make your way down the mountain and transfer back to your peaceful room on the shores of the city’s elite seaside suburb.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – An Endearing Day of Nature and Culture
dayInfo.description: The morning markets that are sprawled in abundance across the city streets will offer an enchanting way to start your day. You may choose to delve into your hotel’s sumptuous breakfast spread or save space for the delicate treats that you will discover at the market. You will meet your private transfer who will take you to Cape Town’s foremost boutique farmers market. The eco-conscious market is home to an assortment of local businesses. Weaving your way through the bustling stalls, you will have the opportunity to taste exquisitely seasoned Biltong , which is South African cured and dried meat, and meticulously crafted traditional tarts. These will be but a few of the delightful foods on offer at this pleasantly friendly and exuberant market. Furthermore, the experience will be accompanied by breathtaking views of the ocean. You and your partner will delight in authentic South African delicacies as you take in this scenic splendor. From here, you will venture to the city’s national botanical gardens that are nestled at the base of Table Mountain. The striking park is home to thousands of indigenous plants and an array of wonderful wildlife. It is an immense garden with winding paths that will lead you to picturesque settings. The stunning Protea garden, for example, offers an exemplary display of the country’s national flower and plant family, and the Centenary Tree Canopy Walkway will take you from the forest floor up above the canopy for panoramic views of the gardens and mountain range. With a picnic basket full of delightful snacks and a comfortable blanket to rest on, you will spend the morning leisurely soaking up the sun. Later today, you will transfer to Signal Hill for a remarkable sunset spectacle. As the setting sun illuminates the sky, paragliders will leap from the great heights and soar to the mountain floor. You will marvel at the endearing sights before returning to your hotel. From your hotel, you will transfer to one of Cape Town’s eloquent theatres where a remarkable performance will provide enthralling entertainment while the elegant establishment serves you and your loved one an excellent meal. This genuinely romantic night out will perfectly round off your day of adventure.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Western Cape Coastline at its Finest
dayInfo.description: You will begin your day with an exquisite breakfast at your hotel. After which, you will transfer to the vibrant Old Biscuit Mill in the heart of the Woodstock area. A thriving hub of local design and cuisine, the destination will warmly capture Cape Town’s talented cultural scene. Amid the energetic little village, you will browse galleries that showcase stunning art and stalls that sell intricate goods. The creative displays will passionately embrace your every interest. After exploring all the mill has to offer, you will meet your private transfer for a guided tour of the greater Cape Town area. You will embark on a tour of the Cape Peninsula that is equal insightful as it is beautiful. Along the extensive coastal route, you will discover captivating vistas and significant points of interest in addition to exploring the city’s famous suburbs as your knowledgeable guide articulates the remarkable history of the Cape. The highlights of this tour are too many and too superb to capture in perfect detail. However, you and your loved will journey along the rugged Chapman’s Peak route with picture-perfect sights of the marvelous mountain range where you will wade in the waters with African penguins at Boulders Beach. The culmination of the tour will be a pivotal stop at the magnificent Cape of Good Hope. The destination, which is encompassed by striking mountains and deep blue flowing oceans, will serve up the most beautiful moments. Here, at the southernmost tip of Africa, you will witness the endearing meeting point of the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. You will continue on your loveable coastal tour of the regions astounding heritage sites before making your way back to your hotel. Before the sun fades and the moon illuminates the sky, you will venture to Cape Town’s pristine promenade. You and your partner will hop on bicycles and enjoy a stately ride along the Sea Point promenade. With the wind in your hair and all worries behind you, the delightful cruise will invigorate your bodies and minds. You will park your bicycles at the Sea Point junction and marvel at the immaculate African sunset by the sea. After which, you will stroll to a coveted restaurant nearby for a gourmet multiple course candlelit meal.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek – Take Flight over the Winelands
dayInfo.description: You will wake early on your fourth day before the sun has risen for another ravishing morning of romantic adventure. You will journey, via private transfer, to the famous Stellenbosch area. Here, you and your partner will board a 2-person private hot-air balloon. The balloon will rumble into gear at sunrise, and you will slowly fly up above the lush green fields. At nearly 1,000 feet in the air, you will be astounded at the surreal vistas of the vast Western Cape region. In the distance, Table Mountain will show off its might, and vineyards will creep across the land below. It will be a sight to behold, and you will capture the dream-like experience throughout your journey, especially on this hot air balloon ride. You will complete the 60-minute voyage in true style with a celebratory glass of exquisite sparkling wine for when you land. After which, you will be treated to a delectable breakfast at a stylish estate that will be set amongst the gorgeous vineyards. After breakfast, you will delight in a tour of Stellenbosch’s rich heritage with an inside look at the incredible Dutch-colonial architecture. You will be completely engrossed by the small town’s old-world charm. Later today, you will encounter the renowned area's finest wines where a private wine tour of the most elite estates will allow you to bask in luxury as you sip on premier vintages and blends. Your guided taste tour will include insightful knowledge on the history of winemaking in the area as well as a behind-the-scenes look at some of the leading estates’ winemaking processes. On this expedition, you will uncover the secrets that make Stellenbosch so special. In the late afternoon, you will transfer to your luxury accommodation in the Franschhoek Valley. This sought-after destination is home to more of Western Cape’s prestigious age-old wine farms and will be teeming with wildlife. The incredible destination will also offer a wealth of history to explore. The following day, you will share in all of it and more, and this evening, you may take the opportunity to unwind together. Soak up the surroundings and delve into an elegant Michelin-starred dinner to bring the gorgeous day to an end.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek – A Vintage Journey like No Other
dayInfo.description: You will begin your morning with a marvelous breakfast before encountering the wondrous natural Franschhoek environment. A chauffeur-driven vintage car will be waiting for you at the lobby after your breakfast. You will step inside the tasteful vehicle for a dignified private tour of the surrounding area that will be led by your experienced guide. You will journey along the distinguished Franschhoek Pass and view the destination from stunning heights. Shortly after, you will arrive at the Valley’s impressive Nature Reserve for an intimate walk with spectacular wildlife sightings. While you have enjoyed the world-class wines at Stellenbosch’s premier estates, the Franschhoek Valley has an impressive collection of its own. This afternoon, you will visit the destination’s leading estate for an exquisite lunch, wine tasting experience, and cellar tour. As you indulge in each glass, you will let the nature around you sweep both of you away. The blissful spectacles of the vast green fields and rugged mountain ranges will instill calm within. With a glass or two of outstanding sparkling wine to cap off the afternoon, you will leave completely refreshed. Afterward, you will stop by a historical museum and monument, which pay tribute to the French Huguenot people that settled in the area decades ago. The beautiful displays valiantly represent the people and their influence over the region. After learning more about South African heritage, you will transfer to an exceptional restaurant for a multiple-course, gourmet meal. The delicious food will be sure to excite your palate with unique, tasty, and local flavors. Your luxury dinner will be complete with panoramic views of the sunset from the comfort of your elegant table amid the gardens.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Living the Luxurious Farm Life
dayInfo.description: Located in the superbly beautiful hamlet of Simondium lies a luxurious farm, which is an absolute must for your romantic Cape Town getaway. After breakfast, you will transfer to the beautiful farm for your incredibly intimate and invigorating day. The farm is driven by deeply-rooted philosophies of sustainability and diversity, and every facet of the organization works towards the betterment of nature and human wellbeing. Thus, their array of activities will be geared towards the enlightening and fulfilling of guests. You and your loved one will have the opportunity to explore the enticing activities of your choosing, from the ancient art of oil pressing and preserving olives to an herbal blending tea workshop. The highly educational experiences will cater to all sorts of preferences. If you wish to skip the enthralling activities, then a garden tour of their rich botanical tapestry will also be available. This journey will excite all of your senses as you browse, pick, smell, and taste the extraordinary grown plant life while hearing the serene sounds of nature around you. After your chosen activity, you will enjoy a magnificent lunch at the farm. Intricately prepared using freshly grown ingredients, the award-winning restaurant’s delectable food will captivate you as you share the experience with one another. This will leave a taste on your palate that you will want with every meal. Later this afternoon, you will transfer back to the bustling city of Cape Town for some time to unwind. Here, you will check-in to your luxurious guesthouse in the charmingly elegant suburb of Llandudno. This popular, yet off the beaten track beach offers luxury living amongst the most tranquil seaside setting. In the evening, you will transfer to the vibrant streets of Clifton Beach for first-class cocktails and a gourmet meal. You will brush shoulders with Cape Town’s elite as you enjoy fun-filled sundowners by the sea.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Cape Town's Best Kept Secrets
dayInfo.description: Your final full day in Cape Town will be spent exploring the pristine Blue Flag beaches that are set along the western coastline of the city. You will enjoy breakfast in Llandudno before spending a few hours on its immaculate white sand. If you are brave enough to embrace the refreshing waters, then you can delight in a swim in the crystal-clear Atlantic Ocean. Then, you will transfer to a few of Cape Town’s most coveted hideaway beaches. You will live like a local at these rare gems as you relax in the sun with next to no crowds. You will tuck into an exceptional meal at one of Cape Town’s revered seafood restaurants nearby before exploring more of the seaside. In the afternoon, return home to slip into something comfortable. From your guesthouse, you will transfer to the base of the Lion’s Head. The impressive mountain, which sits between Table Mountain and Signal Hill, offers couples one of the most romantic views from its peaks. Together, you will hike up the winding trail that winds around the mountain. You will arrive at the top and be met with impeccable vistas of Cape Town. From here, you and your partner will capture lifelong memories of your incredible stay in Cape Town. You will witness the remarkable grandeur of the mountain that cannot be seen anywhere else in the world. Here, you will stand on what seems to be the edge of the world as you snap photos of you looking down below. As the sun sets, you will see the stars break through the blue sky, and within minutes, the sky will be lit up by the twinkling stars, and you will feel worlds away. After taking it all in, you will slowly make your way down the mountain and transfer to a gorgeous restaurant in the city center. Here, you will enjoy another Michelin-starred meal to bring the perfect romantic getaway to an end. You will return to your luxury accommodation for one last night next to the serene seaside environment.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – A Breakfast Fit for a King and Queen
dayInfo.description: In the morning of your final day, you will venture to the heart of the city to soak up the exuberant energy and enjoy an elaborate breakfast at a revered restaurant. As you dine in comfort on elegant meals, you should take some time to reminisce about your romantic getaway together. You will capture a few last gorgeous pictures before you leave the vibrant city. You will wonder why time flew by so fast but the memories and moments will never be forgotten. With your bags and belongings packed safe and sound with your private transfer, you will be met shortly after your breakfast and journey to the airport. Stunning Cape Town will eagerly await your next visit.

tourName: Cape Town Vacation: Stellenbosch Winelands & Safari
placesVisited: Cape Town, Â Stellenbosch
generalInfo: Vacate the life you know for the adventure you crave with this 7-day that celebrates the diversity, culture, food, wine, and wildlife of South Africa. Lions lounge in the afternoon sun, vineyards stretch to the horizon and the Victoria & Albert Waterfront bustles with people and laughter. Here time will slip into a constant meaningful, adventurous experience.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Depart for South Africa
dayInfo.description: Arrive in Cape Town and be whisked to the luxuries of your centrally located hotel in a stylish neighborhood of the city. Table Mountain looms large over the city below, its flat top often covered by the swiftly moving clouds. The Atlantic Ocean laps along the city’s shores and encloses the city with the beautiful ocean glistening with sunlight. The stunning mountains change color in the afternoon sky. The cafes lining the street are boisterous, full of laughter and incredible scents that emanate through the doors. The eclectic scent of a blend of South African, East African, European, and Indian food mixes with the breeze. Long Street is centrally located, full of flair, and is always a wonderful area to watch the diversity of Cape Town from a street-side café, a restaurant balcony, or from your hotel window.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Be Taken Away
dayInfo.description: A visit to the top of Table Mountain is possible for those wanting the beautiful experience of hiking under the foothills, through the pass, and onto the flat top of the mountain, or for those that want a leisure and scenic route by taking the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway. Both the hike and the gondola are fulfilling in different ways and both lead you to the same incredible panorama of Cape Town. Lion’s Head Peak sits just below to your left, while Devil’s Peak is to the right. The air atop the mountain is cool with the breeze blowing against your cheeks. The ocean circles around the Cape of Good Hope, shining an opulent blue and sparkling from the sun’s reflection. The mountaintop is craggy and looks like a marriage of landscapes between the Old West and the Moon. The mountain feels like a giant monolith in its flat nature and ease in which you can explore its crown. The vibrant neighborhood of Bo Kaap can be seen from the mountaintop, nestled in the shadow of Signal Hill, the houses neon in color. Bo Kaap is an incredibly eclectic neighborhood and is considered to be Cape Town’s Malaysian Quarter. You can practically smell the curry and slow cooked stews from the Table. Take the cableway down for one last vista of the city beneath you. The gondola slowly rotates and Cape Town comes closer as you descend the gondola, the beauty of the city you came to see, touch, and take in.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Give and Take
dayInfo.description: With Cape Town’s stunning location and fabulous history you will always need another day to explore the city’s best sites. For a deeper sense of Cape Town’s and South Africa’s history visit the Castle of Good Hope. The castle is in actuality a fortress built by the Dutch East India Trading Company in the 17th century. The gateway was built in 1682 and replaced the old entrance that faced the sea. Two pillars are carved out of gray-blue stone. The entrance is made of small yellow bricks which offer a unique example of 17th century Dutch classicism in the Cape. Soldiers in traditional Dutch uniforms march through the courtyard.
