dayInfo.description: During the day, you can venture into the wilderness with a ranger on a walking safari in search of the marvelous birdlife for which the Okavango Delta is known. You can hear the yapping call of the African jacana as it lingers in the marsh. A fish eagle will perch in the trees and wait for prey to emerge from the water. You can also find the vibrant plumage of the African paradise flycatcher, which commonly has a chestnut or rust-colored tail with greenish highlights.

dayInfo.title: Okavango Delta - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The sounds of active wildlife will return before morning. At breakfast, the scent of fresh coffee will fill the air and be accompanied by the aroma of wet grass. Your time exploring the African wilderness with your family has come to an end. Your private transfer will meet your family after breakfast and escort you to the airport. A brief flight will take you to Maun Airport, where you will continue to your connecting flight at Johannesburg International Airport.

tourName: Flavors of South Africa Tour: New World Wine, Fine Dining & Classic Safari Experience
placesVisited: Cape Town, Constantia, Stellenbosch, Franschhoek, Thornybush Private Game Reserve
generalInfo: Crafted with wine fanatics in mind, this luxurious 12-day tour of South Africa is designed to give you the perfect sampling of South Africa’s many flavors. From elegant wine estates in the Western Cape, to luxury lodges with expansive wine cellars in the heart of the bush, you will experience South Africa as guided by the country’s favorite wines. Coupled with an extraordinary culinary adventure, a sensational bush experience, and a few award-winning spas, this two-week tour will surely delight each and every one of your senses.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Victoria and Alfred Waterfront
dayInfo.description: This African adventure begins at Cape Town’s Victoria and Alfred Waterfront. The active harbor is the hub for tourism in this world famous city, and your chic hotel is located on the edge of it all. Having arrived in the city around midday, you will have the afternoon to leisurely adjust to the time change and pace of life. Browsing the varied boutiques and harbor side cafes while local South African marimba bands play lively songs behind you is one of the most perfect welcomes to the continent. There are countless restaurants to choose between within this area, serving anything from fresh fish and chips to high-end Japanese fare. Some may prefer to wander, browsing menus as you go while others may prefer to make a reservation through the concierge. No matter your approach, be sure to factor in a drink at your hotel lobby, in order to sample your first South African wine from their vast cellar.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Tour of the Cape Peninsula and the City Center
dayInfo.description: While your time in Cape Town is entirely yours to design, we often recommend spending your first day in the city on a private guided tour of the Cape Peninsula. Beginning after breakfast, this tour carries you along the Atlantic seaboard to Cape Town’s smaller harbors. A dramatic and exhilarating scenic highway weaves along the jagged cliffs of the Twelve Apostles, slowly carrying you towards the Cape of Good Hope. There are a number of opportunities throughout this morning drive to pause at various highlights, including Camps Bay, Hout Bay and Clifton. Dip your toes in the Atlantic Ocean before climbing up to the lighthouse at the Cape Point where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans swirl together against a magnificent backdrop. Keep your eyes open for wandering ostrich, mountain zebra and eland amidst the endemic fynbos flora, before carrying on for a visit with the African penguins at Boulders Beach. Today’s tour has a number of detours available, depending on your particular interests. Ornithologists will likely love a visit to World of Birds where you can walk through a series of aviaries filled with unique and endangered species. Others may prefer a quick ocean adventure to visit a colony of Cape Fur seals on a rocky outcropping off the coast. We often recommend a trip to Kirstenbosch for everyone; a stroll through these expansive botanical gardens is nothing short of magical. While it takes days to circumnavigate the entire jungle of ancient and endemic gardens, a few hours is enough to inspire a curiosity in local botany.

dayInfo.title: Constantia - Lush and Leafy
dayInfo.description: This morning you will head out of the city center to the other side of a mountain, arriving in the stunning and exclusive suburb of Constantia. Here you will stay at the tranquil boutique hotel steps away from a number of the southern hemisphere’s oldest vineyards. Quiet, charming and with a Cape Dutch flare, this elegant garden hotel will be the first of many perfect bases for exploring the area. Arriving in the late morning, you will have just enough time to refresh yourself in a private plunge pool before wandering out to a winery for lunch. Indulge in a gourmet meal at a timeless restaurant, being sure to sample their signature desert, the Chocolate Variation. Wander through their manicured gardens, perpetually shaded by the dramatic mountain range behind. The remainder of the afternoon will be spent as you please. Some may fit in another tasting or two, while others may prefer to relax amidst the explosively colorful gardens of your hotel.

dayInfo.title: Constantia - Timeless Vineyards
dayInfo.description: All of today will be spent casually exploring the nine vineyards that comprise the Constantia Valley Wine Route. This wine route is the oldest in the southern hemisphere, with some estates dating back as late as 1685. The Groot Constantia vineyard specifically has been a favorite of authors, royalty and explorers for over three centuries, with Napoleon Bonaparte listing the Grand Constance as his favorite wine in the early 1800s. This vineyard has also preserved the original manor house and Cloete wine cellar, which are currently managed by the Iziko Museums of South Africa. A tour through these historic buildings will shed further light on the centuries of people who have savored these very wines. Each of the nine vineyards produces only premium wines, with a number of award-winning bottles scattered throughout. Knowledgeable and charismatic staff will lead you on a journey through whites, reds and dessert wines, highlighting subtle flavors and strategic differences with every glass. With each vineyard more beautiful than the last, today will be nothing short of dreamy. Whether you opt to visit three or nine vineyards, the pace and pattern will be entirely yours to design. Enjoy!

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch - Famous Wine Route
dayInfo.description: This morning, the elegance continues as you move from Constantia to Stellenbosch, the most famous wine route in South Africa. Driving just past the city along winding mountain roads, you will find the stunning estate where you will stay. Brass gates usher you into this magnificent property tucked away within the Helshoogte Mountain Pass. Though the driveway is stunning, the magic explodes as you enter your private cottage overlooking this famed region. Light floods through the windows of these tastefully decorated suites, providing you with panoramic views from every room. However, you will truly be able to soak it all in as you sip champagne in your private plunge pool that jets out over the rows of grape trees below. Though opulent and extravagant, the property remains somehow understated, always embracing the natural beauty that surrounds it. The coming days here will be a treat.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch - Day of Indulgence
dayInfo.description: Today, every one of your senses will be wowed as you explore the spa, restaurant, wine cellar and diamond masterpieces housed at this incredible property. Begin with a breakfast of fresh tropical fruit and rich espresso, served to you on your porch overlooking the fields below. In the mid-morning, move to the airy and light-filled spa, and pamper yourself with a restorative massage and a rejuvenating facial. While some may spend the entire day here, others may prefer to emerge from the oasis for an extravagant lunch coupled with award-winning wines. In the afternoon, venture into the flagship African store diamonds. Hop in a golf cart and be driven to the lavish boutique, where unique rings and timepieces are spectacularly displayed throughout art-filled rooms. Whether you purchase a stunning watch, or simply marvel at the glittering pieces, this is not to be missed. The extravagance continues as you visit the wine tasting room for samples of a number of top ranking wines.

dayInfo.title: Franschoek - Culinary Adventure
dayInfo.description: This morning you will carry on through the Helshoogte Mountain Pass, descending eventually into the town of Franschhoek. Protected by massive mountains, this quaint French town will be the final stop on your comprehensive wine tour. Drive down the restaurant-fringed main street, turning into a quiet corner near the Huguenot memorial as you approach your next property. This understated boutique hotel perfectly combined its French roots with a modern flair, without ever detracting from the region’s natural beauty. Though the spa, pool and cozy personal fireplace may lure you close, the true appeal is its world-renowned restaurant. Laden with awards, this restaurant has become a destination within South Africa for those truly passionate about inventive and innovative dining. Tonight you will have a reservation for an eight-course surprise tasting menu. Leaving no choice for the guests, the chef will delight each of your taste buds as she profiles local specialties prepared with an international flare. Paired with regional wine, this experience will vie for the place of best meal of the trip. That said, we will not ruin the adventure with more descriptors. They mystery is part of the fun!

dayInfo.title: Franschoek - Countless Vineyards
dayInfo.description: With countless vineyards in your immediate vicinity, set out today on a tour of those that intrigue you most. Whether following a route or the wind, you are bound to stumble upon new favorite chardonnays and cabernets. To balance the wine, it is also worth exploring the artisan food route, which leads you through a journey of handcrafted cheese, bread, olives, olive oil, charcuterie and chocolate. It will be well worth your while to save room during this morning’s tour for lunch at another top restaurant. Franschoek is in fact home to approximately 80% of the country’s best restaurants, and a goal of this trip is to experience as many as possible. Others may crave a creative lunch of charcuterie at the rustic Bread and Wine Vineyard in the valley, or a meal of Africa’s only responsibly-sourced seafood at the Salmon Bar, all of which can be organized to satisfy any palate. No matter where you dine, today will be focused on completing your tour of the country’s culinary capital. Spend the late afternoon sifting through galleries in search of a stunning piece of art to commemorate the trip before drifting into a food-induced sleep.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Fly into the African Bush
dayInfo.description: Hopefully today you will have shipped at least one box of wine home, leaving your bags light for the second portion of your journey. This morning you will drive back to Cape Town, arriving in time for a flight to Nelspruit via Johannesburg. A private plane will carry you the final distance, eventually descending on a dirt landing strip in Thornybush Private Game Reserve. Adjacent to Kruger National Park, Thornybush is among the most vibrant and exclusive private game reserves in Africa. Here you will stay at a jaw-dropping oasis in the raw and untamed bush. Here, you will not experience an ordinary South Africa safari ! Your visit here will be timeless, elegant and a little bit extravagant. In spite of your location in this remote corner of the bush, the culinary adventure has yet to end. This safari lodge has earned international fame for its spectacular dishes, and today’s lunch will illustrate exactly why. Sit down on the airy wooden deck with a glass of rosé, and sit back while the chef amazes you with his creations. Digest with a coffee before meeting your ranger for your first safari. Inevitably complete with prolific wildlife, sundowner cocktails and uninterrupted stargazing, the coming days will make up the imagined quintessential African adventure – with a few dashes of added luxury, of course.

dayInfo.title: Thornybush Private Game Reserve - Embark on a Full Day of Safari
dayInfo.description: Early this morning, your ranger will give your cottage a wakeup call before the sun begins to rise. Shortly thereafter, a guard will escort you along the boardwalks to the main lodge where hot coffee, fruit, and yogurt await. Fueled with a light snack, you will set out into the bush as the sun rises, observing the wildlife’s early morning routines. Zebra, impala and kudu can be seen grazing on the dew-soaked grass, while vibrant birdlife soars above. Traverse the dusty tracks in your open-air vehicle, wrapped in a fleece blanket for a bit of extra warmth. Your ranger and tracker will work together over the coming days to search for the region’s impressive wildlife, providing you with a number of intimate and unforgettable encounters. Your movements and schedule over the coming days will be unpredictable, and based off the tracks they follow in the sand. You will return to the lodge in the mid-morning for a full breakfast served overlooking the watering hole. Resident nyala will likely cruise, while vervet monkeys hover in the trees above in anticipation of a snack. The remainder of the morning and afternoon will be spent entirely at your leisure, until you are eventually called back for the afternoon game drive. The search for elusive leopards and endangered rhinoceros will resume as you explore the bush under the afternoon sky. In addition to using your eyes and cameras, be sure to listen for the roar of the lion and try to smell the scent of an elephant or buffalo. Your ranger may even teach you a few basics of tracking, adding greater depth to the entire experience. As the sun dips near the horizon, pause on an open field for a gin and tonic and a few light snacks. Watch as the sky transforms above you, progressing through a multitude of colors before stars emerge above. Slowly you will make your way back to the lodge while observing changes in the nocturnal world. You will be welcomed back into the lodge with sherry, a warm towel, and another spectacular meal.

dayInfo.title: Thornybush Private Game Reserve - African Adventure
dayInfo.description: Today will follow yesterday’s rhythm of early morning and late afternoon game drives, interspersed with sensational meals and deep relaxation. Today you may see anything from lions feasting on a recent kill to leopard cubs frolicking in the bush. Or, you may prefer to focus on the smaller elements of the bush, embarking on a guided walking safari through the grass. However, be sure to fully indulge between adventures in the bush at the lodge’s famed spa. Treat yourself to a deep massage or a manicure, along with a sauna or Jacuzzi following. If less inclined towards a full treatment, be sure to at least visit this magical sanctuary in the bush to sip on a healthy fruit juice beside the massive pool. Meals will be a highlight of your stay in the bush as you work your way through a number of multi-coursed themed meals. An extensive six-course tasting menu, complete with some of South Africa’s finest cheeses, will feature the full range of the chef’s capabilities. A classic evening braai (African barbeque) will provide you with the chance to experience some classically South African culture, as you sample a perfectly grilled impala loin alongside a roasted rack of lamb. Those with a sweet tooth will delight at a berry-filled soufflé or a creamy cheese cake, before sleepily retiring to a bed warmed with a hot water bottle. Coupled with a day of rich and awe-inspiring game viewing, today will conclude the perfect retreat.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg - Onwards with your Outbound Flight
dayInfo.description: Filled with great food, wine and stories, today you will begin the return journey home. For those craving a few more moments in the bush, you will likely have time to fit in an early morning game drive before a final breakfast on the wooden deck. Squeeze in a few extra pieces of tropical fruit before making your way to the airstrip where a private plane will await you. You will fly to Johannesburg, arriving in time to connect with your international departure. For those wishing to experience this invigorating and fascinating city, we will gladly assist in organizing a few additional days in ‘Jozi’ – or another destination.

tourName: Gastronomic Getaway to Leading Cape Town Wine Estates
placesVisited: Cape Town, Paarl, Franschhoek, Stellenbosch
generalInfo: Cape cuisine is steeped in South African heritage, and it brilliantly retains the authentic traditions while pioneering diverse creativity. Furthermore, the greater Western Cape region has played a significant role in influencing the country’s viticulture. The city and neighboring towns boast world-class wine routes complete with prestigious estates and immaculate vistas of the sprawling landscape and rugged mountains. On this 9-day trip, you will revel in award-winning meals that are paired with exceptional wines to uncover the history behind the pinnacle of Cape destinations. For the devoted foodies and cultured wine connoisseurs, the distinguished flavors of the greater Cape region await you and your palate.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Constantia Charm
dayInfo.description: Cape Town is a highly sought-after destination and, and as you swoop down over the Western Cape, you will quickly realize why. Rugged mountain ranges tower up from the Earth, and white sand beaches sprawl across the coastline to lead into turquoise waters. The city, which is nestled at the foot of Table Mountain, blends sophistication and traditional charm. You will witness all of this and more as you peer out over the greater Cape Town region. You will meet your private transfer shortly after landing at Cape Town International Airport. Grab your belongings and settle into a first-class vehicle for a comfortable scenic drive to the Constantia suburb. Constantia is a premier destination that is situated beneath the striking Table Mountain. It is a beautiful area which boasts luxurious 5-star guesthouses. Furthermore, it is home to Cape Town’s world-renowned wine estates. Set amongst rolling green hills and surrounded by indigenous wildlife, this tranquil village will be the perfect place to call home. Upon arrival, you will check-in to your luxurious villa. Stunning vistas of the evergreen fields and imposing mountain range will welcome you from your private balcony. You will transfer to an award-winning restaurant in the evening. The Michelin Style restaurant, which is located in the heart of the Constantia Valley, will offer an elegant taste of South African cuisine. You will catch the scent of tantalizing dishes as they are prepared by the master chef. The delectable candlelit dinner will be splendidly paired with prestigious local wines, and a toast to your adventure ahead will bring the evening to a perfect end.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – The Origins of Cape Viticulture
dayInfo.description: You will begin your morning in the comfort of your private villa with an elegant breakfast. A spread of traditional pastries, local cheeses, and freshly squeezed juices will set a blissful tone for your day. You can spend some time lounging around the pool and strolling through the diverse Constantia Greenbelt. The sun will peak through the greenbelt’s canopy and warm the dewy ground where the lush foliage encompasses its winding trails. Early risers and their furry companions will share friendly smiles as you go. A short walk from the greenbelt and you will arrive back home. Afterward, a luxurious private transfer will collect you for an in-depth tour of your destination’s famous wine estates. The Western Cape has a deeply rooted viticulture history with its first bottle of wine being produced decades ago in the city of Cape Town. Hence, some of the provinces longest-established wine estates can be found along the Constantia Wine Route. You will transfer to pivotal estates and spend time discovering each unique vintage and blend. The distinguished flavors of each estate will resonate from their bold wines. You will learn more about the winemaking process as your cultured tasting guides share valuable notes with each sip. You will also capture stunning vistas of the far-reaching vineyards, creating lifelong memories at each stop. The tour will culminate at the tip of the valley where you will indulge in a fine-dining lunch. After your immersive taste wine tour, you will connect with your private transfer and journey over the back of the valley to the Hout Bay suburb. The seaside suburb is a charming destination that is complete with sunny shores and a thriving little harbor. Your knowledgeable guide will share valuable information about the history of this fishing village, and you will browse the colorful markets of Hout Bay, delving into the rich Cape Malay culture during the trip. After which, you will arrive at an immaculate dining destination for cocktails and seafood that overlooks the rugged mountains and deep blue ocean. The setting sun will provide the perfect backdrop for your evening, and after dinner, you will travel along the famously magnificent Chapman’s Peak for uninterrupted landscape views. Shortly after, you will settle into the tranquility of your private suite in Constantia.

dayInfo.title: Paarl – Paarl’s Precious Heritage
dayInfo.description: The third day of your trip will begin in style with a delicious English breakfast. A South African twist on the traditional breakfast will highlight the country’s diverse, colonial heritage. You will check-out shortly after and depart for the third oldest European settlement in South Africa: Paarl. The town is steeped in the local culture with a particular emphasis on viticulture. It is known for producing some of the grandest wines in the Cape, and as a result, it has become a booming destination for connoisseurs. Before indulging in the distinct flavors of Paarl, you will set off on a walking, heritage tour of its surroundings. Your insightful tour guide will fluently describe the history of the settlement as you encounter its endearing architecture. With extraordinarily well-kept museums and monuments to explore, your adventure will be culturally riveting. After the tour, you will transfer to a nearby farm for afternoon lunch and tea. Comfortably sit back amongst the pristine gardens while you peacefully watch the afternoon pass. Here, you may explore the stunning succulents and precious plants that sprawl across the gardens. The traditional South African-style tea will be complete with home-baked delights. A variety of authentic milk tarts, cheesecakes, and quiches will be elegantly served to your table. You will transfer to your astonishing accommodation in Paarl later this afternoon. With world-class amenities and an unrivaled setting, your stay will be phenomenal. After a few hours relaxing in tranquility, your private chauffeur will transfer you to a premier Farm-style restaurant. Agriculture plays a pivotal role in the South African economy, and this particular farm is a leading pioneer of sustainable practices. You will be served meticulously constructed gourmet meals that are made from fresh ingredients from the gardens, and your dinner will be paired with pinnacle Paarl wines to accentuate your lavish experience. You will return to your villa after indulging in dinner and witnessing the remarkable African sunset.

dayInfo.title: Paarl – A World-Renowned Wine Route
dayInfo.description: Beyond its prestigious wine heritage, Paarl’s coffee culture is thriving. The town boasts an array of fabulous roasters, and your morning will be spent enjoying one of its finest cafes. Each cup is made using only the highest quality beans that have been sourced from ethical distributors around the world. You may pair your selected blend with a homemade South African meal. Served in a sophisticated fashion, your marvelous breakfast will leave nothing to be desired. You will savor the flavors of Paarl’s leading wines for the rest of the morning and afternoon. The Paarl Wine Route boasts a multitude of incredible estates. While there are too many estates to explore in its entirety, you will experience the best of Paarl’s famous viticulture route on this jam-packed day of tasting. From ancient estates to modern winemakers, you will truly revel in the diverse range that the region has to offer. All the while, your tastings will be accompanied by cultured guides and immaculate charcuterie boards. You will bask in the subtle notes and wholesome bodies of the various wines that will be presented on this tour. An intricately prepared 5-star meal at the final estate will round off your wine and gastronomical adventure. You will return to your manor later this afternoon for a few hours at your leisure. In the evening, you will meet your private transfer and journey to a cozy restaurant in the region. The intimate dining destination will be complete with gourmet South African cuisine and sweeping views of the valley. You may order award-winning Paarl wines to conclude your splendid day.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek – Discovering the Classics
dayInfo.description: You will enjoy one final breakfast in Paarl before setting off for Franschhoek. Your private transfer will collect you in the morning and take you on a scenic drive to this endearing town. You will check-in to your gorgeous villa upon arrival. The beauty of Franschhoek lies in its old-world charm and the lush green valley in which it rests. Retaining its architectural appeal, your day will be in full swing with an exploration of the magnificent Franschhoek monuments and museums. You will meet your private chauffeur at your luxurious guesthouse, and your driver will arrive in an exquisitely restored, vintage automobile. You will discover the greater Franschhoek Valley from the comfort of this classic car. Your first stops will be the pinnacle museums and monuments which highlight the history of the Huguenot people who first settled here. The mighty odes to the Franschhoek heritage are in pristine condition, and their beauty is reflected under the gleaming sunshine. You will discover the story of the settlers and encounter century-old relics. The humbling morning will conclude with a trip to a premier restaurant nearby. Arriving at this exquisite destination via a vintage vehicle will be a perfect Franschhoek fit. After all, the town’s antique automobile history is only rivaled by its passionate viticulture heritage. You will delight in a remarkable lunch that will be paired with world-class wines. Overlooking the entire valley, you will dine in absolute pleasure, and after lunch, you will travel along the Franschhoek pass in the comfort of your classic chauffeur-driven vehicle. The vistas of the African sun setting over the horizon will be unforgettable. Later this evening, you will arrive at a gourmet restaurant in the valley. Here, you will sample authentic South African dishes with a sophisticated flair. These award-winning meals will awaken your senses and bring the day to an utterly satisfying close.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek – Wine Tasting by Tram
dayInfo.description: The Franschhoek Valley is home to many of the Cape’s most significant wine estates, so there will be a seemingly endless variety of distinguished wine destinations to tantalize your taste buds. After breakfast, you will discover the deep wine culture of Franschhoek. You will privately transfer to the Franschhoek Village. Here, you will board a luxurious wine tram for a unique exploration of the famous wine route. The tram will weave its way through the various vineyards in search of the quintessential vintages and blends. You will be accompanied by a knowledgeable wine guide who will share valuable insight throughout your tour. While doing so, you will soak up the picturesque settings. You will also encounter stretches of green vines that wrap around the lush grassy landscape, jagged mountain ranges in the distance that reach for the clouds, and charming buildings that retain an aura of unparalleled dignity. The immersive experience will take you to key tastings at pivotal estates, but the enjoyment will not end here. Beyond delving into the rich flavor varieties, you will be fascinated during a wine lecture and guided, cellar tour. These activities will share behind-the-scenes information regarding the meticulous craft of making wine. The wholesome journey will be complete with a multiple course meal. After delving into the best of the Franschhoek Wine Route, you will settle comfortably at an established restaurant for a first-class dinner.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – Agricultural Excellence
dayInfo.description: An original Cape Dutch farm that is set amongst the green valleys nearby Franschhoek will offer a truly riveting experience. The incredible destination, rooted in organic farming practices, provides a luxurious take on authentic South African agriculture. This comes at no ethical expense as the organic farm is underpinned by values of sustainability, diversity, and collaboration. You will delight in an exquisite farm-grown breakfast before participating in an engaging activity of your choice. From cheese making to succulent growing, the possibilities will be endless. After which, you will depart for the renowned town of Stellenbosch. This charming destination is another pivotal viticulture landmark in the Western Cape. The town has a firm hold on South African history, and there will be much to explore during your stay. For example, the well-kept Dutch-colonial architecture provides a compelling heritage. A cultured guide will walk you through the history of the town, leading you to incredible odes to the old-world and significant heritage sites. The tour will culminate with an authentic top-tier meal at a premier restaurant that overlooks this diverse landscape. You will check-in to your luxury suite later today. Then, you will have the opportunity to relax in style at a 5-star spa. Let the holiday sink in as you unwind with any of the marvelous treatments on offer. Feeling completely refreshed from the spa, you will set off for a sumptuous supper. The meticulously crafted South African meals that will be set amongst the marvelous green fields of Stellenbosch will finish your day perfectly.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – Stellenbosch’s Immersive Flavors
dayInfo.description: You will transfer to a premier Stellenbosch wine estate on your eighth day for a delicious breakfast. This will kick off your final day of tasting South Africa’s most remarkable wines. You will witness a surreal duck parade after your delightful breakfast. The innovative pest control program, which is pioneered by the estate, will be a sight to behold. A flock of over 1,200 Indian Runner Ducks assists the farmers by cleaning up the pest population, which can negatively impact the estate’s vineyard harvest. The entire performance will be set amongst the estates beautifully kept gardens. After the performance concludes, you will transfer to the next leading estate for a unique Segway tour of the vineyards. The off-road tour will highlight the vineyards beauty and the processes behind the distinct vintages and blends. As you ride around under the sun and feel the breeze against your cheeks, you will revel in the freedom of this unique experience. After immersing yourself in this behind-the-scenes activity, you will continue the Stellenbosch wine tour where you will make your way to a few more of its renowned farms for guided taste tours of their refined blends. The tour will culminate with an incredible sunset dinner. As you savor each sip of wine, you will soak up the marvelous vistas of the illuminated orange sky that surrounds you. The multiple course meal will satisfy your every craving as you end your day of distinguished tasting.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Sights from Great Heights
dayInfo.description: On your last day of the tour, you will wake early in the morning for an unforgettable view of the greater Western Cape. This time, you will take to the skies in a private hot air balloon to witness the incredible sunrise. From these heights, you will capture the region like never before. Encounter the estates and restaurants that you enjoyed previously on this tour from a completely unique perspective. Upon your return to the ground, you will celebrate with a glass of exceptional sparkling wine and delight in a fancy breakfast to conclude your vacation in great fashion. After enjoying the delightful meal, you will meet your private transfer who will transfer you to Cape Town International Airport where you will soon depart for home. Though the trip may be at its end, you will leave with great knowledge of South Africa’s wines and reminisce of all the exquisite, gastronomical highlights.

tourName: Hidden South Africa Two-Week Tour
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Drakensberg, Durban, Port St Johns, Cape Town
generalInfo: Highly authentic and vested in the local culture, this adventurous, two-week tour celebrates experiences that are yet to make the guidebooks. Venture off the beaten track in South Africa, and you will unravel the threads of a Rainbow Nation. Think Xhosa lifestyles, Zulu traditions, Bushman art, township culture, and enchanting histories that are narrated by specialist guides. Trek to the world’s second-highest waterfall, lounge on Durban beaches, and uncover the cradle of humankind.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg - A Reinvented City Center
dayInfo.description: Central Johannesburg has reinvented itself over the last decade, mostly due to small, independent businesses and pop-up establishments. Once-derelict areas have become thriving social hubs, where boutiques and cafes meet with breweries and street art. You will be able to feel a high-paced city energy as you begin to explore the strands of the Rainbow Nation. After your airport transfer, you will spend the remaining afternoon and evening around these vibrant areas, including the Maboneng precinct. This will prove an ideal introduction to the country’s multicultural spirit and modern verve.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg - Exploring the Cradle of Humankind
dayInfo.description: You will be out of the city this morning, driving across rolling bushveld toward the origins of humankind. A museum will walk you through human evolution with very real evidence that shows how we all evolved from Africa. A trip to this side of the city is very peaceful and is an excellent option if you are suffering from any jet lag. Soweto defies negative preconceptions about townships, and street art covers everything from walls to power station towers. You will explore this area with your local guide, beginning with a traditional shebeen , which is a bar, and the Hector Pieterson Museum. Then, you will follow the tale of the 1976 Soweto Uprising against apartheid through the township to Vilakazi Street, which is where Nelson Mandela and Desmond Tutu both lived.

dayInfo.title: Drakensberg - Rock Art in South Africa’s Mountain Range
dayInfo.description: It will take about an hour to leave the Johannesburg city limits, but once you are beyond the final suburbs, an empty country will expand. A precipitous mountain stands more than 10,000 feet above luscious, green hills, and this mountain is shaped quite like the famous Table Mountain but is triple its size. Rock art is dotted all around this area, and you will spend the afternoon exploring some of the 40,000 pieces. These paintings narrate ancient stories such as successful hunts, imminent war, and important messages that have been shared between nomadic San people. The entire area is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and can give you a great understanding of life in South Africa thousands of years ago.

dayInfo.title: Drakensberg - Hiking to Tugela Falls
dayInfo.description: Tugela Falls tumbles down from the Drakensberg Amphitheater. At 948 meters, it is second in height only to Angel Falls in Venezuela. It is a mesmeric flume of water amid a cliff face of sun-scorched rock. Hiking to the falls is one of South Africa’s great adventures, and it is not overly strenuous. A four-wheel drive vehicle can take you most of the way, and from there, you can then climb staircases and cross plateaus with stupendous views across KwaZulu-Natal. In total, you will be walking for three hours, but the pace can be very leisurely, and there are no long stretches of ascent. While Tugela Falls enchants, the highlight will be the wilderness up here on a mountain perch that is so far above the rest of the world.

dayInfo.title: Drakensberg - A Day Trip to Lesotho
dayInfo.description: Today, you will follow another four-wheel drive track up the Drakensberg mountains and enter another country. Lesotho is a kingdom in the sky and the highest country in the world. Its lowest point is 1,500 feet higher than any other nation. Isolated and somewhat unknown, Lesotho has preserved its traditional culture. Although UN statistics place Lesotho as one of the world’s poorest and least developed nations, the reality is a country of warm smiles, ancient practices, and a deliberately slow pace of life. Today’s day trip will be very illuminating as you meet the locals, discover the landscapes, and wonder about life in a country that is so remote.

dayInfo.title: Durban - Traditional Zulu Culture
dayInfo.description: Your three-hour transfer to Durban will cut through Zulu lands, and you can jump out and find that traditional culture is well-preserved here, even if modernity threatens to bring change. Women wander about in traditional dress, often carrying heavy loads upon their heads, and circular huts dot the landscape, enhancing rugged-looking valleys. You will meet a community and discover their way of life in these valleys, including concepts such as lobola and the ancestral line of Zulu warriors. Lunch will be very traditional and will be eaten with your hands in a family homestead. Later, in Durban, you can indulge in an afternoon around the beach, discovering a city that practically rises out of the sand.

dayInfo.title: Durban - Discovering a Cultural Legacy
dayInfo.description: Durban is one of Africa’s most diverse and interesting cities. It has an enormous Indian population, and you will follow the Gandhi trail to learn about what the Indian politician achieved during the 21 years that he lived in the city. The Indian heritage meets with Zulu heritage with most of it being wrapped around British Victorian architecture. If you throw a modern surf culture into the mix, then you can feel that Durban is completely different from everywhere else. Throughout the day, you can experience different elements of this cultural legacy from the shops to the food and a harmonious, religious mix. Durban preserves the laid-back atmosphere from your time in the Drakensberg, and the beachfront is an excellent place to spend an afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Port St Johns - First Impressions of the Transkei
dayInfo.description: Today’s drive will be the longest of your trip: roughly five hours of following the Indian Ocean coastline to Port Saint Johns, which is a peaceful, beachside town in the Transkei. The Transkei is South Africa’s most traditional region. As your guide will explain, it is the region that mostly reflects Bantu heritage and was changed little by centuries of colonial rule. During apartheid, the Transkei retained a de facto independence, and it was here that Nelson Mandela, Oliver Tambo, Walter Sisulu, and almost all the original ANC activists originate. Staying in the Transkei will transport you into an older, Bantu way of life. The Transkei is the most beautiful of all destinations in a country famed for its beauty.

dayInfo.title: Port St Johns - Indian Ocean Beaches and Rolling Hills
dayInfo.description: Cliffs twist and fall above Indian Ocean waves, and, from these summits, you can gaze inland to a seemingly endless band of rolling, green hills. Whales and dolphins can be spotted in the ocean on most days. Cliffs tumble down to small bays, which is where you will find golden sand and hardly any other people. Over the course of today and tomorrow, your guide can design an itinerary around your interests. Time in the Transkei is slow. Nothing is rushed, and it is important not to plan too much in a day because serendipity will always play a part. Options include riding horses across cliffy plateaus, venturing along various hiking trails along this coast, and visiting Xhosa villages.

dayInfo.title: Port St Johns - At Home With Xhosa Culture
dayInfo.description: The Transkei is home to the Xhosa people, and a village experience will help you understand how their culture contrasts with the Zulu. Their circular huts are conspicuous and are evenly spaced across the hills, and the villagers must request land from a chief and are given space to raise their cattle. It is a simple way of life, and you can explore how this is changing, especially among the youth. Village visits will be informal and fit naturally into their day. The Xhosa people may lead you to an ocean-tumbling waterfall, or to hike to secret spots along the coast in addition to many other cultural experiences.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Sunset from Kloof Corner
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will have a two-hour transfer to Mthatha Airport before a flight to Cape Town via Johannesburg. By swapping the Transkei for the Cape, you will notice a dramatic change in wealth and culture. Cape Town is a modern city even if nature provides the perennial backdrop. There will be time to explore Table Mountain this afternoon, but you will avoid the cable car queues and crowds upon the summit. Your guide knows of a 20-minute uphill trail that leads to Kloof Corner, which is roughly halfway up the mountain. From the corner of Table Mountain, you will have a 270-degree view, where you can admire spectacular views of an Atlantic Ocean sunset, Lion’s Head, and most of Cape Town city.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Bo Kaap and District Six
dayInfo.description: Sticking to a theme of off-the-beaten-track experiences, you will spend today exploring two very historical neighborhoods. Both Bo Kaap and District Six are revered by their people, and you will be guided by two residents. Stories tell of torture and the wrongs of apartheid as 60,000 District Six residents were forcibly removed and placed on swampland about 20 miles away. In these histories, there is a preservation of a culture that apartheid almost destroyed, and you will witness a hope for the future, which can be told by all the enthusiastic faces. Culminating your day’s tour will be a cooking lesson in a Bo Kaap kitchen, where you will learn and eat traditional Cape Malay cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Art and Change on the Woodstock Streets
dayInfo.description: Woodstock was a gray area throughout the apartheid era. That meant that there was no separation based on skin color. Since apartheid, Woodstock has continued to evolve as Cape Town’s most multicultural neighborhood. Today, it is very much the idea of a Rainbow Nation and a symbol of modern South Africa. This morning, you will venture on a street art walking tour, where you will admire fresh murals and decipher political messages that cover walls. Along the way, you will discover markets, boutiques, breweries, cafes, and tales that are hidden beneath the frame of Devil’s Peak. This afternoon will be left free, so you can have time to explore Cape Town at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Departure
dayInfo.description: After an airport transfer, you will depart South Africa from Cape Town International Airport.

tourName: High End South Africa Luxury Safari
placesVisited: Cape Town, Franschhoek, Thornybush Game Reserve (Kruger)
generalInfo: Opulence and luxury will define your 11-day high-end South Africa safari. You will experience the splendor of mouthwatering cuisine, the drama of private views, and the glamour of sensational wines. Sample rich chocolates after a day viewing giraffes and enjoy a bespoke train ride celebrated for lavish comforts. From African penguins at Boulders Beach to flawless wildlife photos, you can indulge in perfection on your exclusive South Africa safari.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Welcome to Cape Town
dayInfo.description: On arrival at Cape Town International Airport, you will be met by your private guide and driven to your beautiful accommodations. Along the way, notice the dominating massif of Table Mountain looming over the city that nestles on its slopes, and the glittering Atlantic Ocean beyond. Your hotel sits perched on the slopes of Lion’s Head in the exclusive suburb of Bantry Bay, with sweeping ocean and city views that are truly breathtaking. The elegance and sophistication of this unique property are complimented by the welcoming and professional staff, and you will quickly find yourself at home here. The spa, gym, restaurant and whiskey bar ooze with refinement that is enhanced by the spectacular art collection and stupendous views, making this one of the most romantic destinations in Cape Town.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Explore Robben Island and Table Mountain
dayInfo.description: Pass through the vibrant and colorful Victoria & Alfred Waterfront to board the ferry that takes you to Robben Island, formerly the site of Nelson Mandela’s imprisonment and now a living museum. Guided by former inmates, you will be given insight into the lives of the activists who were incarcerated here. Visit Mandela’s cell where he spent 18 years, and learn of the troubled history of South Africa’s apartheid past. Returning across the bay, you will be treated to a spectacular view of the city and the looming bulk of Table Mountain. Browse the interesting shops and absorb the bustle of this working harbor before stopping for lunch at one of the multitude of fantastic restaurants along the Waterfront. Ride up through the city to the cableway that delivers you to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car rotates as it ascends, giving you an awesome wrap-around perspective of the mountains and city below. Arriving at the summit, 3,000 ft. above the sea, a network of pathways lead you to a series of viewpoints where you can gaze down at the beaches of Clifton and Camps Bay, the Twelve Apostles, Lion’s Head and the ocean stretching off to the horizon. On the other side, the mountains of the Helderberg and the wine country are visible rearing up dramatically in the distance. Keep a lookout for the rock hyraxes, or dassies, as they are also known, that live here. These cute and furry animals look like cuddly toys, but are actually related to elephants!

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Take the Cape Peninsula Tour
dayInfo.description: Together with your guide, drive along the spectacular coastal route of Chapman’s Peak Drive to the Cape Point Nature Reserve. Keeping an eye out for antelope, ostriches and baboons along the way, you arrive at the southernmost point of the peninsula, where a lighthouse stands sentinel over rocky crags pounded by the surf far below. Walk along the path to the viewing points and imagine you can envisage the two oceans, the Atlantic and the Indian, mingling their waters at the tip of the continent. Driving back along the False Bay coastline, you will find several quaint seaside towns to explore along the way, and the African penguin colony at Boulders Beach is a delightful experience. While clumsy on the land, these birds become a picture of effortless grace when they “fly” through the water! Take a wander around the historic naval village of Simons Town, which is steeped in many tales of sea-faring adventures and anecdotes. The nearby Kalk Bay Harbour is used by many colorful working fishing boats, and the fishermen sell their catch at stalls upon the wharf, while seals splash and roll for scraps in the water below. Harbour House overlooks the bustle and color of Kalk Bay and is an excellent venue for a delicious seafood lunch accompanied by a wonderful wine list. Finally take a scenic meander back to Cape Town via the colorful beach houses of Muizenberg and the oldest wine estates of the country in Constantia, stopping for a tasting or two along the way.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - The Magnificent Wine Country
dayInfo.description: Stellenbosch and Somerset West represent the heartland of the Cape’s Winelands, set at the foot of the soaring Jonkershoek and Helderberg Mountains. Offering hundreds of estates to choose from, there are a few delightful surprises in the region. The Waterford Wine Estate stands out among the multitude for its unique chocolate and wine pairing experience, which is a taste sensation like no other! In the picturesque and welcoming atmosphere of the estate, you may be able to meet the winemaker and chocolatier for fusions of chocolate and wine that melt on the tongue in an astonishing combination of flavors that will have you begging for more! With your taste buds singing, continue through the spectacular scenery of the wine country, visiting several choice estates along the way. Drive over the Helshoogte Pass with its two estates, Tokara and Delaire Graff basking in tremendous wraparound views of vineyards, mountains and ocean before descending into the Franschoek Valley. Franschhoek (French Corner) is the undisputed wine and culinary capital of South Africa. With its uniquely French atmosphere that’s reminiscent of Provence, there are no fewer than eight award-winning restaurants gathered in the valley. Arrive at your delightfully eclectic hotel, which is the handiwork of an interior designer and an art historian, you will find it to be grandly elegant, sumptuous and quirky at the same time, set within a location of jaw-dropping, natural beauty.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - Culinary Experience
dayInfo.description: Join the chef at your hotel on a gastronomic adventure through Franschhoek as he gathers the fresh produce of the region for your culinary indulgence. With the best products in the country available here, you will find the cheeses, olive oils, herbs, vegetables and fruits bursting with flavor, not to mention the charcuterie, for your unparalleled gourmet experience. Stop along the way at one of the estates for a delicious lunch and tasting of exquisite wines to refresh and fortify your endeavors before returning to your hotel, suitably prepared for your evening’s indulgence. In the show kitchen, either join the chef in his preparations, or simply relax in the candlelight with a glass of excellent wine as he prepares the feast before your eyes. Enjoy the scrumptious fruits of your labors in the baroque elegance of the dining room or out on the terrace, sipping a fine vintage and giving in to absolute sensory pleasure.

dayInfo.title: Rovos Rail - On the Luxury Train
dayInfo.description: Depart Franschhoek with a fond farewell and drive to Cape Town station, where the Rovos Rail train awaits you. Blending pre-war elegance and refinement with modern amenities and service, this is the ultimate way to travel slowly through South Africa’s ‘World In One Country.’ The suites are masterfully designed for space and comfort and are some of the largest in the world. Enjoy the privacy and exclusivity of this sophisticated mode of travel as you take in the splendid views from the large picture windows. Traveling through the dramatic Cape mountains, you come to the quaint Victorian town of Matjiesfontein, preserved since 1890 when it was established as a refreshment stop by Mr. Logan. A fascinating museum on the platform charts the multifaceted history of the town and surrounds. The scenery then transforms as the Karoo rolls out before you. Rocky and arid, the region boasts incredible geological formations and vistas that stretch on forever. The train halts for a tour of Kimberley, a former diamond-rush town in the late 1800s, and includes a visit to the Diamond Mine Museum and the Big Hole, the largest man-made excavation on Earth. The journey then passes the rolling landscape and mountains of the Free State before emerging on the golden plains of the Highveld, where the train pulls in to Pretoria.

dayInfo.title: Thornybush Private Reserve - Into the Wilderness
dayInfo.description: A charter flight from nearby Johannesburg takes you to the renowned wilderness region of the Lowveld, home of the famed Kruger National Park and the adjacent Thornybush Private Reserve. Meeting you at the airstrip, your guide will take you on a short game drive to your safari lodge. Set in a stunning location, deep in the African bush, this lodge will simply take your breath away. Each palatial suites feature air-conditioning, an infinty pool and a private verandah to enjoy the sights and sounds of the surrounding wilderness. Raised walkways link the suites to the impressively elegant main buildings and spa. No element of comfort or modern amenity is spared here, and the level of service and cuisine are of a world-class standard, located in a wilderness setting like no other. Venturing out on twice-daily game drives, you will encounter a plethora of animals and birds here. While the Big Five are sought-after animals to spot (elephant, buffalo, rhino, lion and leopard), there is so much more to absorb and experience than a mere checklist of species. Allow the magic of the wilderness to embrace you, and you will find an altogether holistic experience that is quite unlike any other. Your guide and tracker will draw on their immense knowledge and experience of the area to show you the intimate secrets of the wild, sharing their expertise in a manner that is both informative and engaging. Up close and personal encounters with a variety of animals are bound to happen, and thrilling experiences await you in this most special of reserves. The leopards here are renowned for their relaxed behavior, where they regally go about their lives disdainfully ignoring the clicking of cameras with the practiced ease of Hollywood celebrities. Nothing can prepare you for the awe you will feel at your first sighting of a pride of lions: the sheer presence of these magnificent cats, coupled with rippling muscles and their haunting amber eyes, will send a shiver down your spine. Stopping at a scenic spot to allow you to stretch your legs, your guide will produce a hamper of ice-cold drinks and delicious snacks from the kitchen. In the last light of the setting sun, you gaze out over this spectacular wilderness, at peace with your surroundings as you toast the magnificence of an African sunset. In the gathering dusk, you drive back to the lodge with the aid of a spotlight to seek out nocturnal animals as they emerge into the night. Glowing eyes reveal civets and genets moving acrobatically through the trees, while close to the ground the red eyes of a spotted hyena come into view. These much-maligned animals are as fierce a predator as their competitors the lions, and with their easy loping stride they can tirelessly cover miles in pursuit of prey. Returning to the lodge, you find it ablaze with light from lanterns, and the sumptuous colors of the furniture and fabrics glow richly, welcoming you home. An indulgent feast awaits you for dinner, accompanied by the best wines from the sensational offerings in the cellar. As the sounds of the African night serenade you from the outside, enjoy a convivial evening listening to easy conversation and tales of adventures in the bush from your guide. Moving out to the fireplace for a final nightcap, marvel at the shower of stars above you before slipping off to your suite. Drift off in blissful slumber, while the distant roars of a lion and the whoops of a hyena echo through the stillness of the night.

dayInfo.title: Thornybush Private Reserve - Homeward Bound
dayInfo.description: After three nights of magical African encounters, thrilling game drives, blissful spa treatments and wonderful cuisine, it is finally time to depart. During the flight to Johannesburg, where the journey ends, reminisce on the magical experiences that South Africa has given you. You are now one of the select few to have enjoyed the pleasures of Cape Town and its wine country, the utterly unique Rovos Rail, and of course, the sheer excitement of encountering the Big Five in the wild.

tourName: Immersive African Safari & More: Kenya, Victoria Falls, Kruger
placesVisited: Nairobi, Lewa Wildlife Conservancy, Maasai Mara National Reserve, Victoria Falls, Cape Town, Kruger National Park
generalInfo: Witness five of Africa’s most iconic destinations on your 14-day African safari for first-time visitors. You will have guided game drives through the Maasai Mara and panoramic views of Victoria Falls. Table Mountain will act as a backdrop to Cape Town’s history and culture while the Laikipia Plateau reveals diversity in the semi-arid plains. Your adventure in Kenya, South Africa, and Zambia will combine luxury, beauty, and wonder.

dayInfo.title: Nairobi – Overnight With Giraffe
dayInfo.description: From the street, you may spot a giraffe, and their necks may crane over a tree, which will be a surreal welcome after landing in Kenya’s capital city. You will weave into the trees, and there will be more endangered Rothschild giraffes in the hotel garden. Your suite will be tucked away with excellent panoramas from the first-floor window. Giraffes like to visit this suite, sometimes popping their heads through the window. These animal introductions showcase the Kenyan experience. There is so much wildlife that it is not confined to national parks. Even when not on a safari, there will be beautiful moments with Africa’s four-legged giants, and you know you are in Africa when giraffes are beside your hotel window.

dayInfo.title: Lewa Wildlife Conservancy – Discovering the Safari Experience
dayInfo.description: A black rhino may trot bashfully past your vehicle on route to a bushy hiding place, and Zebras may graze around your suite, lifting their heads to say hello. Later, you may spot an elephant herd, including a newborn that likes to stay close to its mother. Hippos may make an appearance during a picnic lunch, and wildebeest may bring enthusiasm to the early afternoon. Then, this afternoon, you may catch a glimpse of a lion. Within a few hours of arriving, your tick list will be completed, and this is just the beginning of your African safari adventure. Laikipia is a great place to start for any first-time safari. You will be staying in Lewa Wildlife Conservancy, which is one of the unfenced, private reserves on the plateau. Animals move freely between these reserves, but human access is heavily restricted, which helps to preserve the land and provide a more private visitor experience. In relative terms, the conservancy is small and compact. Here, you can encounter a large range of animals without needing a long game drive. You can explore slowly, starting to understand wildlife behavior and getting a good feel for the day-to-day safari experience. Safaris are always fun adventures. Few first-time visitors appreciate how tranquil they can be. Nature will write the script, and the digital detox will provide wonders for wellbeing. Stresses will melt away as elephants wander past, and monkeys chirp their morning alarm call. Animals will appear as nearby silhouettes as you sit around an evening campfire. The lodge will be rustically luxurious as it is converted farmstead that has been preserved in the old-world style. Again, it will be something to ease you into the safari. For two days, you will drive and walk in the reserve with rhino encounters being a particular highlight. Rhinos are one of the continent’s most hard to find sights, and in Lewa, there are both black and white species. Plus, it is possible to go on game walks, so you may feel their presence more keenly.

dayInfo.title: Maasai Mara – Wonders of the Maasai Mara Private Safari
dayInfo.description: Now that you have experienced the safari atmosphere, it is time to visit Africa’s most famous safari destination. You will fly directly to the Maasai Mara and admire how the grasslands unfold. Wildebeests may gather in the thousands, which are euphoric animals that are full of energy. Zebras may crowd in tight groups, so their black and white stripes create a blur and fool predators. Thomson’s gazelles may skip around, bouncing endlessly over the grass. You saw buffalo in Laikipia, but now the herds have multiplied, sometimes 80 individuals marching in unison. Laikipia shows you the animals, and now the Maasai Mara reveals Africa’s wildlife abundance. From July to September, there are more wild, four-legged mammals here than anywhere else on the continent. For every other month of the year, there is still an unfathomable density of life. You will be staying in Mara Naboisho, which is a private conservancy that is adjacent to the Maasai Mara National Reserve. Here, you will see all of the same animals but without any crowds. These quieter plains are very attractive to certain animals, especially spotted cats who are raising their cubs. Local guides take visitors around the same concession each day. This gives them an intimate understanding of different territories, especially where elusive and solitary animals hide. It is not uncommon to encounter more than one leopard or a cheetah on every single drive. Drivers are permitted to take you off the main trails inside the conservancy, and this enhances the intimacy with the animals as you can safely approach all the different wildlife rather than just watching it from the trail. Day four will be spent in the conservancy, experiencing the wonders of the Maasai Mara. From lions battling zebra to cheetah cubs peering from the grass, the destination lives up to its hype. On day five, you will explore Maasai Mara Game Reserve with a full-day game drive and a picnic lunch that will overlook the Mara River. During this experience, you will pass hundreds of thousands of wild mammals. Even when the wildebeest migration is not in the Maasai Mara, the quantity of life makes for continual theater. You may watch animals interact at a watering hole, and you may see another pride of lions. Here, you will feel the wilderness and drift off to the evocative calls of nature.

dayInfo.title: Nairobi – Hot Air Ballooning Over the Mara
dayInfo.description: You will have an early start this morning as you start floating at dawn. A hot air balloon will offer you a magnificent aerial perspective with ochre kopjes , or rocky outcrops, contrasting the vast open plains. From here, you witness how herds continually move to fresh pastures. Like everything on a safari, there will be a sense of adventure, but it will also be a serene escape into a world that is so different from your home. You will land for a second breakfast and then fly back to Nairobi. The afternoon and evening will be at your leisure and provide some downtime to reflect on what you have experienced so far.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls – Experiences The Smoke That Thunders
dayInfo.description: Today, you will fly from Nairobi to Victoria Falls, and the contrast in the landscape will be incredible. After Kenya’s open plains, the lush riverine forest will greet you when you land. As you walk through the trees, you can hear your destination. Victoria Falls thunders a baritone growl that echoes into the forest. You can glimpse the falls through the trees before the first viewpoint looks across the canyon as a circular rainbow may appear in the mist. Following a one-mile trail, you will walk parallel to Victoria Falls, stopping at over a dozen viewpoints. You will get so close that mist will rain down and drench you in an instant. Today, you will have the full afternoon at the falls before a quiet evening along the Zambezi riverbank.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls – Hippos and Rhinos, Adventures and Cruising
dayInfo.description: After a few days of early starts, today will be a chance to relax and take things slowly around breakfast. Hippos may be spotted directly from the lodge while a nearby park may bring rhino encounters. You may choose to go canoeing on the river with guides skillfully keeping you clear of the hippo pods. There will be an option for a scenic flight above the falls. The most popular activity on a two-day itinerary is to cross the bridge into Zambia and witness the falls from the other side as well as the atmosphere in a different country. All these activities can be arranged locally. The day ends with a sunset cruise on the Zambezi River, which will include food, drinks, and plenty of elephants.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Gasping at Table Mountain
dayInfo.description: Two days after arriving, you will leave Victoria Falls on a direct flight to Cape Town. Again, the landscape will change dramatically. Table Mountain dominates as an imperious ode to nature’s power over urban life. Much of this vacation is spent in the wilderness, so city streets will provide a nice interlude. You can check out boutique cafes, vibrant markets, colorful houses, Atlantic Ocean beaches, and the positive ambiance that makes Cape Town so special. Later in the afternoon, a guide will take you to Table Mountain. You will ascend in a cable car and then walk one of the lesser-known mountaintop trails. You will remain on the summit for sunset before a dip into the city’s superb dining scene.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Robben Island and the Mother City
dayInfo.description: Mandela spent 18 years incarcerated on the UNESCO world heritage site of Robben Island, and his former prison guard will be your guide this morning. Your guide narrates fabulous tales of friendship with Mandela, providing an intimate insight into the man’s character and beliefs. Continuing with the cultural theme, you will spend the rest of today exploring Cape Town’s highlight where you will wander the vibrant old neighborhood of Bo Kaap. You can explore the changes that are taking place in District Six, and see some of the early colonial architecture along with the city’s modern and multicultural sides. There will be time left over to visit boutique shops in the V & A Waterfront or the beach in Camps Bay.

dayInfo.title: Mala Mala Game Reserve – Intimate Big-Game Safari in the Kruger
dayInfo.description: Today, you will land in Mala Mala, and you will be back among the wildlife. Elephants may use their trunks as trumpets, lions may stare straight into your eyes, and springbok and kudu may skip around the savannah. It will feel good to be back on a safari, experiencing the atmosphere and animals one more time. The Kruger is another of Africa’s most legendary destinations. It is one of the continent’s largest and oldest protected areas with the trans-frontier conservation area larger than the State of New Jersey. Mala Mala is the most wildlife-rich area within this ecosystem thanks to its constant water flow and broad range of vegetation. Within an hour of landing, the diversity of wildlife encounters may be quite remarkable. You will spend three days going on game drives and short game walks in this private conservancy. Again, a private conservancy means more intimate animal encounters and no crowds. There is a strict rule of two vehicles per sighting, and only guests that are staying at a Mala Mala lodge are permitted inside the conservancy. Soon, you will lose track of the lion prides, the buffalo herds, and baboon troops. Now, you can quickly identify hartebeests, impalas, and elands. Giraffes may be so common that they start blending into the landscape. It may feel like zebra and wildebeest are part of every vista. Kruger will live up to its reputation when you safari in one of its private reserves. Mala Mala has the best location of all the Sabi Sands private game reserves as it has the longest border with Kruger National Park. Here you will be deep in the bush and not on the outskirts. Nighttime game drives will also add something new to your experience. Leopards can be abundant and at night, and you may follow them as they prowl for food. You may also encounter peculiar nocturnal creatures, adding more to the list of animals that you have encountered. Most of all, a safari in Mala Mala provides the opportunity to relax. You will sit around a fire with a drink in hand as you watch animals approach the floodlit river below.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg – Departure
dayInfo.description: After a final game drive, you will transfer from the Sabi Sands to Johannesburg. There will be a short transfer to the international terminal for your outbound flight.

tourName: Intimate Exploration of South Africa: Safari and Starry Skies
placesVisited: Phinda Private Game Reserve, MalaMala Game Reserve
generalInfo: Capture postcard-perfect images galore as you search South Africa from the forested woodlands of Phinda Private Game Reserve to the savannahs of MalaMala Game Reserve on this breathtaking 9-day wilderness adventure. Your discoveries will lead you to watering holes where predators lurk beyond the shrubbery and gentle giants graze vast pastures, all scenes to swoon over stationed right outside your spectacular accommodations.

dayInfo.title: Phinda Private Game Reserve - Seven Worlds of Wonder
dayInfo.description: After a brief transfer from Johannesburg to the luxuriant wildlands of KwaZulu-Natal, you will arrive at Phinda Private Game Reserve, a destination described as the ‘Seven Worlds of Wonder.’ The untouched landscape is composed of lush wetlands and emerald forests, in which your stunning, award-winning accommodation lays nestled beneath the rustling branches of the canopy. After unpacking in your Zulu zen suite, you may join a knowledgeable ranger for an afternoon galavanting through the green before turning in this evening for a peaceful rest underneath the clear, starry sky.

dayInfo.title: Phinda Private Game Reserve - Searching for the Big Five
dayInfo.description: As the African sun rises above Phinda and illuminates the diverse topography in a golden glow, you will hear the echoes of birds whistling from nests hidden in the trees. A sumptuous breakfast spread enjoyed with views of the unspoiled scenery will jump-start a day of adventure escorted by an experienced ranger. Today, you will be on the keen lookout for lions, leopards, rhinos, elephants, and buffaloes, the iconic animals constituting South Africa’s famous Big Five. Journeys across shrub-speckled plains and to tranquil watering holes may reward you with these sightings as you search by morning and afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Phinda Private Game Reserve - Rare Encounters within the Brush
dayInfo.description: While certainly a highlight, the Big Five are but a few of the remarkable animal encounters you may cherish during your days perusing the phenomenal environments of Phinda. Today, you will set course for dusty river beds and fever tree forests in the hope of catching glimpses of rare beasts hidden between the greenery. You may find yourself holding your breath as cheetahs educate their cubs on the art of hunting or giddy with joy as you spot the incredibly rare and shy Suni antelope rustling through the underbrush. Furthermore, you will search for nocturnal creatures by floodlight this evening.

dayInfo.title: Phinda Private Game Reserve - A Night Under the Stars
dayInfo.description: Spend your final day in Phinda wallowing in the luxury of your charming accommodation and the breathtaking landscape on which it rests. Whether unwinding with a delightful spa treatment doused in aromatic essential oils or making tracks for a nearby village to immerse yourself in the culture of the Zulu tribal people, you will be spoiled for choice with adventures unlocking the majesty of KwaZulu-Natal. In the evening, you may spend a night under the stars as you pull up a chair around the blazing campfire and doze off on beds stationed in the clearing and guarded against lurking creatures.

dayInfo.title: MalaMala Game Reserve - Picture-Perfect Scenes in Northeast South Africa
dayInfo.description: Your South African safari adventures will lead you to a gorgeous resort hemmed in the forested northeastern reaches of the country, pinned in the MalaMala Game Reserve bordering the Kruger National Park. MalaMala’s photogenic environments and rich collection of wildlife will be yours to explore from the minute you arrive, chaperoned by knowledgeable rangers who will track the curious creatures wandering through the flourishing bushveld, immense savannah, and riverine woodlands. In the evening, you will tuck into a candlelit dinner accompanied by panoramas of the postcard-perfect wilderness backdrop.

dayInfo.title: MalaMala Game Reserve - Unparalleled Big Five Photography
dayInfo.description: You may capture the spoils of South Africa’s wilderness like never before on a unique photographic game drive in a vehicle equipped with world-class equipment. Joined by an insightful ranger and professional photographer, you will hone your skills as you snap up images of your remarkable wildlife encounters. Heading for watering holes home to wallowing buffalos and sweeping across pastures where lions laze around in the warm sun, you will capture the Big Five over the course of the day, curating your own collection of spectacular images commemorating your discoveries.

dayInfo.title: MalaMala Game Reserve - Wandering through the Bucolic Bush
dayInfo.description: You may witness MalaMala by foot today as you forego the vehicles for an endearing stroll through the woodlands alongside a spirited ranger and spotter. You will see the bush from an entirely different vantage point, allowing you to get up close to the creatures and smell the fragrant flowers as you meander along rugged pathways winding through the greenery. Along the way, you will learn about the endemic animals and the efforts to conserve their environments while the melodic echoes of the wilderness billow from all around you.

dayInfo.title: MalaMala Game Reserve - Visions of the African Night Sky
dayInfo.description: Wallowing in the wilderness is a given during your stay at MalaMala, an activity you may relish during a quiet sunrise game drive this morning or a leisurely stroll along the wilderness-flanked trails. How you spend your day within this breathtaking environment is entirely up to you, and you may also relax during your last day as you enjoy your accommodation’s top-tier amenities, such as a vitalizing spa treatment under the soaring forest canopy. In the evening, you will discover the cosmos as you partake in a sensational star-gazing experience beneath the dreamy night sky.

dayInfo.title: MalaMala Game Reserve - Goodbyes beneath the African Sun
dayInfo.description: The morning sun will peek through your curtains and beckon you to your balcony, where you may slowly sip on a steamy cup of coffee while nature comes to life around you. As sad as it will be to leave this dreamy paradise, it will be marvelous to look back on these stunning adventures taking in all that the spellbinding wilderness has to offer. After packing your things and enjoying a delectable breakfast, you will meet your private transfer and make your way to the airport, savoring the spectacular scenery one last time before you leave.

tourName: Kruger & Sabi Sands Safari for First Timers
placesVisited: Kruger National Park, Balule Nature Reserve, Sabi Sands
generalInfo: Kruger blends all the classic ingredients for a first-time safari. Rugged adventure in the wilderness, luxurious camps overlooking the river, an abundance and diversity of wildlife, plus a range of different activities. This tailored itinerary captures all the inspiring experiences, enveloping you in nature's untamed realm. There are three days of intimate encounters in Balule, three days discovering Kruger's compelling scale and three days of unrivaled luxury safari in Sabi Sands.

dayInfo.title: Balule Nature Reserve – Relaxed Safari Welcomes
dayInfo.description: Land in Africa for the first time and there's always anticipation. All the photos, all the wildlife documentaries; is that what it's really like? Touch down and the mystique captivates, a savanna landscape stretching beyond the horizon. Look closely and nothing is still. An elephant roams alone through the bushwillow trees. Giraffes stand like sentinels to a lost world. Black dots create a patchwork; get closer and they become cinematic buffalo herds. Balule is home to all the revered African animals, making it an indelible place to start a safari. Within the first hour, the questions in your mind have been redefined. It's no longer “will I see this animal and that animal?” but rather, “how many times am I going to encounter them?” After the short transfer from the airstrip, you check into your boutique bush lodge that combines iconic safari luxury with a pristine sense of the wild. Throughout the day, yours is a luxurious base where the safari never stops. Dip into the pool with a zebra herd grazing nearby. Lounge on your wooden verandah and watch life approach the waterhole. Then enjoy two activities a day, game drives and walking safaris that take you across the inspiring big five landscape of Balule. Sharing unfenced boundaries with Kruger National Park, this is a fabled home of all Africa's great mammals. Nothing is guaranteed on a safari. But if you came for the big five, there's a good chance of seeing them all here, every day.

dayInfo.title: Balule Nature Reserve – Thrilling Game Drives and the Big Five
dayInfo.description: Gaze one way and a lion pride spreads out across the grassland, manes flowing in the cool morning breeze. Look the other and a rhino's horn is heading straight for the safari vehicle. Along the horizon are the giants; elephants, giraffes, dust kicked up from marauding herds. Refocus and just meters away are the small and noisy, a troop of baboons or vervet monkeys swinging through the trees. It's sometimes too much to take in, such a diversity of life roaming before your eyes. The sights come thick and fast, almost every turn on the dusty trail revealing something new. You follow the classic safari itinerary here, with a long morning game drive followed by a few hours of tranquil time at the lodge. Explore again in the afternoon, staying out until dusk, savoring the thrills of a raw African safari.

dayInfo.title: Balule Nature Reserve – A Walking Safari Provides a New Angle
dayInfo.description: Now a new angle is introduced. It's the same landscape, teeming with the big five and more. But now you're exploring it on foot. Local trackers guide the way, piecing together minute clues as they take you away from the big cats and towards the ungulate herds. An armed ranger is also with you, ensuring nothing gets too close. It rarely does, as the trackers' phenomenal knowledge weaves a path straight to a herd of zebra, then a tower of giraffe, now a grazing kudu herd and the skipping steps of springbok. Every piece of animal dung is understood, every indent in a tree can be analyzed, every change in animal behavior guides your next steps. Walking safaris are all about intimacy.
