generalInfo: The Rainbow Nation is yours to explore on this astounding 12-day adventure leading from Cape Town to Madikwe Game Reserve. Tailormade to spotlight the fascinating local culture, remarkable history, and heritage, as well as the wondrous unspoiled wilderness, this journey across South Africa is set to reveal a country more beautiful than one may believe made possible through participating in an array of enchanting activities.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Paradise on the Shores of the Western Cape
dayInfo.description: Table Mountain climbs to the clouds from Cape Town city’s borders, velvety beaches hug the coastline that wraps around Cape Peninsula, and emerald wilderness havens sweep slices of the Western Cape’s cosmopolitan jewel destination. You will gaze upon these mesmerizing scenes as your airplane approaches the international airport and you transfer with your private driver to an accommodation tucked away in Bantry Bay. With views of the sparkling sea ahead and scenes of the soaring mountains behind, you will feel swept away by the paradise shores of the Western Cape.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Unraveling the History of the Rainbow Nation
dayInfo.description: There are numerous cultural activities to partake in and around Cape Town, and you will spend your day exploring the most iconic ones alongside a knowledgeable local guide. Weather permitting, you will ascend to the heavens and find refuge at lookout points stationed on the summit of Table Mountain. Afterward, you will return to the ground and stroll within the landscaped lawns of company gardens, feeding the scuttling squirrels who call this sanctuary home. With an abundance of museums and landmarks to discover, your journey through the city of Cape Town will unravel the history of the Rainbow Nation.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Beauty Beyond the City’s Borders
dayInfo.description: While the city of Cape Town holds many marvelous mysteries to uncover, beyond its borders is a wealth of wondrous wilderness to encounter. Today, you will join your insider tour guide and swoop across the rugged Western Cape coastline, cruising along the famous Cape Peninsula to stunning scenic destinations along the way. From the boundless boulders of Boulders Beach, where penguins gather in friendly communion, to the breathtaking vistas of the tip of Africa at Cape Point Nature Reserve, you will be besotted with the untamed beauty of Cape Town’s neighboring regions.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - Seclusion in the Emerald Franschhoek Valley
dayInfo.description: Today marks your adventures deeper into the Western Cape countryside as you meet your private transfer in the morning and travel to the humble town of Franschhoek, a destination brimming with history and nestled in the foothills of the evergreen Franschhoek Valley. Before arriving at your gorgeous boutique accommodation, you may bask in the golden sunshine on the secluded terraces of local wineries, where you may indulge in a selection of the country’s finest vintages. Such scenes to swoon over will make the short transfer worth it, as these are some of the best emerald vistas in the Western Cape.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - The Fabulous Flavors of Franschhoek’s Wines
dayInfo.description: While you may have sipped on a few distinct vintages during your first day in the Franschhoek Valley, there are few things quite as remarkable as touring its elite estates alongside a professional guide and sommelier. With insider knowledge of the best vineyards in the region, you will be swept away to the finest wine destinations speckling the unspoiled valley. At each estate, you may enjoy guided tours alongside the winemakers of their prestigious cellars and galleries. Furthermore, you will sip on the sumptuous vintages and tuck into an assortment of delectable treats perfectly paired with each glass of wine.

dayInfo.title: Kapama Private Game Reserve - The Starry South African Sky
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will head with your private transfer to Cape Town International Airport to begin the second leg of your South African adventure. Your flight will send you from the sunny shores of Cape Town’s coastline to the forested grasslands of Kapama Private Game Reserve, one of the country’s many bewitching wildlife havens. Arriving at camp, either enjoy an afternoon unwinding from within the balmy waters of your accommodation’s pool or set out on your first game drive to view the majestic wildlife before the symphony of wilderness sounds reach their crescendo as the stars twinkle in the night sky.

dayInfo.title: Kapama Private Game Reserve - Searching the Bushveld for the Big Five
dayInfo.description: Today, you will wake up early in the morning before the sun has peered above the horizon to catch the glorious sunrise from a spectacular vantage point. You will watch as the wilderness comes to life in front of a fiery orange sunrise silhouette before venturing further into the forest to see what other mysteries lie between the green. Returning to camp after your safari, you may take the opportunity to refresh your mind and body with a vitalizing spa before heading back out in search of the magnificent Big Five this afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Kapama Private Game Reserve - Unique Animal Encounters in Kapama
dayInfo.description: Besides game drives through the bushveld, where you may capture the many creatures in their natural habitats, there are additional activities to partake in should you wish to during your stay in Kapama. You may enjoy a private interaction with the elephants, where you will learn about these magnificent beasts and the country’s efforts to protect them, or a trip to the clouds in a hot air balloon, where you will marvel at the bird’s eye views of the forested sanctuary in all its untouched glory. How you encounter the wondrous wilderness of Kapama will be entirely up to you.

dayInfo.title: Madikwe Game Reserve - Your Second Stay in Wildlife Paradise
dayInfo.description: You will spend your final adventures in South Africa in the rugged regions encompassing Madikwe Game Reserve. From grasslands stretching as far as the eye can see to the rocky Tshwene Tshwene Hills that rise and fall across the pastures, there is majesty sweeping the sanctuary of Madikwe that you will soon discover after your transfer to the reserve. For the time being, you may enjoy an afternoon basking in the radiant sunshine and swimming lazily in the crystal clear pool before turning in for an early evening enhanced by the sounds of the singing wilderness.

dayInfo.title: Madikwe Game Reserve - Meandering through Majestic Madikwe
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you will join a Field Guide and Tracker who will be your expert wilderness guide through the diverse and rugged terrain of Madikwe. Your safari across the bushveld will reveal all that South Africa is famous for, from the roaring lions pacing across golden pastures to the mighty elephants bathing in cool rivers and spraying one another with their snouts. The animals are left to their own devices here, and you are merely an observer witnessing them go about their days. During your safari adventures, you will snap hundreds of glorious shots capturing momentous natural moments.

dayInfo.title: Madikwe Game Reserve - Fine Dining amongst the Green
dayInfo.description: Madikwe is not only known for its spectacular safari drives, but there are many breathtaking activities to keep you entertained during your stay in the unspoiled sanctuary. From sipping on specially brewed teas and tucking into delightful treats during High Tea to enjoying dinner by candlelight surrounded by the wilderness, Madikwe is a culinary destination as much as it is a wildlife one. Today, you may indulge in the fabulous flavors of South African cuisine prepared by esteemed chefs and culinary prodigies, all while swooning over the wilderness scenes.

dayInfo.title: Madikwe Game Reserve - Slow, Radiant Mornings in the African Bush
dayInfo.description: The sunshine will dance between the trees and embellish your accommodation in a golden glow as the African sun burns through the clouds. The birds will sing sweet songs from the nearby branches to ring in the new day. As you make your way to the restaurant for breakfast, you may catch a glimpse of nature coming to life from the pathways weaving through the grasslands. These are the moments you will cherish the most as you slowly pack your things after breakfast in time to meet your private transfer headed for the airport.

tourName: Personalized South Africa Safari: Greater Kruger & More
placesVisited: Cape Town, Franschhoek, Sabi Sands Game Reserve
generalInfo: Let Cape Town’s cosmopolitan charm and cultural allure dazzle you, Franschhoek’s deep-rooted history and wine-making heritage entice you, and Sabi Sands Game Reserve’s gorgeous green grasslands and abundant wildlife enchant you on this 10-day classic South African tour and safari. With guided experiences and time at leisure allowing you to experience the best of these destinations, the stage is set for a spectacular stay.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Touching Down in South Africa’s Mother City
dayInfo.description: The mother city of South Africa, Cape Town, boasts a romantic cityscape bursting with cultural charm and sophisticated allure. The world-famous Western Cape escape also brags postcard Blue Flag beaches, iconic museums, and a surrounding wilderness that will seduce you from the moment you arrive and transfer to your accommodation tucked away in the foothills of Table Mountain. Today, you may embrace the sights, sounds, and smells of the vibrant cityscape during activities of your choice, from a night on the town to a stroll along the V&A Waterfront.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Captivating Cruise around the Cape Peninsula
dayInfo.description: You will be collected at your hotel in the morning and cruise through the city along the Atlantic seaboard towards the charming fishing village of Hout Bay. Here, you will visit markets and boutique stores sharing a glimpse of traditional Cape lifestyle before continuing up the prominent Chapman’s Peak Drive to viewpoints overlooking the boundless seascape. Venturing around the Cape Peninsula, you will find refuge at picturesque beaches hugging its rugged coastline and relish sights of massive penguin colonies swarming Boulders Beach as well as the meeting point of the Atlantic and Indian Oceans at the Cape of Good Hope.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Explore the Cityscape at Your Pace
dayInfo.description: Today, you may enjoy Cape Town at your leisure and partake in any number of activities sharing more of the city’s cosmopolitan and historical appeal. At the summit of Table Mountain, accessed easily by cable car, views of the Western Cape stretch as far as the eye can see. Across the Atlantic Ocean at Robben Island, the history of former visionary president Nelson Mandela is brought to life. Within the city’s borders, districts like the Bo-Kaap reflect Cape Malay culture, and museum exhibitions such as the Zietz MOCAA share a look into South Africa’s artistic talent.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - Discovering the Distinctions of Cape Wine
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will pack your bags and begin your exciting adventure from Cape Town to the rolling hills of Franschhoek. To make matters more compelling, you will revel in a guided Cape Winelands tour en route to your next accommodation. From Constantia’s famous wine farms to Stellenbosch’s cascading olive-green vineyards, the Cape Winelands is a world-renowned wine bottling region boasting a collection of elite estates set on dreamy vineyard backdrops. Today, you will learn more about the wines with sommeliers and tuck into canapés paired with exceptional vintages.

dayInfo.title: Franschhoek - Sumptuous Wines and Huguenot History
dayInfo.description: The quaint town of Franschhoek is a history buff’s and wine aficionado’s dream escape, bragging several revered estates, cultural farmhouses, and museums sharing insight into the destination’s Huguenot origins. From sipping on sumptuous wines on charming terraces overlooking the lush landscapes to delving into the history of the Huguenot settlers and dining on exquisite farm-to-table meals, you will appreciate every second spent indulging in the pleasures of the Franschhoek valley. You may even delight in the option of exploring the endearing region by vintage automobile.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - From the Cape to Kruger
dayInfo.description: Today, you will be collected in the morning and transferred to Cape Town International Airport for your flight from the Western Cape to the Greater Kruger National Park. The enormous wildlife sanctuary covers vast parts of the country’s northeastern landscape and comprises several privately owned reserves conserving significant slices of the South African wilderness. You will soon enter the gates of Sabi Sands Game Reserve, one of Kruger’s premier retreats home to the Big Five, a myriad of bird varieties, and a rich tapestry of untouched environments.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - Primal Nature Sightings in Sabi Sands
dayInfo.description: There is no dawdling in Sabi Sands as the animals wait for nobody, so you will set off with your knowledgeable ranger before dawn and track various animals as you cruise across the lush bushveld. You may be lucky enough to witness a pride of lions lounging in the shade or pacing across the park, a variety of herbivores gathering together around tranquil waterholes to escape the sun and improve their chances of survival, and birds of prey circling the sky in search of their next victim. You will experience nature at its purest and most primal.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - Searching for the Finest Safari Details
dayInfo.description: Safari drives are a signature wildlife activity in the Kruger area. However, bushwalks are a unique opportunity to witness the wilderness from a new vantage point and gain a greater perspective and respect for the country’s untamed game. You will smell the fragrant flowers peppering the luxuriant pastures, watch the hardy rhino beetles scuttle along large leaves, and capture images of colorful birdlife singing from the trees as you stroll through Sabi Sands with your armed ranger in search of the Little Five, birds, and indigenous plant life.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - Photography and Pampering in the Pristine Park
dayInfo.description: Take your safaris in Sabi Sands to the next level with a unique photographic experience across the reserve. You will join your ranger and jump into a decked-out 4x4 vehicle complete with the latest camera technology. Your guide will show you impressive viewpoints and track several significant wildlife species in the hope of allowing you to capture iconic African images with your professional equipment. Beyond the breathtaking photos that you take, you will return to camp having made magical memories. An energizing spa therapy upon your arrival will be the cherry on top of your day.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve - The Wilderness’ Crescendo
dayInfo.description: Though your South African safari adventures will be coming to an end today, you will relish every last moment spent in Sabi Sands Game Reserve this morning as you savor breakfast with views of the prolific bushveld. You will watch zebra and warthog dash across the grassland as the sounds of whistling birds and rattling crickets reach a crescendo. These are the periods between the safari action where you will have a moment’s peace to absorb the liberating wilderness atmosphere before you enjoy your last game drive and transfer to the airport.

tourName: Private Kruger Safari for First-Time Senior Visitors to Africa
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Timbavati Game Reserve, Sabi Sands Game Reserve, Kruger National Park
generalInfo: Silver service dining as elephants wander below, relaxed two-hour game drives revealing the Big Five and more, luxurious lodge accommodation celebrating the authenticity of the wild; the Kruger’s private reserves are perfect for senior travelers on their first visit to Africa. With this two-destination Kruger safari, you travel in style, exploring at a relaxed pace and uncovering all the famous wonders. It reveals the beauty of Africa without having to jump from your comfort zone.

dayInfo.title: Timbavati Game Reserve – Embark on a Rich Wildlife Journey
dayInfo.description: Picture an African safari and so many images swirl around. Perhaps zebras galloping into the distance, elephants locking trunks at a waterhole, or the flowing mane of a grandiose male lion? Or maybe your safari daydreams feature hippos along the river, giraffes wandering past the vehicle, or a leopard hiding high in a tree? Timbavati responds to all these preconceptions and much more. Located on the western side of the Greater Kruger ecosystem and sharing an unfenced boundary with Kruger National Park, this is a game reserve that offers a wonderful diversity of wildlife. Such a varied roll call of animals makes it a perfect first-time safari destination. Even on the game drive from the airstrip to the lodge, you’re likely to encounter many of the animals from the top of your wish list. Your international flight lands at O. R. Tambo International in Johannesburg, Africa’s largest airport. After clearing immigration, you transfer onto a local flight to the Timbavati Airstrip, where you’re picked up in an open-sided safari vehicle. It’s a thrilling journey to your luxury safari camp accommodation, one that may even include the complete Big Five. Sit down to a sumptuous lunch then spend an hour or two relaxing in your suite. Then an afternoon game drive continues the relaxed unraveling of wild Africa, leading you past elephants, lions, buffalos, zebras, and giraffes. Returning for sundowners, you’ll already know how to recognize up to half a dozen different antelope species. After dinner in the traditional boma (covered meeting place), you drift off to sleep, already excited about tomorrow’s game drive.

dayInfo.title: Timbavati Game Reserve – Settling Into the Rhythm of Luxury Safari
dayInfo.description: Today you settle into the atmosphere and rhythm of a luxury African safari. Wake to the sounds of nature, hippos providing a sonorous bass to complement the tropical birds. Fresh tea and coffee are delivered to your private deck, along with a light snack to get you going. Early morning is the prime time to explore the bush, as many of the predators are on the prowl before the heat of the day kicks in. Spend an hour seeking out lions, cheetahs, and leopards, with an expert guide and tracker revealing their intimate knowledge of the landscape. They know where particular prides hang out, or where a leopard likes to hunt wildebeest. Then enjoy a hearty breakfast beneath a majestic bushwillow tree, a chance to energize, stretch your legs, and listen to the chirping of the endemic birds. On each morning, there’s an option to continue the safari adventure in the safari vehicle, or on foot. It’s your choice, as the program is fully flexible to your interests. You return to camp in the late morning. Relax and unwind on the viewing deck, take a snooze or check out the library, then indulge in an excellent lunch. When the heat of the day is dissolving away, you head out for a late-afternoon game drive. Explore at leisure, stopping for canapés and refreshments as the wonders of wild Africa gradually reveal themselves. Relatively unique to Timbavati, the game drive will continue after sunset, giving you some time to spot nocturnal animals. Whenever you’re ready, the guides will then head back to camp where a romantic dinner is waiting. It’s accompanied by fine South African red and white wines (chosen from an extensive list), along with the animals that roam along the savannah beneath the camp. Relax, indulge, drift off, and get ready to repeat this atmospheric day tomorrow.

dayInfo.title: Timbavati Game Reserve – Relaxed Luxury Safari in a Private Reserve
dayInfo.description: Each day on your Timbavati safari follows the same rhythm. But no two days are even remotely the same. One morning, you might spend an hour following a leopard, admiring the stealthy hunter, perhaps watching her take down a springbok. Sometimes you see the lions lounging lazily beneath a tree. At other times, you find lionesses on the prowl, or a pride tearing apart a zebra carcass. On every game drive, you’ll encounter hundreds of buffalo. But that’s nothing like seeing hundreds of buffalo congregating in one giant herd, with the guides getting you close enough to hear their hissing, exhaled breath. In such an abundant landscape, every few moments are going to bring fresh and exciting scenes. Game drives allow you to get close to the giants and the predators. This is when you see the most revered of safari scenes, such as the hunt, or animals mating. The guided walks move at a very slow pace and help you experience flora and fauna from a new angle. You’ll track different antelope, like kudu, springbok, and eland, along with gaining a detailed understanding of how each animal move. It’s all very safe, and like everything on the safari, runs according to your pace and mood.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve – Sublime Aerial Safari and the Beauty of the Sabi Sands
dayInfo.description: After three days of early morning starts, you can sleep in this morning, before enjoying a leisurely breakfast on the patio. A short game drive transfer takes you to the Timbavati Airstrip, for the short aerial safari to the Sabi Sands. Exclusive and enchanting, the journey above the Greater Kruger gives you a new impression of one of the world’s largest and oldest protected areas. A short game drive then introduces you to the Sabi Sands, which is arguably Africa’s most famous private game reserve. The Sabi and Sands Rivers have attracted an astonishing density of wildlife, and it’s even possible to see the Big Five on the drive from the airstrip to the lodge. Upon arrival, you enjoy refreshments and lunch, before an afternoon game drive continues your immersion in Africa’s wonders.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve – Charming Big Five Encounters
dayInfo.description: Over the three days in the Sabi Sands, you continue the relaxed safari program, with a private guide and tracker tailoring the timings to your needs. Like in Timbavati, early morning and late afternoon are when the savannah is at its most active and you can see the most thrilling safari scenes. Stop beside a bushwillow and gaze up at a leopard that’s draped across the highest branches. It returns your gaze, resplendent blue eyes shining through the foliage. Then it descends, bounding down the trunk and heading off on a hunt. You follow at a respectful distance, goosebumps rising on your arms as the spotted hunters attack a herd of wildebeest. Sometimes it’s a success, and the leopard emerges carrying a carcass. At other times a sentinel raises the alarm, and you watch a herd scatter in fear. An African safari isn’t about seeing animals in isolation. By spending seven days, you’ve become engrossed in their world, settled into the ambiance of a landscape untouched by man or time. The experience isn’t about spotting and photographing an elephant. It’s about watching a herd interact as you take breakfast in the bush. It’s about snoozing on your balcony as zebras splash gleefully in the lake below, or hearing two lions roar then spotting the lioness they’re fighting over. Each visitor to the Greater Kruger will be treated to different scenes and that’s why this is unlikely to be your last safari. After a first-time adventure, you’ll already be planning when to return, when to continue the journey through an untamed land.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The Sabi Sands Airstrip provides a convenient departure from the wilderness. Two daily flights depart for O. R. Tambo International in Johannesburg, and you’ll enjoy full use of the lodge’s facilities before the departure. For the airstrip transfer, a final game drive leads you through the bush, dropping you beside the runway as elephants and buffalos disappear slowly into the distance.

tourName: Private South Africa Photography Tour
placesVisited: Cape Town, Sabi Sands Game Reserve, Saint Lucia
generalInfo: South Africa cannot be defined in a single image. A country with 11 official languages and thousands of iconic settings, the landscape of South Africa evokes the drama of nature and the diversity of cultures. This 13-day photographers' tour will explore its many angles and you will need to bring all of your lenses as grand aerial photography is mixed with fascinating portraits and no shortage of giant mammals. From Cape Town to Kruger to the Indian Ocean, this is a journey through both the famous sights and unknown faces.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Arrival in South Africa
dayInfo.description: Your arrival into Cape Town will be striking as you see the mountain hanging dramatically over the city and the Atlantic Ocean waves tumbling onto the coast. You will immediately sense how it is shaped by nature and roll to a rhythm unlike any other city. After being greeted at the airport, you will be transferred to the coast where your hotel in Camps Bay will provide two of the iconic photos of Cape Town. Behind you will be the mountain, and then stretching out below will be the white sand and tropical colors of the ocean. A wide variety of restaurants are within walking distance, and all gaze out at the sunset. Relax, savor the ambiance, and settle into South Africa.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Dramatic Cape Peninsula Aerials
dayInfo.description: A series of rugged peaks stand majestic on Africa's tip, rising vertically above the crashing waves and hidden coves of the coast. The landscape will not seem real and may feel like one that has been automatically enhanced with photo editing. Exploring its true grandeur is best from the air, so you will take off in the morning on a private helicopter tour. The sun will be coming up from the east to illuminate Table Mountain and the City Bowl. You will cruise south, the sun mostly behind you as you soar inland to False Bay, where Indian Ocean colors glisten in the distance. Continue south, and then down the Cape Peninsula for a bird's eye view of Cape Point and the lighthouses that mark the end of the continent. Fly back to Cape Town along the Atlantic coastline, photographing the jagged peaks before swooping around the city. It's a 50-minute journey, and you can easily fill an entire memory card. Many of Cape Town's most inspiring images come from the helicopter, with the ocean below and the city draped beneath the mountains. The rest of the day is free, and you may wish to enjoy another aerial by taking the cable car to the summit of Table Mountain.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Urban Portraits of South Africa
dayInfo.description: South Africa has 11 official languages and thousands of different faces to reflect the essence of the Rainbow Nation. Almost everyone is doused in color, from redolent eyes to floral skirts, to elders beneath Panama hats to children standing outside vibrantly-painted metal shacks. To capture the urban portraits, you will need to journey into the heart of the urban landscape with a visit to the Khayelitsha township. Your stay will be led by community leaders you will have no challenges in finding a subject, especially when the camera is anywhere near children. Your guide will arrange for specific portrait sessions with a wide cast of the locals, giving you intimate access to the lifestyles of the township. Although the area is known as a slum, you will find a lively and enthusiastic place and only remember the smiles and energy. Every shack is painted a different color, a ramshackle assortment that looks great on camera. Each church or shop is unlike any you may have seen before and radiates a primitive, yet endearing, charm. You will find the houses to be surprisingly well appointed on the inside, and your guide will arrange access to different homes. Your aim will be to photograph the often undocumented side to South Africa, the setting itself telling a poignant tale and the faces providing an inspiring subject.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Capturing Cape Town's Historical Narrative
dayInfo.description: The history of South Africa is powerful and poignant, and while not always a pleasant tale, the people and the terrain tell a story that should be told. This morning you will visit Bo-Kaap, the early light ideal for capturing the colorful terraced houses of the former slave quarter. The people of the community seem to dance for the camera with all of the contrasting hues juxtaposed. In the mid-morning, you will take a boat out to Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was incarcerated for 18 years. A former inmate will guide you around, and you can photograph the inside of the prison, including the tiny cell Mandela once lived. Once you have seen it all, you will return to the city for any afternoon at your leisure to relax and unwind.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Free Day in the Mother City
dayInfo.description: Cape Town has an embarrassment of riches found in the city, and you could spend weeks here without seeing everything. The day is deliberately left free so you that can follow the angles that you find most intriguing. A private driver-guide is made available, and you will have various options. Drive along Cape Point and inspect the wild penguins of Boulders Beach, or head inland to explore the vineyards of the Cape Winelands. You could also travel along the back of Table Mountain to find botanical gardens and more vineyards, or you could cruise north and within one hour find yourself in the dunes and the desert.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve – Introductions to the Big Five
dayInfo.description: Sabi Sands Game Reserve shares a border with Kruger National Park and is packed with evocative scenes. Rhinos march around and then bashfully hide amongst the bushes while elephants roam past the lodges, occasionally drinking from the plunge pools. The eyes of a leopard eyes will light up the dark forests to create a photo that could grace any magazine. Life congregates around the permanent water sources, and you will never have to venture far to see it all, from a zebra drinking to lions prowling for a meal. For a Big Five safari, this region is one of the best destinations in all of Africa. The area is made even more accessible thanks to direct flights from Cape Town, and you will land with plenty of time for an afternoon game drive. As you do with all wildlife photography, you will need patience. But luckily, you will not be spending a full day seeking out one revered shot. Life abounds and your game drives will bring up all manner of surprises and enchanting scenes, from cheetahs on the move to predatory jaws snapping around a zebra carcass. Over these three nights, you will stay at a luxury lodge standing over the river with your camera quick at hand as there are some remarkable animals wandering past throughout the day and night.

dayInfo.title: Sabi Sands Game Reserve – Wildlife Photography in a Luxurious Greater Kruger Reserve
dayInfo.description: This South Africa tour is tailored towards those seeking to capture all sides of the country, so three days of safari are in the middle to ensure that the incredible wildlife is part of the picture. Other photography tours may spend two weeks in remote parks, patiently documenting the revered scenes. The Sabi Sands is compact, making it an excellent place for a short wildlife photography safari. You will not need to spend hours on the move to seek out the animals as so much of the wildlife comes to you, roaming past the lodge or gracing the savannah that stretches down below. Within a single game drive, you could be photographing lions hunting, elephants bathing in the river, hippos quarreling, and a mystical array of different antelopes. Morning drives leave at dawn as the landscape is most active, and the light will help you to produce some astonishing images. Return to the lodge mid-morning for a second breakfast and a few relaxed hours enjoying the luxury. Head out again at 3 pm for a game drive that will continue until the last light has disappeared from the sky. Your guide will have a good understanding of wildlife photography and will aim to provide the best angles, giving you more time at each scene than on a typical game drive. Rather than rushing on to tick off every angle, your focus will be on finding a beautiful safari scene and taking your time to photograph it. With the full Big Give in residence, you can expect some dramatic wildlife shots.

dayInfo.title: Saint Lucia – Crossing the Remarkable Kingdom of Swaziland
dayInfo.description: Swaziland reflects the old-Africa of your imagination as circular huts dot verdant hillsides, standing like sentinels amongst roads of red earth. Women carry almost everything on their heads, from baskets of bananas to vibrant clothes bound for the market. Traditional headdresses and tribal outfits continue to be worn, especially as you enter the villages. The landscapes are incredible with the rolling hills uninterrupted by modernity. It takes six hours to drive from the Sabi Sands to Saint Lucia across Swaziland, and the overland journey offers you an entirely different perspective on the continent. This is traditional Africa, and your guide will stop in villages and valleys that reflect your dreamy preconceptions. Leave early, and you will come over the border and Piggs Peak for great landscape photos, and then have plenty of time to explore Swaziland at leisure before departing from the south and driving along the Indian Ocean coastline to Saint Lucia.

dayInfo.title: Saint Lucia – Relaxing on the Indian Ocean
dayInfo.description: Exotic colors will provide the postcard image in Saint Lucia with the white sand flanked by the turquoise waters of the Indian Ocean. Monkeys roam through the trees, and you are never far from the antics of the wild hippos. Saint Lucia is a luxurious coastal enclave surrounded by the UNESCO World Heritage iSimangaliso, a huge stretch of protected wetlands. You will enjoy the perfect soft sand, but also the unusual sight of wildlife roaming across the beach. After a few busy days, the day is purposely left free for a chance to settle into the coastal atmosphere and get used to some very bright conditions.

dayInfo.title: Saint Lucia – Boat Trips in the iSimangaliso Wetlands
dayInfo.description: A hippo will grunt from the sapphire lagoon, poking its head from the water as you cruise past in a boat. The rest of the pod is up ahead, and if you stay patient, you will get the iconic photo of a hippo yawning with its humongous jaw stretching almost horizontally. Trumpeting down the waterways are elephants, with babies playing gleefully and old tusked bulls sending jets of water through the air. Birdlife is prolific here, and you cannot go 100 meters without catching site of another unusual species. The iSimangaliso Wetlands are a wonderful expression of nature's exotic colors, and the four-legged giants provide a stunning focal point. In the morning, you will go on a canoe safari where the silent method of travel will enable you to get very close to the wildlife. In the afternoon, you will travel by motorboat to cover a greater distance and capture the lagoons as they are painted golden by the sunset.

dayInfo.title: Saint Lucia – Day Trip to Africa's Oldest Game Reserve
dayInfo.description: For over a century, Hluhluwe-iMfolozi has been a protected reserve, and you can immediately sense its old-world allure. The savannah feels untouched and untamed, scarred by the skeletons of zebras killed by lions and dominated by the movements of wild white rhinos and elephants. Whereas Sabi Sands was all about getting you close to the individual animals, a safari in Hluhluwe-iMfolozi is about photographing the panoramic scenes. So much seems to fit into your viewfinder, and your photos can showcase how everything is interacting and communicating in the bush. It will not just be a herd of springbok as it is also a monkey troop shouting to the springbok to warn them of a lioness hiding in the grass, which in turn will send a herd of kudu galloping onwards. Like an ancient Eden, this park provides a fitting conclusion to your South African photography tour as it pulls together the wildlife and the landscapes to reveal just how raw and untouched the country can be. The park is only a short drive from Saint Lucia, and you will return to your beach hideaway after the safari.

dayInfo.title: Saint Lucia – Departure
dayInfo.description: Richards Bay Airport is a one hour transfer from Saint Lucia, a journey that will take you along the coast for some last shots of the Indian Ocean. Depart for the O. R. Tambo International in Johannesburg where your intercontinental departure will take you away from South Africa with thousands of images that will reflect the diversity of the Rainbow Nation.

tourName: Remarkable African Honeymoon Safari and Island Paradise
placesVisited: Victoria Falls, Cape Town, Sabi Sands Private Game Reserve, Kruger National Park, Mahe
generalInfo: The majesty of African wildlife, coastal splendor, and powerful cascades will enchant you on this 14-day luxury honeymoon of Zimbabwe, South Africa, and Seychelles. Experience the romance of a secluded safari lodge and embrace the powdery white sands of a tropical island. Snorkel in crystal-clear water, sample delicious wines, and discover the romance at Victoria Falls, Sabi Sands Game Reserve, and Mahe island.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Arrive at Victoria Falls
dayInfo.description: The wonders of the landscape will blend with the majesty of the wildlife at Victoria Falls. As one of the world’s natural spectacles, panoramas from the top of the gorge reveal curtains of water that pour into the Lower Zambezi amidst the sound of endless thunder from the crashing cascades. Your flight will land at Victoria Falls Airport, where your private transfer will greet you upon arrival. After settling into your luxury lodge, you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure. You can sip a drink while overlooking a watering hole known for attracting zebras and giraffes.

dayInfo.title: Victoria Falls - Enjoy a Walking Tour of the Falls
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will lead you to the stunning trails that offer different viewpoints of Victoria Falls. A panoramic view encompasses the cascade that sweeps over a half-mile long and causes mist to rise to a height of 1,312 feet. At the edge of the precipice sits Livingstone Island and the natural pond known as the Devil’s Pool. The plunge-pool offers remarkable views of the water as it drops over 328 feet. At the Victoria Falls Bridge, you will have a dramatic view of the falls, and adventure-seekers can dive over the bridge on a certified bungee jump.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Transfer to Cape Town
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your private transfer will transfer you to the airport for your flight to Cape Town. After enjoying time to settle in to your hotel, the remainder of the day will be yours to experience the vibrant ambiance of the city between the foothills of Table Mountain and the Atlantic Ocean. You can indulge in the exclusivity of your accommodations or venture out into the city to stroll along the V&A Waterfront, which is a historic 19th-century harbor that now brims with activity around the shops, restaurants, bars, and passing fishing boats, creating a romantic ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Explore Cape Town and Robben Island
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you in the lobby after breakfast eager to introduce you to the beauty and vibrancy of Cape Town. You will explore the historical and cultural sites across the city, including an excursion to the infamous Robben Island. The prison dates back to the 17th century and now acts as a memorial to those who were once incarcerated, including Nelson Mandela. The wind will sweep across the tufts of grass, carrying the scent of the sea. The lime quarry will glint in the sun while a little stone house reflects the conditions of solitary confinement.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Discover Cape Point and the Peninsula
dayInfo.description: Your guide will meet you after breakfast and lead you along the coast tour of the peninsula that leads to Cape Point. You will follow the scenic coastal drive of Chapman’s Peak, where the road has 114 curves and offers dramatic panoramic views of rugged cliffs and shimmering Atlantic waters. When you reach the Cape, you will find a protected coastline where Cape Mountain zebras graze on the windswept grasses. Here, baboons also forage for fruits and insects around the bush. The water will crash against the rocks as you find the secluded point at which warm Mozambique and cold Benguela currents converge.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Bask in the Cape Winelands
dayInfo.description: The colonial settlements of Franschhoek and Stellenbosch provide oceans of vineyards that lead to the rising foothills of the surrounding mountainscapes. In Stellenbosch, the aromas of grilling steaks and charred vegetables will fill the streets before you reach charming and opulent estates with a mix of Dutch, Georgian, and Victorian architecture. When wine tasting, you will find the fantastic aromas of Pinotage that denote hints of tropical smoke and brambles. The 300-year-old history of winegrowing in Franschhoek will highlight French heritage, celebrated gastronomy, and famous wineries. Here, you can sample Sauvignon Blanc with hints of lemon and tropical fruits.

dayInfo.title: Kruger National Park - Travel to Kruger National Park
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will fly to Skukuza Airport in Kruger National Park. Your private transfer will greet you at the airfield and escort you to a gorgeous lodge inside the world-famous Sabi Sands Game Reserve, which helps form a portion of Kruger National Park’s 7,523 square miles of protected landscape. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to bask in the secluded luxuries and romantic ambiance of your lodge. Here, you can enjoy a view over the winding river and its lush banks that are known for attracting gazelles and thirsty buffalo.

dayInfo.title: Kruger National Park - Delight in the Tinyeleti Treehouse Experience
dayInfo.description: Your morning game drive will begin before sunrise. Your guide will lead you through the vibrant landscape in search of the wildlife that is active before the midday heat settles over the scenic mixture of grassland, woodlands, and marshy banks. The dense population of Big Cats brings the exhilarating opportunity for viewing lions and leopards in their natural habitat. In the evening, you will spend the night in a luxury treehouse with a panorama across the Sabie River. You may be able to hear hyenas prowling around the grasses and the quiet steps of a hunting leopard.

dayInfo.title: Kruger National Park - Revel in Fantastic Game Drives
dayInfo.description: You will experience the joys of game drives once more in the morning and evening. Your drives will be guided by a ranger who is skilled in spotting resting wildlife and signs of rare animals. In the late afternoon, you will set out on a second game drive as the wildlife once again becomes active due to the waning heat. As you explore the wilderness, you can spot the wide frame of a white rhino as it strolls through the grass. A male can grow 13 feet from head to tail and reach 5,100 pounds.

dayInfo.title: Mahe - Arrive in Seychelles
dayInfo.description: The charms of your honeymoon will continue when you travel from Kruger Mpumalanga Airport to Johannesburg International for your flight bound for Mahe and Seychelles International Airport. As the flight lands, you will notice the lavish blues and greens that emanate from the lush landscape and clear water of the Indian Ocean. Your private transfer will escort you to an exclusive seaside resort where you can indulge in the tropical comforts of your passionate getaway. The aroma of the sea will fade beneath the scents of coconut and pineapple as you discover the resort’s soothing charms and the island’s serene atmosphere.

dayInfo.title: Mahe - Indulge in Seychelles at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: This morning, you will wake up to the sounds of a tropical paradise in your resort within over 296 acres of rare and luxuriant vegetation. You can board a catamaran bound for Mahe Reef. You will dive into the warm water and enjoy the vibrant marine life on a snorkeling excursion to discover radiant angelfish that swim near rugged outcroppings of granite and preserved coral. The seabed will undulate with sections of branch coral and give way to beds of seagrass where Hawksbill turtles glide through the water. You will also have a view of Victoria as you sail to the resort.

dayInfo.title: Mahe - Relax in the Charms of Seychelles
dayInfo.description: You can delight in a day of action at Morne Seychelles National Park to explore the impressive combination of coastal mangrove forests and lush woodlands that lead to the peak of Morne Seychelles at 2,969 feet. Walking trails wind into the dense jungle, which makes civilization feel worlds away. You will pass ruins of antique cinnamon distilleries and reach the breathtaking view from the mountain summit. The panorama includes lush jungle canopy and opens to the expansive turquoise water. In the evening, you can embrace the romance of the island with dinner on the sands underneath the majestic starlight.

dayInfo.title: Mahe - Discover Seychelles at your Pace
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, the day will be yours to bask in the beauty of the tropical island and the passion of your honeymoon escape. You can wander through the famous Sir Selwyn Selwyn-Clarke Market to find colorful fruit and vegetables alongside aromatic spices and an astonishing variety of fresh seafood. You can also make your way to powdery white sands that lead into the crystalline of the Indian Ocean at Beau Vallon Beach. The fringing palm trees cast shade over the coastline, and the waves offer a soothing lull in the afternoon air.

dayInfo.title: Mahe - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: The doors of the Kaz Zanana gallery will open in the morning. The 1915 wooden Creole structure remains part of the island heritage and features works that belong to Seychelle’s most-notable painter. The aromas of freshly brewed vanilla tea will fill the hotel dining room at breakfast and be accompanied by the scent of coconut. Your private transfer will meet you at the hotel and escort you to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Romantic South Africa Adventure
placesVisited: Johannesburg, Umhlanga, Port Elizabeth, Amakhala Game Reserve, Cape Town
generalInfo: Capture the romantic side of South Africa’s most breathtaking landscapes, culturally-rich destinations, and wildlife havens on this 14-day romantic South Africa adventure. Let your mind wander as you sip a sundowner on safari and embrace the melody of vibrant African bartering at Durban’s Victoria Market. Watch with amazement as dolphins frolic in slight waves and penguins waddle on sandy walkways at Boulders Beach.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg - City of Gold
dayInfo.description: Feel the warmth of the South African people from the moment you arrive. Johannesburg, known as the “City of Gold”, shines a bright light of hospitality as your driver greets you with a smile and drives you along bustling highways and through tree-lined neighborhoods to your boutique hotel. If time permits, you may have time to explore the vibrant Sandton Square, the enormous statue of Nelson Mandela noted as a key focal point, or choose to sink your teeth into traditional meats and vegetables at the Moyo interactive restaurant. With boutique hotels set in lush and tranquil gardens, perhaps pamper yourself with a spa treatment or simply an afternoon tea in your luxury surroundings.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg - A Cultural Day Out In Newtown Precinct
dayInfo.description: Discover the rich culture of one of South Africa’s influential cities with a visit to the popular and prominent Newtown Precinct. This neighborhood runs from city railway lines to the busy M2 highway, a network of red-brick buildings buzzing with influencers and industry. Step inside the magnificent Museum Africa, a captivating collection of African artifacts and intriguing rock art highlighting silhouettes of wildlife etched in white or red against a dusty gray surface. Stop for a bite at one of the informal sidestreet restaurants and treat yourself to unique flavors with the combination of sticky pap (maize porridge) and spicy stew.

dayInfo.title: Umhlanga - City Sights to Coastal KwaZulu-Natal
dayInfo.description: Pace yourself with a leisurely breakfast before bidding your leafy suburban oasis farewell and flying south to the coastal gem of Umhlanga, recognized by its prominent white-walled and red-roofed lighthouse that stands out against the golden-brown beach sand. Swap walking shoes for sandals and take a stroll along the winding patchwork of stone that makes up the Umhlanga promenade. This evening, let the fresh breeze off the Indian Ocean ease you into the night as you consider indulging in the aromatic masala flavors of a traditional Durban Indian curry.

dayInfo.title: Umhlanga - A Morning Discovering Durban Delights
dayInfo.description: Discover the diversity of Durban as you travel south toward its city center. Durban challenges visitors to embrace their wild side by climbing 550 steps over the skyline-dominating Moses Mabhida Stadium for a bird’s-eye view across suburbs and sea. A city that invites you to sit in a rickshaw and let your guide, clad in traditional Zulu attire, take you along the Golden Mile, the up-and-down motion of the colorful cart rivaling the adjacent white-crested waves of the Indian Ocean. Slow things down a little with a walk through the Victoria Market, the peppery and floral aromas of Indian spices and the allure of vibrant fabrics greeting you at the entrance.

dayInfo.title: Umhlanga - A Valley of 1000 Hills
dayInfo.description: Move away from the blue waves of the Indian Ocean and travel inland towards the contrasting green waves that form the breathtaking Valley of 1000 Hills, cascading mounds that seem never-ending as they roll towards the mighty Umgeni River. Stare over mini-peaks, tree-filled valleys, and the odd red-brick building as you stop to catch your breath. Embrace the warm welcome of the local community at nearby PheZulu Village as you explore the roots of Zulu culture and ancient traditions. Sit in thatch-walled circular huts, the smell of the dust emerging among aromas of corn rising from freshly-made bread known as ujeqe , the local “medicine man” throwing bones to reveal your future.

dayInfo.title: Port Elizabeth - Fly from KwaZulu Natal to the Eastern Cape
dayInfo.description: Enjoy a leisurely breakfast and a gentle check out before your transfer to the airport, where a short flight along the coastline will bring you to the “Friendly City”, Port Elizabeth. Known for its golden beaches, bustling boardwalk, and the Campanile, Port Elizabeth is a city of heritage discovery and a gateway to the Eastern Cape’s safari scene. If you have time, take a walk to the historic Donkin Reserve. The redstone pyramid stands as a strong reminder of the resilience and strength it took to construct one of South Africa’s oldest cities. If you climb to the top of the adjacent lighthouse, views over the colorful gardens and picturesque lily ponds at Happy Valley are your reward.

dayInfo.title: Amakhala Game Reserve - A Boat Adventure to St Croix Island
dayInfo.description: An early start as you board your whale, dolphin, and penguin island cruise. Feel the breeze of the morning air brushing your cheeks as you travel out into the mild waters off the Sunshine Coast, your eyes peeled for majestic whales, their sheer size a feast for the eyes, and magnificent dolphins leaping into the air. Notice the blur of black and white as you approach the busy penguin colony of St Croix Island, the air turning from coastal freshness to that which reflects marine life, the bustling bodies bobbing to and fro as they scuttle for their spot on the beach. Bid the coast farewell this afternoon as you head into the wilderness for your next adventure.

dayInfo.title: Amakhala Game Reserve - A Day of Safari Adventure
dayInfo.description: Your wake-up call will have you up before the sun, the reserve starting to come alive with wildlife patiently awaiting your presence. Embrace the stillness of the dusty open plains as the chill of the fresh morning air swirls around you, your eyes adjusting to the light of day and on the lookout for creatures big and small. Lap up the quiet vibes of your peaceful surroundings, the cackle of a helmeted guineafowl or the crunch of fallen branches beneath an elephant’s foot pricking your ears. After an afternoon rest, you can set out before sunset for the chance to encounter a tower of giraffe slowly crossing in front of you or a pride of tawny-colored lions lazing on the last warm patch of road. Back at your lodge, indulge in a night of pure romance with a private dining experience accompanied by candlelight and the sounds of the African bush.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - A Wild Morning and A Cosmopolitan Afternoon
dayInfo.description: One last glance across your wild surroundings and it's time to find your city legs as you head south on a short flight to Cape Town. The “Mother City” presents a blend of mountains, ocean, and skylines, with hues of green, brown, and blue merging to create an exceptionally scenic city. The popular V&A Waterfront is a hub of shopping, dining, and entertainment. Visit colorful stalls, watch African dancers perform, or head out on a sunset cruise. Experience Cape Town’s suburban night scene with a mix of intimate and interactive dining experiences, or sip cocktails in a funky beach bar in Camps Bay, mellow tunes playing in the background. See where your mood takes you.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - City, Mountain, and Historical Island Adventure
dayInfo.description: Cape Town’s most iconic site is the magnificent Table Mountain, a dramatic rocky backdrop overlooking the “Mother City”, home to floral beauty and presenting commanding views from every angle. As you climb the strong, steel cable towards the sky, notice the winding hiking trails that wrap around the mountain, an alternate way of getting up or down. Gaze out over the crisp, blue Atlantic and over the plains of the Cape Flats. In the distance, you can see Robben Island, a significant location where fascinating stories of its most famous resident, Nelson Mandela, are regaled during your visit. The ferry ride back to Cape Town provides the perfect time to reflect on the knowledge and adventure absorbed today.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Discover the Cape Peninsula and Playful Penguins
dayInfo.description: Journey along the picturesque Cape Peninsula today, the drive along winding Chapman’s Peak unveiling a more breathtaking view than the one before. Absorb the contrast of giant boulders on one side and the glistening Atlantic Ocean on the other, long beaches of white sand and cottage-style towns and villages adding to the scenery. Stand at Cape Point, the wind gently brushing against your face as you stand tall at the end of the African continent. Listen as the wooden slats beneath your feet click and clack as you walk over the sandy shores of Boulders Beach, noticing the honking and chirping sounds of penguins. Watch as they glide into the shallow waters of the Atlantic and waddle back out with zest.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - Savor the Wonderful Cape Winelands
dayInfo.description: Head to the picturesque Cape Winelands today, classic vineyards creating a dramatic background against historic and quaint towns and villages. Sip crisp chenin blancs, flavors of honey dancing on your tongue, floral notes rising from your glass. Let the blackcurrant notes and smokey nose of South Africa’s signature variety, pinotage, tantalize your taste buds and awaken your sense of smell. Feel the cool interior of cozy wine cellars and indulge in delicious bites of boerewors (South African sausage), the rich flavor complimenting your glass of deep-hued cab sav, or a charcuterie board bursting with color and flavors.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - A Day at Leisure in the Mother City
dayInfo.description: Cape Town is teeming with adventure. Take a romantic stroll along the Sea Point promenade, sounds of the sea and smells of marine life heightening the senses, or stop at a bustling cafe in Green Point for a creamy, flat-white coffee. Spend time at the V&A Waterfront, taking in the merriment and sounds of steel drums, rich voices offering a seemingly private concert just for you. Sample the flavors of Cape Malay cuisine, spicy and fruity aromas wafting through the streets of the Bo-Kaap, or watch the sunset over the Atlantic Ocean from Signal Hill as your romantic African adventure comes to a close.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town - A Farewell to Africa
dayInfo.description: If time permits, pay one last visit to key locations such as the V&A Waterfront, wander the alleyways of the Cape Quarter, or sit a while along the active Sea Point waterfront. You may have time for a picnic in the blossoming Kirstenbosch Gardens. Then say goodbye to South Africa as you catch a glimpse of Table Mountain in the rear-view mirror as you transfer to the Cape Town Airport.

tourName: Safari, Wine & Romance Tour of South Africa
placesVisited: Cape Town, Stellenbosch, Franschhoek, Hermanus, Thanda Private Game Reserve
generalInfo: The delights of Big Five safari, the sensual reverie of vineyards, the seductive charms of secluded South Africa; this itinerary is coated in romance and handcrafted for couples seeking to indulge in South Africa's wonders. Think champagne whale-watching safaris, heated pools surrounded by elephants, quaint stone cottages amidst the vines, and helicopter trips above Table Mountain. This romantic African safari tour is teeming with intimacy and explores world wonders at a delightfully unhurried pace.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Warm Welcome to South Africa
dayInfo.description: The romance starts immediately. Your hotel has dazzling views onto Table Mountain and a spa treatment is included with the room. Lie down, adore the vista, and allow any travel fatigue to be eased by a talented masseuse. The rest of the day is free but be sure to savor the remarkable sunset views over the Atlantic, another treat at this five-star boutique hotel.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Stunning Helicopter Flight Over Table Mountain and Cape Point
dayInfo.description: The southwestern corner of Africa revels in its natural mystique. Mountains vertically rise and then snake along the ocean, beaches mingle with canopies of green, and the cityscape nestles alongside nature. There's only one way to truly appreciate its beauty: from the air. Climb aboard a helicopter and take a private ride down this enchanting corner of the continent. You soar above the city and ocean, cruise alongside the mountain chain, loop around the corner of Africa, and then return to Cape Town via vineyards and forests tucked into the creases of Table Mountain. It's a two hour flight that unveils the nuanced natural design of one of the world's most remarkable landscapes. Your hotel features its own helipad so there are no road transfers. Just take the elevator and savor a scenic flight of unrivaled beauty. The rest of today is left free for you to continue the shared Cape Town exploration.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Romantic Treats in Cape Town
dayInfo.description: Cape Town's streets dazzle with a patchwork of color; markets come in rainbow hues, sloped cobblestone streets reveal intriguing pastel shades, and historic monuments juxtapose with the dramatic mountain backdrop. Today is free to explore but a few little romantic treats have been included in the itinerary. A table for two will be booked at one of Cape Town's world-renowned restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Winelands – The Vineyards of Stellenbosch
dayInfo.description: South Africa is indelibly serene and unhurried. Cape Town pulls you into its calm rhythm and the Cape Winelands relax you further. Over 500 wineries create a blanket of vines that slope around the towns of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek. This whole region exudes the grandeur of yesteryear, the old world charm pouring out of whitewashed stone cottages, elegant country retreats, and wine estates set in acres of greenery. Check in to your luxurious villa suite in the Winelands, and check out the four-poster bed and serene views across the estate. Known for being the Winelands's most elite choice for couples seeking exclusivity and opulence, this will be home for the next three nights. Throughout these three days a skilled wine guide will create a custom itinerary. You dictate the interests and style, then allow your guide to transport you to renowned vineyards, cute farmhouses, lunch with cellar owners, and hidden gems that only the locals know about. Stellenbosch and Franschhoek are just 30 minutes apart but their wineries have distinct flavors. The former is more well known and celebrated, home to renowned exporters and innovative newcomers. It's the perfect place to start your South African wine journey. Most of the major grapes are grown here, although Cabernet and Pinotage are particularly world -famous. Famed Italian and French investors have developed wine farms here adding further sensual treats to the diversity on offer and keeping your palate continually entertained.

dayInfo.title: Winelands – Exploring the Charm and Wineries of Franschhoek
dayInfo.description: Tucked between towering mountains and gracefully accepting its mantle as South Africa's culinary heartland, Franschhoek is a destination for languid mornings and leisurely breakfasts. Gaze out across the green country estate and then meet your guide for a second day of vineyard exploration. Franschhoek's charming wineries are smaller and more boutique than those in its more illustrious neighbor. This is a wine destination for discerning palates and experienced connoisseur, a place for meeting the cellar owners and sharing glasses on delightful country estates. Using intimate local knowledge, your guide will craft an itinerary that combines sensual wine treats and the area's most celebrated restaurants. Then enjoy a leisurely evening in the soaring luxury of the country house.

dayInfo.title: Winelands – More Spa Treatments and Wine Tasting in the Cape Vineyards
dayInfo.description: Lavish spa treatments start your day in a regal style, the soothing ambiance enough to lull any couple but don't fall asleep just yet. This third day of wine tasting can focus on exquisite tastes, your guide handcrafting an itinerary of small vineyards that only the locals know about. Once again it's unhurried and relaxed. There's no schedule to follow and your guide knows when to leave you alone and wait in the car. So indulge the palate, share romantic moments, and savor the elegance of an undisturbed part of South Africa. Franschhoek is one of the continent's oldest settlements and there's plenty of impressions of 19th-century grandeur.

dayInfo.title: Hermanus – Romantic Whale-Watching Safari
dayInfo.description: Follow the valley through the mountains and the green landscapes roll down onto the Indian Ocean. Your next two days are spent on the coast in comfort in accommodation perched on rugged cliffs with glorious views across the bay. Whales are visible from the private verandah of your Bay View Suite, humpbacks, and Southern rights whales coasting through these waters on their migratory routes. But you're getting much closer than that. The champagne is packed and you sail out onto the calm waters, an experienced skipper tracking whale movements and delivering unforgettable moments with nature's largest mammals. Humpbacks crash their fins down onto the waves, 15 meter Southern right whales breach the waves just meters away, and there are few better places to raise a glass to romance and unique vacations. The three-hour boat safari is completely private with departure time decided closer to the date.

dayInfo.title: Hermanus – Thrilling Great White Shark Encounters in Gansbaai
dayInfo.description: Open the curtains and there is a good chance of spotting whales from the balcony. So today is a good morning to sleep in and enjoy a long morning breakfast served to you on your balcony. Whales are effortlessly charming, but today's marine experience is anything but. This afternoon brings thrills and drama. Jump into the water as great white sharks swirl around the cage keeping you safe from their ferocious teeth. Shark cage diving in South Africa has a 100% safety record, but that doesn't stop the surge of adrenalin as a four meter marine beast swims past the cage. Few wildlife encounters are as exhilarating, the ocean's greatest predator just a couple of meters away. Note that it's possible to switch the great white shark encounter for a second whale watching safari in Hermanus.

dayInfo.title: Thanda Private Game Reserve – Honeymoon Suite and Big Five Safari
dayInfo.description: Over the last eight days you've explored an exquisite corner of South Africa, the destinations within close proximity, and each journey weaved beneath a mountain backdrop. On day nine you return to Cape Town and fly to Durban on the eastern coast of South Africa. A helicopter pilot is waiting to swoop you off and transfer you down the Indian Ocean coastline, the panoramas of beach and forest dazzling beneath the propellers. Your destination is Thanda Private Game Reserve, a regular winner of the World's Leading Luxury Hotel and a stunning safari destination for discerning couples. Spend four nights at a wonderfully spacious and private camp that provides wonderful solitude in the heart of remote African bushland. The interiors offer the luxury you would expect from a member of the world's leading hotels, while the canvas walls ensure that Africa's animal soundtrack leaves a continual impression. You don't open the windows to the wild. You simply pull back the walls and admire elephants and rhinos from the comfort of your bed. Paraffin lanterns provide additional charm and a large heated pool is perfect for watching renowned African sunsets. With two private game drives each day you'll have ample opportunity to see lion prides wandering along dusty tracks, their manes flowing and eyes ever alert for opportunity. Endangered rhinos display both grace and power, horns pointing skyward as they wander close by. Elephants play at the waterholes, giraffe tower above the trees, buffalo herds stare you down at clearings, and four days provide ample time to seek out the elusive resident leopards. Game drives are about adventure, but they're also wonderfully serene. Take the wine and enjoy private moments with glorious views over the wildlife action. Return from a drive and soak up a lavish spa treatment with views of zebra and various antelope species. Marvel at the exclusive seclusion on offer at Thanda; this is African safari at its most luxurious, yet the experience also bursts with intimacy and authenticity.

dayInfo.title: Durban – Farewell to South Africa
dayInfo.description: After 12 unforgettable days the South African vacation comes to end. City, safari, wine, and ocean encounters; it's been quite a journey, the kind of journey that will stay in the memory for decades to come. From Thanda you're transferred by road to King Shaka International Airport in Durban and your international departure.

tourName: Sensual Cape Winelands Tour on Horseback
placesVisited: Cape Town, Franschhoek, Stellenbosch, Paarl
generalInfo: Explore the Cape Winelands on horseback as you ride through the orchards and vines and connect the sensual beauty of this spectacular region with this 8-day sample itinerary. Canter to beautiful vineyards for an exclusive tasting, trot through surreal forests and gallop across the plains between enigmatic granite mountains. On horseback may be the most enchanting way to see the Winelands, a leisurely journey of views, vineyards, fine dining, and open landscapes. With five days of riding, you will not only observe by also become a part of this mystical region.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Touching Down in the Mother City
dayInfo.description: Table Mountain stands majestic with the vertical face seeming to rise out of the city with the towering summit standing over the frothy waves of the Atlantic Ocean. The mountain is the compass point, the landmark that will guide your exploration over the next two days. On the journey from the airport, you will see Table Mountain, but before exploring it, you will journey along its hidden back slopes where the vineyards spread out between the trees for a sensual welcome to the country. A platter of charcuterie will accompany a guided tasting to introduce you to the flavors of South Africa and its famous local Pinotage. The vineyards of Constantia are a perfect stop on route from the airport, and a great place to relax after your flight. Enjoy the dramatic views of the city and sit back as different wines are poured for your enjoyment. From here, your guides will take you along the mountain's base and into the city, to your hotel in Green Point. The 5-star Cape Royale enjoys incredible views over the ocean and is situated in an ideal position within the city. You are just a five-minute walk to the V & A Waterfront, where a series of fine dining seafood restaurants await your enjoyment. The surrounding streets feature some of Cape Town's most celebrated restaurants while the vibrant cafes of Bree Street are within a 15-minute walk. You will arrive at your hotel in the late afternoon, and the rest of your day is at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Table Mountain and the Colors of the City
dayInfo.description: Cape Town immerses your senses with too much to take in. Stand on the summit of Table Mountain and feel the shiver of the ocean air as it whizzes past your ears and then evaporates into the full blue sky. Smell the energy of Greenmarket Square and the central city, where African cultures come together in harmony. Feel the beating sun on the beaches of Camps Bay and Clifton, where white sand is sheltered from the wind. Colors excite the eyes in Bo-Kaap, where each house is painted a different tone. Harmonies greet you at the Waterfront, where marimba bands and choirs sing beside the harbor. Today, you will have a private driver-guide and the day can be planned to your interests. Taking the cable car up Table Mountain is usually a definite, and you will be able to see the Winelands glistening in the distance. History comes alive in museums such as the District Six, while the youthful energy of the country is wonderfully evoked with a trip to Khayelitsha. Spending your afternoon at the beach is an option, as is taking a helicopter or a boat tour. With a private guide, you can travel anywhere throughout the day. Towards Sunset, you will want to make your way to Signal Hill or Lion's Head, the two peaks to the side of Table Mountain for a romantic view of the city.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – An Enchanting Ride Across the Vineyards
dayInfo.description: You will have an hour's journey into the Cape Winelands and your next 5-star hotel, where you will check in before visiting the horses. Upon your arrival in the Winelands, you will immediately see why most visitors find it hard to leave. One glance is it all it takes to be captivated as the granite mountains offer a timeless backdrop to the folds of vineyards. Explore the paddock and choose your horse with the excellent knowledge of the guides helping you to select one that suits your style. All of the horses are responsive and like to move forward, with characters ranging from elegant, easy mares for beginners and wild stallions for the more experienced riders. The route and riding are suitable for all levels of riders, and this itinerary can be enjoyed by absolute beginners, although the riding over the first couple of days would be modified as skills develop. Take your horse along the base of the Simonsberg Mountain to get a feel for the old farm trails and the rugged paths found between the vines. You will take a short ride to a nearby vineyard, where you will taste the Pinotage that comes from the surrounding slopes. From here, there are options to go further across the mountain, although the focus of this first day is to get acquainted with your horse, the landscape, and the riding environment with far longer expeditions to come. Return to your hotel to enjoy sundowners before a seafood dinner paired with local wines.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – Through the Vineyards and Orchards of the Paarl Valley
dayInfo.description: Riding the Cape Winelands is like a journey from a past century. Trot through the vines and take in the aromas that drift on the morning's breeze. Canter across the mountain's dry slopes to pass whitewashed farmhouses to savor the views over the magnificent Paarl Valley. Stop in one of these farmhouses to inhale the musty smell before settling down to a tasting from one of the region's most revered cellar owners. From here, you will ride onwards and hone in on a wine estate that is draped across the mountain and evokes a sense of old-world grandeur. Stop for a languid a la carte lunch to rest your legs after your ride. Your journey will take you back to the valley floor, where there are many potential stops dependent on your tastes and energy levels. One that will not be missed is Neil Joubert, a vineyard that is not open to the public. You will enjoy a private tasting with the winemaker with another chance to get into the heart of the Winelands and its produce. Their Pinotage is special, but a whole host of grapes perform well here, notably the Shiraz and wooded Chenin Blanc. Return to your hotel late afternoon, and the rest of the day is at your leisure to be enjoyed.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – Mountain Trails and the Vineyards of the Franschhoek Valley
dayInfo.description: Now that you are very comfortable on your horse, it will be time for a longer expedition. Look forward to an exhilarating journey through peach and pear orchards and into the Franschhoek Valley. Take your horses beneath the massive apple trees, cross vineyards that seem to extend for eternity, and feel the enormity of the mountains that rise above. You will stop for a tasting at the internationally-acclaimed Backsberg, and then continue on a mountain trail through thick swaths of eucalyptus and pine forests. Setting off early in the morning will help you to maximize the cooler hours of the day, especially in the summer. You should return to your hotel just after your sumptuous lunch hosted by a celebrated wine farm. The Cape Winelands are made up from a series of valleys that center on the historical towns of Paarl, Stellenbosch, and Franschhoek. In the afternoon, you will have time to explore these towns, which are all just a 15-minute drive from each other. The valleys have subtly different tastes. Franschhoek's vineyards are few, and their focus is on quality, akin to what you would find in France's Burgundy region. Expect exquisite wines covering the Winelands' main grapes as you visit. The Stellenbosch Valley is packed with wine farms, hundreds of them spreading out beneath the mountains. They have contrasting styles, some following classical production techniques while others are very experimental. Paarl has a more unusual terroir and is where the lesser-cultivated grapes are found, the Malbec, Petit Verdot, Mourvedre, Grenache, and Viognier.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – Riding Through the Forests of the Simonsberg Mountains
dayInfo.description: Your ride today will be a break from the vineyards for a full-day journey into the forest of the Simonsberg Mountains. Take a picnic lunch with you, and it will not be long before the pull of the wilderness is felt. Your horses can explore in the forest, and you will have many opportunities to loosen the reigns and let them run. After the day’s exhilarating ride, you will be welcomed as you are every afternoon in the Winelands by the serenity of Angala, your luxury base. Tonight's dinner is a feast of local game meats cooked over the coals with a selection of springbok kudu, ostrich, and some beef fillets as well. Nestled beneath the mountains in the Franschhoek Valley, Angala is a seamless blend of modern luxury and expressive nature. You will feel as if you are a part of the Winelands as the vineyards cascade out below with the mountain peaks glowing as the sun crosses the sky. Your boutique hotel will feel more like a lavish country house, and a bit of a balm to your soul. While the Winelands are a base for a horse riding adventure, they are also a haven of utter serenity. So after a day in the saddle, there is nothing quite like sitting on the balcony to watch the sunset light up the valley. As you would expect, the hotel has an exceptional cellar to choose a bottle from, and you can settle in to relax as you’d like.

dayInfo.title: Stellenbosch – Enchanting Wine Estates of Stellenbosch
dayInfo.description: From a fast canter to a lazy meander, your final day in the saddle will move at your pace. Stellenbosch has the widest choice of trails and wine farms, so it is easy to tailor the route as you go to pass through orchards, vineyards, and along estate dams. Stellenbosch is comparable to the Bordeaux region, and the signature of many vineyards is a classic Bordeaux-style blend. Winemakers stick to traditions but are not afraid to let their flair take over, often with some spectacular results. The local guides are expert sommeliers and have an intimate knowledge of the area, so whether you want to follow the wooden Chardonnay trail or trace the origins of Pinotage, they will have you inspired.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Departure
dayInfo.description: Rest your legs this morning while you enjoy the views with your breakfast of salmon and champagne. After the bubbles, the day is at your leisure for a chance to fully relax and savor the tranquility that the Winelands can offer. Cape Town International Airport is just a short drive away, and you will be transferred in plenty of time for your departure flight after one last leisurely morning.

tourName: Signature Southern Africa: Cape Town Tour, Kruger Safari & Victoria Falls Itinerary
placesVisited: Cape Town, Sabi Sands, Kruger National Park, Thornybush Private Nature Reserve, Victoria Falls
generalInfo: Evocative and exclusive, this signature safari unravels the colors and charms of Southern Africa. Every day takes you on a journey through surprise and wonder: walking with rhinos, hidden vineyards, prowling lions, watching elephants from a private pool, a helicopter ride above Victoria Falls. With handpicked lodges and privately guided safari activities, it’s a 2-week adventure that blends the icons of a region, with the treats that only the insiders know about.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Lounging at the Waterfront or Sunset on Lion’s Head
dayInfo.description: Table Mountain stands majestic above the city of Cape Town, providing an inspiring introduction to Southern Africa.
